loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
La   Sra. María Elva  es soltera  tiene   cinco  hijos,  dos  en edad escolar y tres mayores de edad que viven todavía con ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, en forma ambulante, la misma le genera un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de sus hijos están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas, como remeras, buzos, pantalones, camperas.
texts.en:
Ms. María Elva is single and has five children, two of whom are of school age and three are adults who still live with her. She sells clothing on foot and this brings her a good income. With the help of her children, and with great sacrifice and dedication, they are all getting ahead. Today her small company is very successful and has many customers because of her good customer service. She has demonstrated herself to be a very honest and responsible person. She is asking for his loan in order to buy clothing, such as t-shirt, pants, sweaters, and jackets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley C. V., tiene la edad de 42 años, está casada, y vive con el esposo  y sus dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ropa para venderla. Desea tener un inventario más variado de prendas de vestir, para ampliar su negocio.  Además,  ofrecer un mayor inventario y adquirir prendas de mayor calidad para los clientes que posee. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio viendo la necesidad de aportar a la economía de su hogar. Es la  primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Shirley C. V., 42, is married and lives with her husband and two children who are 12 and 18 years of age. She will use the loan to buy clothing to sell. She wants to have a varied stock available in order to expand her business. In addition, she wants to offer a more varied stock of better quality items to her customers. She started the business several years ago as a way to augment family income. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms offered. She hopes in future to provide her family with a better quality of life and improved economic stability as well as to continue to grow both as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing sales.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 30 years old, married, and lives in the province of Antique in the Philippines with her husband and four young children (ages 3 to 8). To supply additional income for her family, Mary Grace is opening a prepared food stall (ready-to-eat) in her neighborhood.

Mary Grace would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory of ingredients for her business. Mary Grace believes in offering a varied menu in her stall for customers seeking convenient purchases. A new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Mary Grace is grateful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long term goals are to expand her business, fund the college education of her children, and support her family financially. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Tawopaneh-Iii Group

texts.en:
M’Balu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born thirty-two years ago in Makeni city, M’Balu is married and has four children.  For seven years now, M’Balu has been selling biscuits, cakes and firewood. M’Balu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business, buying firewood, biscuits, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

This is the first loan that M’Balu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy firewood, biscuits, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn M. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamis City. She is 32 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Merlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of products to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,995 PHP from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Robina Arif's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a resident of Siddiq Akbar town which is a housing colony located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and is well known for its textile industry. Her home is a small one containing two rooms. She shifted here 17 years ago with her family. Robina is a housewife and the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son wasn't interested in education and started work as a painter a few years ago. Her other children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

Robina's husband has a business which sells construction supplies. He offers construction supplies to customers and earns money for his family. He has been doing this work for the past 15 years. Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy construction supplies such as bricks, cement, sand, etc. to sell through his shop.  

Robina is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve through this investment in it. She is a new borrower from Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Evelyng Lissett

texts.es: Evelyng Lissett tiene 32 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ella vive en una zona que se encuentra algo alejada de la ciudad, por lo que ha sido muy difícil trasladar todos los productos que tiene que ofrecer en los diferentes lugares que recorre, pues va a los mercados, buses, entre otros. Por lo que desea adquirir una buena calidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes para niños. Evelyng es una mujer bastante activa y que gusta mucho de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Evelyng Lissett, 32, sells clothes.  She lives in an area that is quite distant from the city so it has been quite difficult to transport her wares to all the places she frequents to sell because she goes to markets, bus stops, etc.  She wants to acquire good quality products to have on stock for her customers.

She has therefore deemed it advisable to request a loan to buy underwear, pants, shirts, skirts and children’s outfits.

Evelyng is quite active and enjoys working in order to help her husband get ahead.

People who know her hold her in high esteem and consider her to be trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old. Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Grace is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Yadira Jamileth

texts.es:
Yadira Jamileth de 41 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 18 años estudiando la universidad y el menor de 10 añitos en 4to grado de primaria. Yadira labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como inspector ambiental desde hace 2 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa construyendo unas gradas en la parte trasera de la casa en là salida de la cocina y ademas desea pintar el frente de la casa para que ahora en navidad se le mire bonita.  

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Yadira Jamileth is 41 years old and single. She has 2 children; the older one, age 18, is studying at the university, and the younger, only 10 years old, is in 4th grade at primary school. Yadira has worked for the Municipality of Juigalpa as an environmental inspector for 2 years.  

She is requesting her first loan with the aim of improving her home, by constructing some steps at the back of her home at the kitchen door, and she would also like to paint the front of her house, so that it will look nice for Christmas. 

Her greatest dream is that her children will receive a university education and become successful people.

loans.use: Building steps and painting her home

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a retail shop. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Phoebe faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to become a mobile phone seller in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to start a mobile charging shop, purchase mobile chargers and electrical extensions. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: To  start a mobile charging shop, purchase mobile chargers and electrical extensions.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma O. is from the village of Katipunan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental 7209. She is 40 years old. Vilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Vilma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 17th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Angela Paola

texts.es:
Angela tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su madre en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical caracterizada por producir frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en la vivienda donde reside. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, brindándoles una buena atención, el negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por lo que Angela siempre se esfuerza por satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Adicionalmente ella complementa su negocio con la comercialización de prendas de vestir.

Angela desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y de esa manera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Angela es una joven bastante trabajadora y que gusta mucho de colaborar con los demás, los ingresos que percibe de su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Adicionalmente trabaja como profesora para un centro educativo impulsado por la municipalidad de su distrito que tiene como finalidad reforzar la educación que se les ofrece a los niños de su localidad.
texts.en:
Angela is 28 years old, single and lives with her mother in one of the hamlets that make up the district of Tambogrande, an area with semitropical climate, characterized by its fruits like mango, lemons, and passion fruit. It belongs to the Piura region and it is located some four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Angela sells basic household goods and groceries in a store in her home. She offers her customers different products for daily use, as well as the best care. The business is accepted very well because Angela always works hard to help meet the needs of her customers. In addition to groceries, Angela offers her customers a clothing selection as well.

Angela wishes to have more merchandize to expand her business so that she can meet the needs and demands of her customers, which is why she asked Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for their help of a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

Angela is a hardworking young woman who likes to work with others. The income that she receives from her business, she uses to help her family get ahead. In addition to her store, Angela also works as a teacher in an education center sponsored by the municipality of her district; its goal is to reinforce the education that is given to the children of the area.

loans.use: To get more merchandize to expand her business and in this way meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 24, is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last 4 years and employs one farmhand. Her main products are potatoes, tea, milk and vegetables, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her business selling charcoal to the local market.

She has requested a loan of 30,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood. She plans to expand her tea plantation in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Yudaya has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Yudaya has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Yudaya hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to go back to school.
Yudaya is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money, which will help her return to school.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She operates 2 businesses: hog raising and buying & selling dried fish. Her husband, Raul, who is 62 years old, works as a laborer. They have 10 children aged between 15 and 37 years old. 

Marina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500. She intends to use this to buy medicines and vaccines for pigs so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and the expansion of her business. Marina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.ru:
Sadagat H. zamujem i imeyet 2 detey . Sadagat yavlyayestay IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. 
Ona uje 3 qoda kak zanimayestay etim biznessom prodaji posudi. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye posudi dlya prodaji. Ona imeyet mnoqo pokupateley sredi svoix sosedey. Sadagat ranshe rabotala prodavshiccey v produktovom magazine.
texts.en: Sadagat H. is married and has 2 children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the city of Baku together with her beloved family.  Sadagat has been involved in the business of selling dishware for 3 years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy dishware for sale.  She has many customers among her neighbors.  Sadagat previously worked as a salesperson at a food market.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Madame HÉLÈNE T. est une femme de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 depuis 04 ans et demi. Elle a 09 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide et de l'élevage de porcs. Elle est très expérimentée dans ces activités pour les avoir menées depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'une part, d'acheter de l'arachide à transformer en huile et d'autre part acheter de pourceaux pour l'élevage

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants. Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs Hélène T. is a 40 year-old married mother of five. She has been a member of the Sainte Anne 2 credit association for four and a half years.  She has received 9 consecutive loans and has never failed to repay them. 

She produces peanut oil and rears pigs for a living, and has over 10 years' experience in these fields. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase more peanuts for producing oil, and will also help her to buy more pigs for rearing. 

Her aim is to be able to see to her family's needs, for example their food and her children's education. She would also like to put some money aside for savings.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and pigs for rearing

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Sylvia has a cosmetics shop that sells lotions for the skin, which she has had for five years.  She also has a beauty salon.  

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics, body lotions, and braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to become a popular business woman.  

Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more new games.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, body lotions, and braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La señora Rosario se dedica a la venta de antenas parabólicas ofreciéndolas casa por casa; esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para la ampliación de un anticrético ( anticrético es una figura legal por la cual el dueño de casa y el inquilino acuerdan que el inquilino vivirá en la casa por un tiempo determinado al termino del cual el dueño de casa devolverá el dinero recibido al comienzo del contrato). Rosario vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Agua de la Vida de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario is a sales representative who sells satellite dishes door-to-door. This job proves a source of income by which she is able to cover her expenses. This loan will be used to extend her “anticrético” contract (an “anticrético” is a legal agreement in which the landlord and tenant agree that the tenant will live in the house for a specified time, after which the landlord will return the money that was received at the start of the contract).

Rosario lives in a rental property in the District of Agua de La Vida in the city of La Paz. She is single and has no children. This is the first time she has received a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: To extend her "anticrético" rental contract.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 43 years old. She is married and has one child. Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase items like eggs, juice, and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years. She also earns an income from electronic recharging. Melanie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Heber de 28 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 02 hijos Magaly de 07 años y Natalie de 02 años de edad, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación para que tengan un mejor porvenir. Magaly y su pareja manifiestan que ambos tiene mucho proyectos por concretar, hace tres años que invirtieron sus ahorros para comprar toda clase de repuestos y lubricantes para todo tipo de vehículos. Es así que se dedica al negocio de estos productos, por lo que indican que le va muy bien y le es muy rentable. En ocasiones tiene mucho clientes por atender, es ahí donde su pareja la apoya, además que le enseña todo por cuanto debe atender y complacer a los clientes, puesto él tiene suficiente experiencia reparando vehículos. Le gusta su negocio, es que a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias no deja de lado a sus amistades es por ello que es muy querida por sus vecinos. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo económicamente y con el transcurso del tiempo es abrir otra sucursal de ventas en otros distritos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de repuestos y lubricantes para su tienda.
texts.en:
Magaly is a hard-working 28 year-old woman.  She lives in her own home together with her partner, 28 year-old Heber, and their two children: 7 year-old Magaly and 2 year-old Natalie.  She would like to provide a good education for her children so that they can enjoy a better future.

Magaly and her partner both have plans to carry out many projects.  Three years ago they invested their savings in buying all kinds of spare parts and lubricants for all types of vehicles.  Magaly works in her business selling these products.  She says that it is doing very well and is very profitable.  Sometimes she has a lot of customers to serve and so her partner supports her.  He also teaches her how she should serve and please their customers.  He has experience repairing vehicles.

Magaly enjoys her business.  In spite of making good profits, she doesn't neglect her friendships.  For this reason, she is very well liked by her neighbors.  Magaly has plans to continue growing financially and, over time, she would like to open another sales branch in another district.  This is Magaly's second loan from MFP.  She knows that she must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do this.  She is grateful to the institution for granting her the loan.  She will use the loan she is requesting to acquire more spare parts and lubricants for her store.

loans.use: to acquire more spare parts and lubricants

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath, age 37, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Sambath is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a mechanic, earning an income of $10 per day. 

The standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for her children’s administration fee to work in South Korea. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the children's administration fee to work in South Korea.

loans.name: Moussodjeton  2 Group

texts.fr:
MOUSSODJETON 2 est un regroupement  de femmes mariées du village de DJALAKORO,  de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et au moins 8 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel de BINTA, qui est  la deuxième debout à droite avec une écharpe verte, sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences de sésame et de fonio,  payer les frais de labours,  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 13000 à 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes  de la famille.
texts.en:
Moussodjeton 2 is a group of married women from the village of Djalakoro, part of San in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are on average 43 years old with at least eight children.

They grow peanuts, fonio (Western Africa cereal) and sesame. To make their farms profitable, the group members decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. After successfully repaying previous loans, they are on their third agricultural loan.

Binta, the second person from the right wearing a green scarf, will use her portion of the loan to buy sufficient quantities of fonio and sesame seeds, pay plowing costs, and buy small equipment and agricultural inputs at the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value gain value before being resold at the general market in SAN and in surrounding markets, retail (often in bulk), in cash to customers usually from large cities.

After selling their agricultural products each group member hopes to achieve profits between 13,000 and 90,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other clothes-sellers in the market. She dreams of opening a clothes shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Rosa has a fruit stand where she sells mangoes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for her mango trees. Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the mango trees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros, tiene 51 años y vive con su esposo y tres de sus seis hijos. Su hija de 21 esta estudiando Psicología en la Universidad Alas Peruanas. Ella estará utilizando su préstamo para viajar a Lima a comprar losa por mayor en Jiron Puno, y venderlas por menor con su esposo en triciclo.  Les venden a hogares, restaurantes y por pedidos. Maria lleva 32 años de casada y trabajando. Aparte de su negocio de lozas ella tambien compra artesania de Quinua (retablos, piedras de Huamanga, y el nacimiento en ceramica) y las lleva a Cusco. Maria ha sido socia de FINCA Perú por un par de años pero se salió cuando su esposo se tuvo que mudar mas lejos por el trabajo. Se acaba de reiniciar como socia y apenas terminó su primer ciclo. Lo que mas le gusta de FINCA Perú son los ahorros y la atención que las promotoras le dan a las socias. María paso todo el mes de Marzo en Lima cuidando a su madre que fue operada. Ella dice que eso le afecto mucho el trabajo, pero que ahora esta trabajando muy duro para superar el tiempo que no pudo vender.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Milagros' community bank.  She is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three of her six children.  Her 21 year-old daughter is studying psychology at the Universidad Alas Peruanas.

María will be using this loan to travel to Lima to buy kitchenware wholesale in Jiron Puno.  She will then sell the products retail with her husband on their three-wheeled cart.  They sell their products to homes and restaurants, and also to order.  María has been married and working for 32 years.  In addition to her business selling kitchenware, she also buys handicrafts in Quinua (devotional paintings, Huamanga stone carvings and ceramic birth mementos) and takes them to Cusco to sell.

Maria has been a member of FINCA Peru for a couple of years but she left when her husband had to move away for work reasons.  She has recently rejoined as a member and has just finished her first loan cycle.  What she most likes about FINCA Peru are the savings and the attention that the loan officers give to members.  Maria spent the whole of the month of March in Lima, taking care of her mother who had an operation.  She says that this affected her work a lot but now she is working very hard to make up for the time that she was unable to make any sales.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware wholesale in Lima

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна – вдова. У нее два взрослых сына – Александр и Игорь. Анна торгует кондитерскими изделиями, конфетами, печеньем в ассортименте на центральном рынке своего родного города Мелитополя. У Анны хорошее, большое торговое место и приемлемые цены на товар. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 5 лет. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 28 000 гривен, а прибыль – 4 000 гривен. 

Анна планирует использовать кредит в 8 000 гривен, чтобы закупить партию товара по договору с поставщиками. В ее дальнейших планах – развивать бизнес и улучшать свой быт. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли, заемщица планирует приобрести новую бытовую технику. Анна нашла приемлемое направление в бизнесе и собирается дальше работать в этой сфере.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Anna is a widow. She has two adult sons, Alexander and Igor. Anna sells pastries, candies, and an assortment cookies in the central market of her native city of Melitopol. Anna  has a large retail space and affordable prices. She has been in this business for five years. At the moment, her working capital is 28,000 hryvnia, and her profit is 4,000 hryvnia. 

Anna plans to use the credit of 8,000 hryvnia to buy goods under a contract with her suppliers. In the future, she plans to develop her business and improve her life. With her profits, she plans to acquire new household appliances. Anna has been successful in business and plans to continue working in this field.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Geronimo Serapio

texts.es: El Señor Gerónimo se dedica  al transporte público, como taxi trufis de una línea que hace el recorrido por las zonas mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  con una experiencia superior a los 5 años en el rubro. Vive en la casa de sus suegros con sus 2 hijos, su esposa se encuentra trabajando en Comercio quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El crédito es para realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, es una persona joven y trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerónimo provides public transportations services. He is part of a taxi fleet that travels through the busiest areas of the city of Cochabamba. Gerónimo has five years of valuable experience in this field. He lives at the home of his in-laws with his two children. His wife works in retail and helps with the household expenses.

This loan will be used to pay for maintenance since his vehicle is suffering from a few defects that are preventing him from providing good service to his customers. Gerónimo is a jovial and hardworking individual who desires to succeed. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité inicio gracias a la iniciativa D. una D. las miembros. Ella Contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona y D. ahí en más trabajan todas D. forma conjunta y dentro D. un ambiente D. mutua ayuda. Ellas son mujeres jefas D. familia, todas muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, que el día a día buscan el bienestar para sus familias.
La señora Asunción se dedica a la venta D. comestibles, por medio D. este trabajo ella genera los medios necesarios para mantener su hogar y a su familia. Ella comenta que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales siempre compran D. ella los platillos que prepara. Dice que todos sus clientes la felicitan por las excelentes comidas que prepara. Una D. sus metas es tener algún día un comedor donD. pueda expandirse y seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos, especias y otros insumos que necesite para la elaboración D. sus alimentos. Está contenta por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The formation of the current committee began thanks to the initiative of one of its members. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the communal bank in the area and from then on everyone has worked together in a mutually helpful environment. The women are heads of their households. All are very hardworking and self-sacrificing, who look out for the well-being of their families day by day. 

Asunción makes a living selling food, and it is through this work that she generates the means necessary to support her family and home. She says that she has many customers that always buy the dishes she makes and that all her customers compliment her on the excellent food she prepares. One of her goals is to one day have a restaurant where she can expand and continue growing. 

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, seasonings, spices, and other supplies needed to make her food. She is pleased by the opportunity the Fundación has given her as getting the loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, seasonings, spices, and other supplies needed to make her food.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El joven Israel tiene la edad de 20 años, se encuentra estudiando la Universidad, es soltero, el y su familia viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una region cañera.

El nos comenta que desde hace un año decidio iniciar a trabajar de  maestro albañil porque quiere salir adelante con sus estudios y poderle apoyar a su mama con los gastos de su hogar y pagar sus estudios.

Israel realiza su trabajo componiendo casas con diferentes personas de su comunidad que necesitan componer o contruir  su casa, asi que el necesita comprar material de construccion y madera para realizar sus trabajo, el nos platica que este oficio de albañil se lo enseño su padre y aun que es un trabajo muy duro a el legusta mucho ya que es bueno ver como la gente se llena de felicidad al tener su casa.


El necesita este credito para la compra de tablones, martillo, clavos, metro, cemento, desarmadores, tabla realizar su trabajo.

Israel espera que con esta inversion su trabajo aumente pues ya tendra el materia para realizas su labores y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
The youthful Israel is 20 years old and studies at the University. He is single and he and his family live in a community located in a sugar-cane-growing area.

He tells us that about a year ago he decided to begin working as a master bricklayer because he wanted to get ahead in his studies and be able to help his mother with household expenses and pay for his own studies.

Israel works renovating houses for different persons in his community who need to repair or construct their houses. Consequently, he needs to buy construction material and lumber to carry out his work. He says that he learned bricklaying from his father and that although it is very hard work, he likes it very much, since it is good to see how overjoyed people are to have their own house.

Israel needs this loan to buy planks, a hammer, nails, a tape measure, cement, screw drivers, and boards to do his work.

Israel hopes that with this investment, his work will grow, once he has the supplies to carry out the work and continue studying.

loans.use: buy construction material to enable him to continue working as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children.
 
Noel has a shop that makes and sells coconut and wood charcoal by the sack. He has had this business for 10 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut and wood for charcoal making.

Noel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconut and wood for charcoal making.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 32-year-old, married man who has been working as a painter for ten years. Kassem enjoys painting houses and walls and feels proud when he finishes a project. 
Kassem is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time to buy a car which he needs to transport his tools and paints from one project to another. His previous loan was very positive and helped a lot in improving both his social and financial situations. 
This car is his entire dream right now. He hopes he it will help him to take on more than one project at a time as it will mean transportation is not a problem.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia sigue trabjando en su negocio de restaurant, ella sigue preparando desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de fruta, la socia por medio de estos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant y mejorar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, platanos, uvas y mandarinas y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar y verduras. 
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Maruja. She is 40 years old, married common-law, and she has 4 children. She continues to work on her restaurant. She has been preparing breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and she has also continued to dedicate herself to fruits sales. It is through these businesses that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand and improve her restaurant business and she wants to improve her fruits sales business. She requests a loan to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarins, and to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, sugar, and vegetables.

He is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarin oranges as well as ingredients for cooking such as rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 1 child who goes to school. She has one additional family member (sister). 

Doreen sells bananas from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one year. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of matooke (green bananas). 

Doreen's aspirations and goals are to be a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Corazon has a tailoring shop that makes curtains, pillow cases, and gowns, and repairs clothes and uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop. Corazon is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is 38 years old and single. She lives in H. Chi Minh City. She earns an income by selling mobile cards and SIM cards. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and range of SIM cards and mobile cards to serve more people. She hopes that the loan can help her to improve her income and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and range of SIM cards and mobile cards

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 35-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Rana is trading in clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes to sell.

Rana is looking to open a shop for her business instead of working form home. She is also looking to save money for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 52 years old, a farmer for 20 years. He lives with his five children. Until now, this has been the source of funds for the education of his children. Now, he wants to improve and develop his business for the sake of his children’s education. He is now asking a loan amount P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides use to improve his business.

He hopes through this loan he will be able to gain better crops for him to save for his children and lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Adelo

texts.en:
Adelo is married with five children. He is 49 years old and lives in Tonggo, Tudela.

Adelo is a farmer, and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for planting crops.

Adelo has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Adelo hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Maria Emilia es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio excelente, ellas nos expresa que con el financiamiento le ayudaron mucho ya que pudo aumentar su inversión y sus clientes también. Maria Emilia aprendió este negocio empíricamente ya que no tenía trabajo y necesitaba generar ingresos a la familia y tuvo que emprender si saber nada este negocio que junto a sus hijos trabaja para salir adelante. Maria Emilia está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como ropa para damas, ropa para caballero, ropa para niño, cosméticos, entre otros productos que demanden los clientes.
texts.en: Maria Emilia is an entrepreneur who has worked with Fundación León 2000. She has shown herself to be a responsible person with an excellent credit history. She tells us that the loan helped her a lot since she could increase her investment and her customers as well. Maria Emilia learned this business empirically since she didn't have a job and needed to generate income for her family. She had to start the business without knowing anything bout it and with her children she works to get ahead. Maria Emilia is asking for a loan to buy products such as women's clothing, men's clothing, children's clothing, cosmetics, and more that her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, men's clothing, children's clothing, cosmetics, and more.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Vilma tiene 42 años de edad y es madre solera y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal de Vilma es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Ya son dos meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Andrés Avelino Cáceres" is made up of responsible and hard-working people who make their families progress. Most of its members live and work in Cusco, a city known as a popular tourist resort as well as for its commercial activities and its traditional Inti Raymi festival. One of the Seven Wonders of the World, the Machu Picchu, is nearby.

Vilma is 42 years old and the single mother of two children. She was born in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, and lives in her beautiful native city. Her main economic activity consists in breeding small animals, such as sheep, guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. She has been working for two months in this business and is doing very well. Today Vilma applies for a loan to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Zuleima Elizabeth

texts.es: Zuleima Elizabeth de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, camisas, pantalones,  vestidos entre otros, tiene  varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en parques, calles y colonias cercanas a su localidad y ya tiene mucho clientela las personas saben que todo lo que vende Zuleima es de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; es una mujer decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante, le gusta aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan porque sabe que solo así logrará el éxito; desde hace mucho tiempo quiere aumentar las ventas, pues sabe que así aumentaran sus ganancias, no posee de suficiente capital para invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Zuleima es muy responsable y tiene excelentes referencias de pago asegura que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez ofrecerle mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

loans.use: ropa por mayor como blusas, camisas, pantalones, calcetines, y faldas

loans.name: Agung

texts.en:
Agung Is a son of Komida client, and he is a student in National High School In Mande.
Everyday agung always help his dad for selling fish in traditional market when he after back from the school. 
he is a diligent child. but he has trouble by the costs, so that's a which one of komida reason for help his school costs. and he really thanks to kiva and komida because was help his costs.

loans.use: To pay for monthly Costs

loans.name: Deisy

texts.en:
Deisy has seven years of experience selling vegetables. She started selling them during the holidays when her town would hold festivals. When those are not going on, Deisy runs a shop out of her home. When customers started coming, she realized that they were also in need of household items, so slowly she started building an inventory that looked something like a small market. Ms. Holguin moved to a part of Guayaquil call Malvinas five years ago when she bought her house. It is there that she works hard every day from 6:30am until 11pm. She is asking for this loan so that she can attend to the needs of her customers better by keeping more products in stock and offering the best vegetables she can find. 

Deisy is a 26 year-old single mother of three, two of whom are studying in school. When her husband left her, her children were just infants, so she has had to rely on her family to support her. Her wish is to continue building the business and earn higher profits.

loans.use: She is asking for this loan so that she can attend to the needs of her customers better by keeping more products in stock and offering the best vegetables she can find.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy 50 more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with an 8-year-old son. She started her entrepreneurial activity with a tiny stand selling different household necessities in the local market. Through diligent work she is now running a kiosk selling toys and games. Yelena’s monthly net profit is about $1,000-1,200. 

Yelena is very generous. She has a kind and caring heart. Her love for children motivated her to choose this sphere of business. Being a sociable person, Yelena manages to find common ground with every client, which has given her many loyal customers.

Yelena needs a loan for $800 to increase her stock for the summer season. She wants to buy stuffed toys, table games, Barbie dolls, puzzles, construction pieces, etc. in bulk from wholesale distributors. Yelena has worked in this business for over 5 years and knows exactly what kids will like and how to make a child happy. She doesn’t have to advertise her kiosk. Her attractive toy displays and bright colors draw many potential clients to her kiosk. With a loan, Yelena can purchase a better supply of inventory and be prepared for what she hopes will be another busy and profitable summer season in Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her toy and games business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S. is 38-year-old mother of 5 children. She is a housewife, while her husband is a head of family who covers all the family’s expenses by working for a private company as a driver. He can typically earn up to $6 each day. Two of her children also work as private drivers, and the others generate income by operating a tailoring business. S. hopes this loan will help her purchase more sewing machines, so that her children can operate their business more efficiently and satisfy their clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines for her children's tailoring  business

loans.name: Ferila

texts.en:
Ferila K., a mother of two from the big island of Savaii, is now married to a hard man from Saletele Fagaloa on the island of Upolu. She's unemployed and her small business that provides her living is producing handicrafts. She also helps her husband planting kava and delivering it to the shop in town.

All this hard work turns into financial support for her family with the main financial assistance coming from S.P.B.D program. That’s where the progress started even though she has to pay back S.P.B.D; without their support this would never happen. Now Ferila is able to support her own family and also her parents and family on the island of Savaii. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to continue the dream.

loans.use: For purchasing supplies for her crafts

loans.name: Kacang Kebonsari Group

texts.id:
This group of peanut farmers led by I Made Suta has the following members: I Wayan Sukarman, I Nyoman Ariana, I Wayan Itep dan I Made Budiasa. To grow peanut the time required is 3 months and does not require as much water as rice. When the land and peanut seedlings are ready they are planted. Thereafter commences the care. They need fertilizer for nutrition and pesticide for the insects. This need not be performed as frequently as growing padi. The amount of water also needs to be controlled, not too much or too little. These activities are carried out till almost harvest. Their effort will generate a profit of Rp 4.000.000,00 (about USD440) per person. This amount is attained from 3 months of farming. Their loan will be used to purchase peanut seedlings, manure, care and working expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok Petani Kacang yang diketuai oleh I Made Suta ini beranggotakan : I Wayan Sukarman, I Nyoman Ariana, I Wayan Itep dan I Made Budiasa. Untuk bercocok tanam kacang mereka membutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 3 bulan. Kacang tidak membutuhkan air sebanyak tanaman padi. Setelah lahan dan bibit kacang siap, maka dilakukan penanaman. Pada masa-masa berikutnya merupakan masa perawatan. Mereka perlu memberikan pupuk-untuk nutrisi-dan atau pestisida –untuk membasmi serangga. Hal ini dilakukan tidak dilakukan sesering seperti yang harus dilakukan pada tanaman padi. Jumlah air juga perlu dikontrol. Jumlah air tidak boleh terlalu banyak atau terlalu sedikit. Aktivitas ini mereka lakukan sampai menjelang masa panen. Usaha yang mereka lakukan tersebut memberikan keuntungan sebesar Rp 4.000.000,00/orang. Nilai ini mereka peroleh setelah 3 bulan penantian. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh akan mereka pakai untuk membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja.

loans.use: Purchase peanut seedlings, manure, care and working expenses (Membeli bibit padi, pupuk, biaya perawatan dan ongkos kerja)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the community bank “Las Fresitas”, is 65 years old and has one grown son who is her pride and joy. With the first loan of $100USD from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of beef.

Currently, she has a small location in the “Yarina Cocha” market and she gets up very early to prepare breakfast and then go to her place in the market to take care of her many customers. In the afternoon she does embroidery and takes care of her young grandson.

With the recent loan of approximately $1003USD from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid over a period of six months, she will invest in items such as beef and kitchen utensils.

Maria, despite family problems, has never felt defeated. On the contrary, she told us that neither age nor the obstacles that can come along in life should impede the realization of one’s dreams. These challenges should instead give us the motivation we need to make our goals a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas”, Jr. 3 de Octubre 262, distrito de Yarina Cocha D. departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años y es madre de 1 hijo mayor de edad y que es el orgullo de ella. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$100) decide invertir en la venta de carne de res. En la actualidad tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de Yarina Cocha y se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y después ir a su puesto en el mercado y atender a sus clientes que por cierto son muchos, en las tardes se dedica a hacer bordados y cuidar a su pequeño nieto. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000 (US$ 1003.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará S/. 200.00 en carne de res, implementos de cocina (2 cuchillos, un hacha, 1 ciento de bolsas para la entrega de la carne), además dará mantenimiento a su balanza. María, a pesar de tener problemas familiares no se ha sentido vencida, muy por el contrario, nos contó que la edad y los obstáculos que se puedan presentar en la vida no son impedimentos para realizar nuestros sueños, nos da el impulso que necesitamos algunas veces para sentirnos capaces de realizar nuestros objetivos.

loans.use: Purchase beef and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Abduvahobov

texts.en: Abduvahobov R. lives in Spitamen, and he is married and has a child. Abduvahobov R. made the decision to become the client of MicroInvest because he heard many stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan procedures that helped his friends to develop and improve their businesses, so he has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. Abduvahobov R., from the first days, showed himself as a reliable and executive client. The business stability and income increases he's had have helped him to return in time the previous loan. Mr. Abduvahobov R. is experienced in business and has the appropriate knowledge of livestock because he worked with bovine animals from his early years. He helped his father in the farm with livestock raising and selling, the milk production and other work. It was the family business. He still is engaged in livestock raising and selling because he dreamed of having a large herd. In time, he dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for the further meat and milk-sour (cultured milk) goods production, which supplies the bazaars with pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. Now Mr. Abduvahobov R. requests a loan for business development and to increase the business income, and to plan for more pedigree milk-cow purchases.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema S., age 38, is married with 1 child (who is 19 years old). Rehema owns a shop selling alcohol, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 6 PM daily, she earns about $65 a month from this business.

Rehema has successfully taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy alcohol stock for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Rehema belongs to a loan group called Garden.

loans.use: To buy more beer and other beverages

loans.name: Thi Tat

texts.vi:
Mrs Tất has 2 children who are still going to school. She has been selling plastic products for a long time. Her products are made with recycled plastic, these are of good quality and beautiful design. She has built a good base of loyal customers. She would like to borrow 2006000 VND to expand her store, adding more products to her catalog. She likes SEDA's loan condition and the ability to make weekly installment

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tất có hai con còn đi học, buôn bán nhựa từ lâu đời. Sản phẩm chị làm ra từ nhựa tái chế nhưng mẫu mã đẹp lại bền chắc nên được rất nhiều người tin dùng và trở thành bạn hàng thân thiết của cửa hàng chị. Chị muốn vay 2006000 đồng để mở rộng cửa hàng, làm ra nhiều sản phẩm để bán hơn nên chị đã vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị chỉ phải trả hàng tuần với số tiền nhỏ.

loans.use: plastic products

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan N., 63, and her husband have been married since 1972. They have six children; four sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family house. Of the other four children, three are employed full time and one is a student. The family lives along the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sophan has been a weaver for forty years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who sells it in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has been a farmer since he was young. They are in their early 60s but are still strong enough to work. 


She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase materials for weaving silk and to repair parts of her house. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving silk and to repair parts of her house

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina O. owns a provision store. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan will be used as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Mano Amiga Group

texts.en:
Juliana Calcaño is a young mother of two children, ages 7 and 9. In order to spend time with her children while continuing to earn a living, she has opened a small salon in her home. In the Dominican Republic, the women go the salon once a week for a hair wash and straightening. Juliana provides hair services, manicures, and different skin treatments. She sought out Esperanza to acquire a small loan that will allow her to buy more shampoos, conditioners, and nail products. As her business continues to grow, she hopes to employ several other young women to work in her salon alongsiD. her. In her free time, Juliana loves to cook and says that cake is definitely her specialty.

Juliana Calcaño is just one member of the 20 person bank, Mano Amigo. These Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the othe members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Juliana, the Mano Amigo group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty that you are helping to solve.

loans.use: To buy more shampoo, conditioner, and nail products for her small salon.

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen A. is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells videos and audio CDs. She learned this business in 1 year and 8 months. She started her own business in 2000. She is a LAPO client. Amen is requesting the loan amount of $875 to buy more videos and audio CDs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more videos and audio CDs for sale

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun T., 43, of Daunlaar Village, Kampong Thom Province, is the mother of four children and has been growing rice since 1998, earning about $4 per day. Assisted by her husband, she works hard everyday in order to provide for her children. They grow the rice crop twice a year: the rainy season and the dry season. Because this is their main source of family income, they are trying to improve and expand their farming business, so Mrs. T. is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to increase her rice yield.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to expand her rice crop business

loans.name: Rebeca Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rebeca habita en la colonia Unidad de Propósito, en donde habita con su madre y con su hermano, tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vende variedad de mercadería como ropa, zapatos cosméticos, tiene seis años de estar en las ventas. La solicitud de préstamos es para invertir en los productos, va a adquirir ropa de niñas y niños para así mantener la variedad que siempre ha ofrecido. Su meta en estos momentos es seguir apoyando a su madre y a su hermano en la manutención del hogar, ya que ella es la única que trabaja. Y para su negocio espera poder mantener las ventas como hasta ahora, y en un futuro experimentar crecimiento para así poder llegar a tener un local formal donde hacer sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rebeca lives in the Unidad de Propósito neighborhood with her mother and her brother. She is 34 years old and is single. She has been selling a variety of products such as clothing, shoes and cosmetics for the past six years.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise, such as children's clothing so that she can maintain the variety she has always offered. Her goal at this time is to continue to financially support her mother and her brother, she is the only one that works in the household. She also hopes to maintain the level of sales she has had up to know and to continue to grow so that in the future she can have an actual store to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 56 años. Desde de hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa en general y estampados publicitarios en ropa deportiva e industrial.
Actualmente no cuenta con un taller propio donde trabajar, por lo que trabaja en un pequeño espacio de su vivienda. 
El crédito que anteriormente recibió Manuel le sirvió para comprar materiales como telas y tintes de estampado. Ahora el necesita otro crédito, ya que planea poner un pequeño taller que le permita un trabajo más apropiado.
texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old. Since several years ago, he has sold clothing and imprints advertisements on sports and industrial clothing. At the moment, he does not have his own workshop, so he works in a small space in his home. Manuel used the loan that he previously received to purchase material such as fabric and printing dye. Now he needs another loan, which he plans to put into a small workshop that will be more suitable for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a workshop for producing clothing and imprinting advertisements

loans.name: Anees Fatima M. Shabir Group

texts.en:
Anees Fatima Baji is a wife of M. Shabir and resides in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. Anees Baji completed her education till 5th standard. She has no kids. Anees Baji’s husband has a clothes selling business. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He buys clothes from different cities (Lahore and Faisal Abad). Anees Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Ameena Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Naseem Fatima Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Sanam Baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Salma Baji wants a loan to buy corn oil to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en:
Mohammad Sadiq, a man with two children, has a restaurant in which he has been involved for more than 10 years. He has a good number of customers and always tries to expand his business. He loves his business and his customers like the food in this restaurant, and therefore he would like to expand.

He requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans for the term of 18 months to complete his stock and enlarge his restaurant to make his business strong in the future and keep his customers happy. This is one of his best wishes to make happen in his life.

Finally, he would like to thank those who help this loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership with Kiva and AFSG.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Nay

texts.en: Mr. Nay M. is a motorcycle taxi driver in Pursat Province. He can earn around US$ 3 per day, but currently his income has declined because his motorcycle is old. He is married to Mrs. Un Nhanh who is a rice farmer. He has three children, all of whom are in school. To keep a stable income, M. would like to request a loan to change his motorcycle and purchase another one that can attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase another newer motorcycle that can attract more customers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Owusuaa is 35 years old and married with three children. Currently, all her children are in elementary school. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as tables, stuffed chairs, and wardrobes. Ama O. is a second hand textiles dealer. She deals mostly in bedspreads. She buys from wholesalers in Kumasi and hawks them door to door in her community. She also sells on a table top in the market square. Ama would like a loan to buy textiles in large bales so that she can trek to other towns to make business. It is her dream to help her husband sponsor their children to the university level of education.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles in bales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds for his land

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
.
 
Vive en la comunidad Guaraya de la Provincia  Ingavi del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a  cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su hija menor la cual le colabora en el cuidado del ganado y su hogar. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Francisca works raising cattle and sells their milk through PIL Andina (the Andean Milk Production Plant). She lives in the Guaraya community in Ingavi, La Paz, Bolivia which is located about 4 hours from the city of La Paz. She lives with her small daughter who helps her take care of the cattle and their home. This loan will be used to purchase a milking cow to increase the milk production and, by that means, their income. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 25 años, vive con sus padres en su casa propia. Se dedica a la atención de su restaurante, ubicado en una carretera muy transitada, este negocio lo administra desde hace varios meses, ella y sus familiares aportaron en el capital de apertura y desde entonces Judith atiende por las tardes, de preferencia todos los días para ofrecer a los clientes el servicio de almuerzos. Hasta el momento el negocio está dando bueno frutos en cuanto a la rentabilidad. Para el futuro, Judith ve con grandes expectativas de éxito y crecimiento su negocio, por lo que se concentrará en mejorar la presentación de su restaurante. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su  banco comunal porque han visto que ella a una persona muy responsable con sus cuentas y colaboradora en todo lo que se dispone. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de mercadería en gaseosas, además quiere incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir que exhibirá en su mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Judith is 25 years old and lives with her parents in their own home. She applies her attention to their restaurant located on a well traveled roadway. They have managed the business for a few months since she and her family members put up the opening capital. Judith prefers to work every afternoon in order to offer the lunch service to the customers. Until now the business has been fruitful regarding profitability. In the future, Judith has great expectations of success and growth for their business as they will concentrate on the improved presentation of their restaurant. This is the first request for a loan from MFP. She was invited to form a part of the communal bank because they have seen that she is a very responsible person with her accounts and works well with others on everything she prepares. They money requested is for the purchase of soft drinks, additionally she wants to include the sale of clothing articles to be displayed at the same business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks for her business / Compra de bebidas para su negocio

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie M. est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge. Elle veut maintenir et renforcer son activité de vente de tissu teint « Thioup ». Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie M. is married and responsible for 5 children. She wants to maintain and expand her business selling dyed cloth known as "Thioup". Her goal is to better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dyed cloth called "Thioup"

loans.name: Flor De Tani Tani Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Senkata, a este pertenece la asociación “Flor de Tani Tani”, formada por trece miembros.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas. Diferentes son las actividades de este grupo; algunas venden comida, otras realizan tejidos a mano de chompas y mantas, también preparan  fibra de alpaca para luego venderla solamente a pedido. 
Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar materia prima, con esto mejorarían sus ingresos, con el único de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Tani Tani" group is made up of thirteen members and is part of the focal center Senkata, located in the city of El Alto. This is a very happy group that together with its loan assistant, works with a lot of responsibility. Most members of the group are married with large families. The group members engage in different activities. Some sell food, others make hand-woven sweaters and blankets, others prepare alpaca fiber that is later sold only by order.
