The group is requesting more loans in order to expand their sales. In order to do this, they need to buy raw material. This will allow them to improve their income as their single goal is to improve the lifestyle of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for their various businesses.

loans.name: Khalid Group

texts.en:
Khalid is the group leader of Khalid group. There are five members in this group and each of the group members wants a loan to expand their business and buy the essential things for their business.

Manila wants to take a loan for her beauty salon.

Nazia and Sweeta want to take a loan for their businesses of bead-working and embroidery.

Nasrin wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Khalid wants to take a loan for her general store.

They are happy that, through a Kiva loan, they can improve their businesses.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She sells electronics to make a living.  She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Y. Sao Yen, 40, and her husband make a living by producing rice wine and raising pigs to sell piglets. Sao is pictured at the place where she produces rice wine. She lives with her husband and three children. Two of her younger children are still dependent on her because they have years to finish schooling. Her oldest child has a business of his own as a motorbike dealer--buying used motorbikes and selling them for a fairly good profit.

For household improvements and future stability, Sao wants to borrow $1000 US to buy a stock of rice grains to sell when the right time comes.

loans.use: To buy rice grains

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne T. runs a bar called “Chez Horace” in Cotonou, Bénin. She has four children, one of whom helps manage the bar. She also employs a cashier, several waitresses, and a woman to purchase beverages at a local market.

Business is going well but could be better. Daphne thinks that her sales have diminished somewhat due to the rainy season when there is less social activity. Daphne normally sells food in front of the bar but cannot do so when it is constantly raining. She hopes business will pick up again when the rain lets up towards the end of the summer. Daphne is seeking a loan from Alidé in order to restock her beverages, which she hopes will increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is 21 years old and single. He makes a living running a grocery store in Hebron, Palestine. Mahmud would like to expand this business by buying sacks of rice, canned goods and other products to sell to his customers. By doing this,  he will be able to contribute to the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Lydia Margarita

texts.es: La señora Lydia D. N. es cliente antigua, en su historial crediticio no tiene dias D. atraso, lo cual indica que es una persona responsable y cumplida. La señora, se dedica a la compra por mayor D. peluches para venderlos al por menor en la popular feria D. la zona 16 D. julio, ciudad D. El Alto, su negocio lo hace sola, no tiene esposo, tiene una sola hija que actualmente esta estudiando.
texts.en:
Lydia D. N. is an old client; in her credit history she has had no delayed payments, which indicates that she is a responsible and committed person. She dedicates herself to purchasing stuffed animals wholesale, to sell retail at the popular market of the 16 D. Julio area in the city of El Alto. She runs her business alone. She does not have a husband, and has one daughter that is currently studying.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of more bundles of stuffed animals.

loans.name: Maria Eustaquia

texts.es: La señora María vive en Villa Salomé hace muchos y actualmente tiene su casa en construcción. Su esposo, Máximo H., es contratista (persona que realiza contratos D. construcción, donD. guía y controla que la constucción termine). Ellos tienen 4 hijos, tres D. ellos estudian en la escuela primaria y el otro es aún pequeño. Ella se dedica a vender en su tienda D. barrio, el local esta en alquiler. Es muy conocida por sus vecinos como una persona responsable y dedicada con su familia y su trabajo. Uno D. los deseos D. María es ver a sus hijos como profesionales. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. abarrotes como ser arroz, azúcar y fideo.

loans.use: COMPRA DE ARROZ, FIDEO, AZÚCAR

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon M. is a 23-year-old man, married to Zipporah Wanjiku and together they have two school-going children. Simon has been operating a water vendor business for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. He has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before and this will be his first loan. Joseph will use this loan to add more donkeys and donkey carts to transport and supply water to his ever increasing customers in Naivasha town.

His future aspiration is to own a plot of land and buy a pick-up car to supply water covering Naivasha town and its environs.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Adding more donkeys and donkey carts.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna O. dreamed of having her own business to manage so that her husband’s sporadic income as a farm laborer would be augmented. This would make them capable of sustaining the finances of their two children aged one and three years old.

Jonna wanted to secure the future of their children while they are young. Thus, she joined ASHI and has requested a loan which will be used to start up a food-vending business. Through the profits of her planned business, she hoped to generate savings for the future of her children and eventually to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and ingrediets for her food-vending business

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Febelyn is a young mother who lives in a village located at Barangay Pieza, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 21 years old. Because of her early marriage, she only completed a secondary level of education. She is married to Jeffrey V.; they are blessed with a child named Eunice V.. It is difficult for them to earn a living because they have no stable job. 
	
Her husband cultivates their parcel of land by planting rice and some vegetables while Febelyn uses their tricycle to earn income. Through her patience and sacrifices, she earns a minimum income of PHP 200 per day. She utilizes this to acquire their daily basic needs and to save for the future of their child. Due to the high cost of commodities, she needs to earn more income to meet their daily needs. Consequently, she wants to borrow additional capital from ASKI, amounting to PHP 7,000. It will be used for the maintenance of their tricycle. She is very grateful for this financial assistance because it will allow her to use her tricycle continuously and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: maintaining her tricycle

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita A. is a resident of Barangay Marcos in Roxas, Isabela. She is a loving mother of four children. Relita is married to Apolonio, Sr,, a farmer. Farming is their main source of income, but they only earn money from farming during the harvest season. Thus, Relita decided to raise pigs for extra  income and her husband took a job working in their neighbor's farm whenever he is not busy in their own farm.

Because she lacks the necessary capital, Relita has decided to borrow Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a young Palestinian man who is married and has small children.

In Palestine, butcher shops buy chicken live from the farms and at the shop they prepare it for their customers. They take off the feathers in order for the meat to be fresh since the people here buy the meat or the chicken fresh and slaughtered on the same day.

Anwar has operated his shop for ten years selling both chickens and eggs. There is good demand for his shop, especially since he has contracts with some Bethlehem hotels and restaurants.

Anwar appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To buy products for his shop

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Mrs. Lenie A. is from the village of Magsaysay in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. Lenie grows and sells rice. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and she earns PHP 4,000.00 (~ $87 USD) from her business each month. 

In 2001, Lenie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP for her business.This will be Lenie's 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Gioconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gioconda M. de 40 años de edad, vive en la zona de Perimetral de Guayaquil tiene una casa de cemento solo cuenta en su vivienda con agua y luz no tiene alcantarillado, Gioconda emprendió este negocio de cerrajería gracias a su esposo que hace 10 años atrás trabajo en una Empresa de soldaduras, pero al no cancelarle a tiempo y no tener beneficios de esa empresa decidió ser independiente con los conocimientos aprendidos comenzó a enseñarle su esposa Gioconda.

Ahora Gioconda con su esposo trabajan de 08h00 hasta las 17h00, compran soldadura, pinturas anticorrosivas y planchas negras algunos de sus clientes mas conocidos traen la materia prima para que le salga mas económico, una de las mayores complicaciones es la electricidad en tiempos de racionamiento del Gobierno y también el trabajo que hacen a sus 3 hijos les ocasionan alergias, sus 3 hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal cercana a su sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y equipos para poder tener más movimiento en su clientela y darle una mejor vida a su familia, en el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y así sus hijos tengas la oportunidad de estudiar en mejores colegios.
texts.en:
Gioconda M., 40, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Her house is concrete but it only has running water and electricity; no sewerage. Gioconda opened a locksmith shop thanks to her husband who worked for a welder 10 years ago. However, because they did not pay him on time nor offer any benefits, he decided to use what he had learned and open his own shop. He also began to teach his skills to Gioconda. Now, Gioconda and her husband work from 8am to 5pm. They buy solder, anti-rust paint, and black metal sheets. Some of their better known customers bring their own raw materials in order to save a bit on costs. One of the greatest complications they face is when the government rations electricity use and some of the projects they work on irritate allergies in their three children, who are students at the local elementary school. With the funding she wants to buy tools and equipment so that she can have a larger customer turnover in order to provide a better life for her family. In the future, she would like to enlarge her business so that her children will have the opportunity to go to better schools.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tools and equipment.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha N. is 44 years old and she lives in Trapaing Tonle village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pen Sem, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. They have a problem because they do not have enough money to buy rice seeds for cultivating. Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds; she plans to use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides. Mrs. Chantha N. has six children: three are students, two are farmers and one is a labourer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for cultivating

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Horonya est composé de neuf femmes dont huit mariées dans des grandes  familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et habitent le chef lieu de  commune rurale Cinzana Gare (4ème Région administrative du Mali.) 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités commerciales. 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, la transformation de grains de Néré en Sounbala, la restauration etc. 
Dans le souci  d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 1er  prêt de groupe.
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter,  5 sacs de riz,  2sacs de farine de blé, 2 bidons d’huile de 20 litres, 2 caisses de pommes de terre, 2cartons de spaghettis, 3 cartons de bananes plantains, et des condiments (nécessaires à la préparation des différents mets alimentaires), 2 sacs de graines de Néré,  2 colis de calebasses, 1colis d’ustensiles  en plastiques, 48 paires de chaussures et 2 cartons de parfums. 
La plus parts de  leurs marchandises seront achetées sur place à la foire hebdomadaire de Cinzana Gare. La pomme de terre, les bananes plantain sont fournies par les forains venant de Loulouni. Les graines de Néré sont transformées en Sounbala. 
La vente se fait au marché de Cinzana Gare, dans les gargotes et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14.100FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, à l’achat de nourriture, des fournitures scolaires  et à la participation aux évènements sociaux. 
Leur ambition est la diversification de leurs activités avec  l’élevage de petits  ruminants.
texts.en:
The group Horonya is composed of nine women, of whom eight are married, in large traditional extended families.  The women average 39 years of age and four children each living in the capital of the rural community Cinzana Gare (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, and their commercial work.  They work at selling a variety of goods, food catering, and processing néré seeds to make sounbala (a pounded and fermented condiment formed into balls and used in cooking). Concerned about increasing their business volume, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their first group loan.  This loan will be used to buy:  five sacks of rice, two sacks of wheat flour, two 20-liter containers of oil, two cases of potatoes, two boxes of spaghetti, three boxes of plantains, and some condiments (necessary for making different dishes), two sacks of néré seeds, two packages of calabashes, a package of plastic utensils, 48 pairs of shoes, and two boxes of perfumes.  Most of their merchandise will be purchased locally at the Cinzana Gare weekly fair.  The potatoes and plantains are furnished by fair vendors coming from Loulouni.  The néré seeds are processed into sounbala.  Sales are made at the Cinzana Gare market in stalls and in homes.  Cash or credit is accepted from customers composed of men and women. The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 14,100 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan, to buy food and school supplies, and to take part in societal events.  Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by raising small ruminants. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina L. is currently in the business of selling beans, tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of beans and onions to sell. Dina is 29 years old and is married to a business man. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Martha Eugenia M. S. tiene una pulpería en la cual ella vende de todo un poco, ubicada en el barrio Santa Ana contiguo al puente Walter penki, La señora M. nesecitaba el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su pulpería ya que casi no tenia surtido, su negocio lo abre desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche diario, ella es madre soltera no tiene carga pero es una señora que le gusta luchar y no depender de nadie ella tiene un trabajo fijo que es barrer las calles en horas de la madrugada de parte de la alcaldía luego de llegar a su casa abre su pulpería, su negocio empezo desde hace 12 años cuando comenzó vendiendo frutas en la puerta de su casa  para sacar adelante a sus hijos, luego ella surtió su venta hasta la fecha que es  una pulpería, tiene de trabajar con nosotros alrededor de 5 años con 28 créditos en los cuales a ella le han beneficiado bastante por que a podido remodelar su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Eugenia M. S. has a general store in which she sells a little bit of everything, located in the Santa Ana neighborhood, next to the Walter Penki bridge. Señora M. needs financing to buy merchandise for her store, since she has almost no stock. She opens her business from 6 in the morning until 9 at night every day. She is a single mother. She has no dependents now. But she is a woman who likes to work hard and not depend on anyone. She has a regular job, which is to sweep the streets in part of the town in the early morning hours. Then, on arriving at her house, she opens her store. Her business began 12 years ago when she began selling fruit at the door of her house in order to advance her children. Then she increased her stock for sale up to the point that it became a store. She has worked with us for about 5 years, with 28 loans, which have benefited her enough that she has been able to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for my store such as staple foods, snacks, soft drinks, everyday necessities, etc.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Mr. Savat K. is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Keang Chhorn (they are pictured together), is 42 years old. They have been married since 1981 and have eight children: 3 sons and 5 daughters. Three of their children are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker and the other four attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savat has been growing mushrooms for two months while his wife has been producing rice wine for ten years. Savat hopes to expand his mushroom farm so he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand his mushroom farm

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young man from Gaza city in Gaza strip. He is married and the father of Fotoun, 4 years old, and Iyad, 3 years old. Mohammad is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority and works as a taxi driver after his working hours.

Mohammad pays for his taxi from its income, but since he has only a few payments left, he decided to take a loan from FATEN to pay them off all at once.

Mohammad stands next to his car in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchase a Taxi car

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke is 48 years old, married and has three children. She is a member of LAPO and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past four years. 

Ronke makes and sells bible covers and bags used for parties. She has been in this business for the past 14 years and also sells foodstuffs. She is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. 

Ronke is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to buy materials used in bag making in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and more profit on each sale. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase materials for bag making

loans.name: Firida

texts.en:
Firida S. is currently in the business of selling weaving materials at a salon and is requesting a loan to stock perfumes to sell.  Firida is 33 years old and married. Her husband is a nurse. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start up a bookshop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock perfumes to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina ,de 55 años, es madre soltera y  tiene una hija Katia (20),con quien vive en su acogedora casa, que es propia.Todos los productos oriundos que siembra los comercializa directamente en los mercados de la ciudad, desde hace 40 años. Además los días miércoles visita las chacras de sus vecinos para acopiar diferentes variedades de verduras ,que lleva dentro de su mercadería, lamentablemente realiza  esta labor sola, pero afirma que son tantos los años dedicada a esta labor que se basta sola para desempeñarla.Lo que más le gusta es viajar con sus compañeras que también llevan mercadería a la capital, porque se ayudan bastante , sin embargo le molesta que algunos conductores quieran aprovecharse cobrándole un flete elevado por el traslado de los frutos.Su negocio le resulta rentable, porque con tranquilidad puede pagar sus gastos y cubrir la educación superior de su hija. Para el  futuro, quiere comprar un espacio en el mercado central de la capital para que sus ventas sean seguras y pueda tener un puesto fijo donde comercialice sus productos.Este es el décimo tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y los años que viene trabajando con su banco comunal hacen que ella se sienta segura de continuar laborando, pues entre todos se guardan respeto y mucha confianza.Valentina tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería (en verduras y productos oriundos de la zona).
texts.en:
Valentina is 55 years old, a single mother of one daughter, Katia (20) with whom she lives in acosy house of her own. She has been selling the products she grows directly at the town markets for 40 years.

Aso on Wednesdays she visits her neighbors' farms to gather different varieties of vegetables for ther business. Unfortunately she works alone, but assures that she has been doing this for so long and it is ok. What she likes the most is to travel with her friends who also take merchandise to the capital as they help each other. Nevertheless it bothers her that some of the drivers take advantage wanting to charge a high fee for transporting the fruit. Her business is profitableas she can easily cover her expenses and the superior education of her daughter. In the future she wants to buy a stall at the central market of the capital to secure her sales and have a stable place to sell her products. This is her tenth loan with MFP and the years she has been working with her community bank make her feel secure to continue working as there is respect and trust among everybody. Valetina plans to invest the money requested in buying more merchandise (vegetable, and local products.)

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nagimatou

texts.en:
Madame Nagimatou I. sells firewood and charcoal from her home. This is a small but lucrative business that she has had for about four years.

Madame I. has experience taking micro-loans from WAGES and has requested her third loan of 400,000 CFA. She plans to use the loan to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nouakan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
MINATA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, de Mororibila et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
MINATA D. tout comme les autres membres du groupe compte réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de la production agricole, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BenkadiI 1 is a group of married women from the village of Toura Nouakan in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional families. On average, the women are 30 years old and have at least six children. They grow peanuts. In order of turning a profit from their farms, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third farming loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Minata D. will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and fertilizer, in the big Kimparana market. After winter, the crop will be stored for it to gain value and then sold at the Kimparana market and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. The members of the group each expect to make a revenue of 35,000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the family's expenditures.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds, fertilizer and small tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertiliser

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy S. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 31 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Daisy owns and operates a business providing recycling services, primarily hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Silveriana

texts.en:
Mrs. Silveriana C. is from the Barangay of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years of age and a widow. She is blessed with four children, three of whom are now already adults and one is still a teenager.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a mini carenderia and snack vending activity. She is also receiving regular support from her children in terms of some basic and immediate needs. She’s been engaged in this kind of service activity for 5 years already and earns approximately Php3,000.00 a month from this business activity.

In the year 2008, Silveriana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silveriana, as an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php5,000.00. She is requesting a loan amount of Php5,000.00 as her 7th loan availment to be used for an existing mini carenderia and snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, her child’s education, insurance and possible business expansions. 
		
About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mini eatery and snack vending business

loans.name: Kibimbiri Development Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
With modest earnings he has been able to make the best of the bad bargains that have hit his garment sales business occasionally. N. David, aged 52 years, is a member of the Kibimbiri development group in Kihihi, and he gleefully reveals how, with his small profits, he is able to educate three out of his six children who are still enrolled in different institutions of learning.

He operates a six-year-old garment sales business from Kihihi town, selling clothes at monthly and weekly markets in the area and earns about $143 on a monthly basis. What has inspired him most about his business is having learned the prevailing market in the area from local occupants. It is for this reason that he wants to get this loan to improve his financial gain prospects by restocking his business with attractive materials and more bales of clothes.

loans.use: purchase of clothes to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Elvira is widowed and has four school-aged children. Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion L., 28, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Joseph L., a security guard, and is the mother to two young children, one of whom is just starting his elementary years while the youngest is still toddling around at home. By the grace of God, Concepcion has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send both of her children all the way through college.

Concepcion operates a variety store where electronic cellular phone load has been incorporated into the inventory. She also does sideline work, doing direct selling of clothing, footwear and cosmetics. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy electronic cellular phone time from different network providers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Concepcion dreams to be able to encourage her family to join her faith, because as she said, “It is hard to achieve your dream if you are not active in your relationship with the Lord”. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Kirsy is the coordinator of her group Caminando con Jesus 3 & 4 (Walking with Jesus). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to watch television.

Kirsy is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for six months, starting with her husband's help. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling all kinds of clothes and different home-decoration items. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy a couch. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy home decorations and clothes

loans.name: Dashdeleg

texts.en:
Dashdeleg T. is 62 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife herds their livestock in the countryside during the summer months. Dashdeleg makes furniture in his own shop near the family home.
Dashdeleg worked for a government organization from 1970 to 2006; he started his carpentry business in 1980 to supplement his family's income. He is retired now and focuses on his woodwork. He usually produces a variety of wooden products according to his customers' orders. Dashdeleg wants to own a stall in the central market one day where he can expand his customer base, sell more furniture and further improve his family’s financial situation.
Dashdeleg is a talkative and open-minded man. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and furniture-making supplies (which will cost 500,000 MNT). He will send the rest of the money to his wife in the countryside in order to purchase and transport dairy products to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase wood and furniture-making supplies

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Fernando; El socio tiene 25 años de edad, el es conviviente y trabaja en una discoteca atendiendo la barra, el prepara todo tipo de bebidas alcohólicas; El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un mueble para su cuarto el socio desea comprar una cómoda para su cuarto. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una cómoda.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fernando belongs to the “Los Líderes” (The Leaders) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Fernando is 25 years old.  He lives with his partner and works as a barman in a disco.  He prepares all sorts of alcoholic drinks.  Fernando is requesting a loan to invest in buying a piece of furniture for his room.  He is requesting this loan to buy a chest of drawers.

Fernando is grateful and appreciates his loan.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy a chest of drawers

loans.name: Ponclat Juvet

texts.fr:
IL fait de l’alimentation en plein étalage au marché, après ses études universitaires, n’ayant pas trouvé un poste de travail, il se lance dans le commerce des produits d'alimentation et des divers . Célibataire sans enfant,il est  en activité depuis 8 ans .
Par jour  en temps normal, il vend 50.000f, le prêt passé a été une école,   les différentes formations reçu lui ont ouvert l’esprit.
Il  veut recevoir  le nouveau  prêt et faire des stocks afin de vendre plus pendant la période des fêtes de fin d’année. IL va acheter : 10carton des biscuits, 10 cartons de bonbons ,biscuits, chocolat,5cartons des jus à pipette pour les petits enfants, 2cartons de lait en poudre, 2 cartons de lait concentrés, 2 cartons de sardines 1carton de pots de mayonnaise, 1cartons de macédoines, 1 carton des petits pois. En vendant  beaucoup pendant cette période des fêtes, il va augmenter ses épargnes.
Très ambitieux, il veut ouvrir  une boutique pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
This man displays his food in the market. After his university studies he was not able to find a job and thus set himself up in the business of selling food products and other items. He is a single man without any children and he has been working for eight years. In a normal day he sells 50,000 francs of goods. The last loan he received was for school and the different training he has had has opened his mind. 

He would like to get a new loan to build up his stock, in order to be able to sell more during the end of year festive season. He is going to buy: ten boxes of biscuits, ten cartons of candy, biscuits and chocolate, five cartons of juice with straws for small children, two cartons of powdered milk, two cartons of concentrated milk, two cartons of sardines, one carton of pots of mayonnaise, one carton of mixed diced vegetables and one carton of peas. By selling a large quantity of products during this festive season he will increase his savings. He is very ambitious and would like to open a shop to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cartons of milk, canned foods, spaghetti and bags of sugar

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Phebe P. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Phebe is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Phebe owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Phebe has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Phebe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Phebe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Phebe is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Phebe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 56, sells vegetables, earning an income of 6 USD per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. The family spends 80 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and 47 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase more vegetables to resell. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sajor A.

texts.en:
Sajor A. J. is approximately a thirty-five-year-old man. He was born in the village of Affair, in northern Sierra Leone. However, Sajor now lives in Kabala town together with his wife and two children who are attending primary school. Sajor has been a businessman for many years now. He sells drinks, sardines, powder milk, batteries, soaps, candles, etc.  

Sajor has requested for a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 from Kiva field partner, Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock. In this way, his business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into his business.

loans.use: Buys drinks, sardines, powder milk, batteries, soaps, candles, etc.

loans.name: Reziel

texts.en:
Reziel is 34-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. Reziel has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Reziel is borrowing PHP 12,000 in order to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Reziel hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to buy additional stock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman who lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a hog raising business.  Her husband Felix helps her run the businesses.  They have 6 children who are between 36 and 41 years old.  All of them now  have their own family. 

Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gloria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6 cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use as working capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Gloria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To use as working capital for businesses

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Латипов Бозор проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 50 лет. Он женат, имеет 6 детей. Его дети находятся в России на заработках. Сам Бозор имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. По специальности работает 10 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Bozor L. lives in the Kulob Region. He is 50 years old. He is married, with six children. His children temporarily work in Russia. Bozor has secondary specialized education; he is a driver. He has been exercising this profession for 10 years. In addition, in his free time he does farming. He has a land plot near his house, where he grows wheat and plants fruit trees. He has been doing this for over 7 years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase seeds.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds

loans.name: Tom Ondong

texts.en:
Tom Ondong O. is a gentleman of 36 years. He is married to Rose Achieng and together they have five children. They live in the Mitume area in the outskirts of Kitale. Tom has a shop where he charges car batteries; he has been in this business for eight years and gets a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be Tom's first loan with KADET LTD, and with this loan, he plans to buy battery acid and electronic switches to boost his work. With the income he will get, he wants to use it to repay the loan. 

In the future, Tom wants to educate his children to the highest level, give them a comfortable life and also expand his business.

loans.use: To add stock like electronic switches, battery acid, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas, a 31-year-old mother of two children aged three and five years, is married to John Chumba, who is a driver. Dorcas has owned a grocery business in the Kimaam trading centre for the past four years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 5,400.

Dorcas has received her first loan of Ksh 20,000 from KADET LTD to pay for the cabbages (Ksh 700), green maize (Ksh 3,000), tomatoes (Ksh 5,000), onions (Ksh 3,300) and charcoal (Ksh 8,000) she ordered from the local suppliers. The anticipated additional profits from the business will be used to open a retail shop.

Her dreams are to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to pay for the vegetables and fruits she ordered from the farmers

loans.name: Jesutin Group

texts.fr: JESUTIN est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier et pratiquent tous la même religion. La présidente du groupe, Cécile (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 22 Novembre 1961 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, mais qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Cécile vit donc seule et s'est installée depuis neuf ans au quartier Gbokpa à Djèrègbé dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Il y a environs neuf ans que Cécile fait le commerce de noix de coco et de friperies de façon secondaire à son domicile. Cécile achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile avait bénéficié de crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle avait tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa cliente, Cécile ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Cécile sollicite à nouveau un financement de ALIDé. Dans l'avenir, Cécile envisage acheter une parcelle et s'y installer.
texts.en:
JESUTIN is a group of four people whose members live together in the same neighborhood and practice the same religion. 

Cecile, the group's president (seen in the photo with her hand raised), was born November 22, 1961 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She is a widow and the mother of three independent children, all of whom have attended school. Cecile, who lives alone, settled 9 years ago in Gbopka, a district of Djèrègbé in the town of Sèmè-Podji, in Benin. 

Cecile started to sell coconuts and used clothing from her house about 9 years ago. She gets her merchandise in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Previous loans obtained from ALIDé were all fully repaid. Facing a steadily increasing demand from her client base, Cecile wants to increase her working capital and bolster her activities to better meet the needs of her customers. This is why she is seeking another loan from ALIDÉ. 

In the future, Cecile would like to buy a piece of land and settle there.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, used clothing and various other items

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is 38 years old and the mother of seven children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Irshaad takes care of them very well and tries to give them comfort by fulfilling their needs. 

She is married to F. M. who operates a sweetmeat-selling business. His shop is located in the market and he offers good quality and a variety of sweetmeats to his customers. Irshaad also helps him by preparing sweetmeats for his shop. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, her husband will buy required items such as sugar, milk, dried fruits and cooking oil, etc. to prepare a larger quantity of sweetmeat and sell them at a better profit. 

Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for her husband and he will be able to gain maximum profits from it. 

She belongs to Arifwala, a small city which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. Her house contains 3 rooms where she has been living with her family for the past 10 years.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for her husband's sweetmeat-sales business.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina, de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Efraín de 36 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación para un mejor porvenir. Ricardina, es una mujer muy laboriosa, posee un puesto de venta, negocio que le ayuda a salir adelante. Ella es comerciante, tiene una tienda en donde vende productos de primera necesidad que se encuentra ubicado dentro de su comunidad. Su negocio es muy concurrido es así que lo abre desde muy temprano por la mañana, lista para recibir a sus primeros compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 05 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias abriendo un pequeño mini Marquet. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería.
texts.en: Ricardina is a hardworking 38-year-old woman who lives in her own home with her husband, Efrain age 36, and their 3 children, to whom she wishes to give a good education for a better future. Ricardina is an assiduous woman who runs a stand, and this business helps her get ahead. She is a small business owner who sells basic need items out of a store located in her community. Her business is well-frequented, so she opens very early in the morning, ready to receive her first customers, who will no doubt purchase something because of the wide variety of goods that she offers. What she likes most about her job is conversing with her customers because this is one of the skills that she employs in order to gain more customers. She has been in business for 5 years, and what she considers to be the most difficult aspect of her job is staying on her feet almost all day long. In time, she hopes to increase her earnings by opening a mini market. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels that this loan will help her a lot with her business progress, and she is willing to make her repayments punctually, according her payment plan. With this loan, she will purchase more provisions to restock her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to restock her shop.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok is a 42-year-old married man who works in a rubber plant in the province of Siem Reap. From this, he earns an income of around $4.25 each day to use for the family's daily expenses. To earn more income, Mr. Sok’s wife has been planting a few fruit trees on their land. They are blessed with two children who are studying in the local school and depend on their income for support. The rainy season is approaching, so Mr. Sok has requested  a loan to plant potatoes.

loans.use: plant potatoes

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is a domestic farmer who has been living in Kompong Cham Province. She normally spends most of her time in the farming business. She always uses her fertile farm to grow a few crops and her husband frequently helps in the crop-planting business. 

For more profit, Sim catches fish on the lake. 

The couple has given birth to three children. One is also employed in the farming business while the other two are still enrolled in school. 

Sim will use the loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her farmland and to purchase potato seeds, insecticides and fertilizers for her crops. With the rest, she will purchase some planks to repair her old wall.

loans.use: to hire a plowing machine to plow her farmland and to purchase potato seeds, insecticides and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is married and has two children. His family lives in Bilasuvar, Internally Displaced Settlement. 

Mubariz has a grocery store and sells food items. His business boasts fresh groceries, reasonable prices, flexible and quality client service, and uniqueness and variety of merchandise. Mubariz works hard to develop his business and make his business profitable. 

He started with working capital of 200 USD which he took from AqroInvest CU, and another two loans also helped him to reach goals and bring him to his current success. Mubariz is requesting a loan of 1300 AZN to reconstruct and modernize his grocery store, to increase turnover capital and to purchase an assortment of goods for retail sale. Mubariz is planning to use the generated profit to remodel his old house. 

Mubariz is a conscientious and focused manager of his resources and always plans his time and finances. In all his business dealings, he is guided by a sense of trust and goodwill towards others, especially to AqroInvest CU. We believe these qualities will help him repay his loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to modernize his grocery store and to purchase more food merchandise for retail sale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 69 years old and married. She has eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Manuela has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Manuela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

 In the future, Manuela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est une femme  âgée de 40 ans. Elle est  mariée  å un retraité. Elle a un  enfant. 
Akou  travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle  vend de la boisson locale  à toutes personnes  servis à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Tabligbo. Elle travaille  seule pour satisfaire la demande. Au moment, de sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir  servir à volonté sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroître.
Akou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bidons de boisson.
texts.en:
Akou is a 40-year-old woman who is married to a retiree and has one child.

Akou became a reseller in 2005. She sells a local beverage from her home to a clientele consisting of all types of people. She buys her stock in Tabligbo and works alone. At present time, her main challenge is not being able to meet customer demand, which is increasing steadily.

Akou is seeking her first loan from WAGES to stock up on drums of this local beverage.

loans.use: to buy drums of the local beverage SODABI

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old and married to Nyambura. They have three school-going children. He has practiced farming for six years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy, aged 38, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s married to Edgardo, her business partner and is the mother of one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. She is currently working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Joy earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual items. She also retails rice in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Joy hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery, just as she hopes to provide the daily needs of her family and give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Olga Sylvie

texts.fr: Olga Sylvie est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un dentiste du nom de Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Olga Sylvie assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Olga Sylvie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Olga Sylvie mène comme activité, la vente de chaussures, des produits de mercerie et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire. Olga Sylvie s'approvisionne au Togo et au Nigeria, États voisins du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Olga Sylvie sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Olga Sylvie is 40 years old and is married to a dentist named Roger. The couple has four children, who all attend school and are in their care. Olga Sylvie provides for the family's various expenses together with her husband, thanks to the income from her activity. Olga Sylvie left school in middle school.
For about ten years, Olga Sylvie has been in the business of selling shoes and haberdashery items; she also sells prepaid phone cards as a side activity. Olga Sylvie gets her supplies from Togo and Nigeria, Benin's neighboring states.
This is the fourth time that Olga Sylvie has requested a loan from ALIDé. The loan will be used to grow her business and to better satisfy her customers. Previous loans have been repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy shoes and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Yanmah

texts.en:
Yanmahh is 52 years old and lives in Garnerville. She is a widow and she has seven children, between 25 and 37 years old. One of her children still lives at home and is currently in school, while the others are on their own.

For the past twenty eight years, Yanmahh has been selling oil, pepper, rice and onions. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit. Some problem she faces is shortage of goods. Yanmahh is requesting a loan to purchase oil, pepper, rice, and onions for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase oil, pepper, rice, and onion for her business.

loans.name: Sreyvart

texts.en: Srey Vart is 24 years old and lives in Kampongcham province with her family. She earns $2 a day by selling groceries, while her husband earns $5 a day working for a non-governmental organization. They have a child who is one year old. Every month, she spends $83 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other items. She is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use when traveling to and from work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use when commuting.

loans.name: Mohran

texts.en: Mohran is a 28-year-old, married man living with his wife. He has 13 years experience working in the construction field. In 2006, he started to work on his own. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works in local projects upon client request. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to purchase more wood for his latest project. In the future, he plans to improve his work and expand his business by taking on bigger projects and working with construction entrepreneurs to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his latest project

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es:
Luis tiene 19 años, es soltero y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, vive con sus padres e hijo en Salcedo, que se encuentra cerca de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Luis se describe como una persona tranquila de buen caracter y sobre todo muy cariñoso con su familia y sus animales.

Luis trabaja con sus padres en la crianza de cerdos para posteriormente venderlos. Es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi el cual va a ser invertido en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de sus animales, debido a que con el balanceado los cerdos crecen saludables y al momento de su venta son de buena calidad y estos aspectos ayudarán que Luis tenga muy buenos ingresos manteniendo a su familia y el terminando sus estudios.

Su sueño es ser profesional y dar el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis is 19, single, and has a three year-old son. He lives with his parents and son in Salcedo, which is near Latacunga in the Sierra Central region of Ecuador.  

Luis desribes himself as an easy-going person of good character, and above all, very loving with his family and his animals.  Luis and his parents raise animals for later sale. 

This is the first loan he has taken out with Fodemi. He will use it to buy balanced feed for his animals, because with balanced feed pigs grow up healthy, and are good quality at the time they are sold. These factors will help Luis to have very good income for supporting his family and completing his education.

His dream is to be a professional, and provide his son with an education.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Maibel Antonia

texts.es: Meibel de 42 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de Barranquilla, allí se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir  de manera individual y a la medida,  y también aplica el sistema de maquila a terceros,  es decir grandes empresas le envían las piezas cortadas y ella aplica la costura.  Su negocio lo inició en el año 2000, pues en el año 1989 había estudiado modistería y con una máquina sencilla, poco a poco empezó a ganar clientela; su trabajo en la  microempresa, le ofreció la oportunidad de ahorrar y comprar 5 máquinas más y generar un empleo. Sus ventas las hace a crédito a negocios en Ciénaga ( departamento del Magdalena) y a vecinos del sector de Soledad. La necesidad del negocio es la adquisición de una cortadora industrial y una mesa de corte, porque esta fabricando jeans y es muy lento el corte con tijera.Su meta más adelante es agregar a su taller la venta de telas, ubicándose en un local en la vía principal.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una cortadora industrial, una mesa para corte , planeando mejorar  los tiempos productivos por la cantidad de productos, que a futuro con esta infraestructura puede fabricar. Su margen de contribución promedio actual es del 30,33% , mientras su rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es inferior a un 25,89% y desde aquí proyectamos su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Meibel is 42 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla. There she sews clothing that she designs herself or is designed by other people through a third-party system. In other words, large companies send her pieces to sew and she assembles the final product. Meibel started her business in 2000. She completed her fashion studies in 1989 and owned a simple machine. Over time, she began gaining customers. The work in her microenterprise provided the opportunity for her to save. She bought five more machines and was able to start offering jobs. Meibel sells her products on credit to businesses in Ciénaga (in the Department of Magdalena) and to her neighbors in Soledad. Her business needs an industrial cutting machine and a cutting table because it is very slow to cut with scissors when making jeans.

Her goal further on in the future is to combine her sewing workshop with a fabric store that is located in a shop on the main avenue. Meibel is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, which is also her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The money will be used to buy an industrial cutting machine and a cutting table. She plans to improve her production times so that she can generate more products. In the future, she will have the infrastructure to handle this. Her contribution margin currently averages around 30.33%. Meanwhile, her sales profitability is no less than 25.89%, which is a an indication of growth.

loans.use: to buy an industrial cutting machine and a cutting table.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years of age and a farmer in his community. He has been operating this business for a year and it really helps him more to support his family. Because of the disastrous typhoon occurring in their province, his expected production in his crops was not attained--many of his crops were destroyed. For this reason he is in need of additional working capital to renew his corn field. This is also to recover the costs spent and provide for his child and wife. 

Right now, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers. These inputs would have a great positive effect on the development of his farming, which will allow Jonathan to provide sufficient financial support for the studies of his child and for the family's daily basic needs at home.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Nun

texts.en: Nun, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Nun is a farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. Nun is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more piglets to raise for sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Generosas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició gracias a la señora María. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. El grupo se denomina “Mujeres Generosas”. Están en el Quinto Ciclo, con 18  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable. Todas ellas desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ofelia, quien se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas, comenta que siempre tiene muy buen trabajo, ya que siempre está llena de pedidos. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que lucha por el bien de su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos para abastecer su local.
texts.en:
This lending group started thanks to Maria - she contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in their area. The group is named "Mujeres Generosas" and they are in their 15th cycle and have 18 members. This group stands out in their neighborhood because it is very united and responsible. They all want to get ahead and help their families.

One of the members is Ofelia, who makes all types of garments. She says that she always has plenty of work and is always full with orders. She says she is a hardworking woman who makes sacrifices to fight for her family's well-being. 

She asks for a loan to buy fabric, threads, buttons, zippers and other products to stock her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргизе 30 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2002 года. Муж работает  парикмахером. Наргиза торгует на рынке детской и женской одеждой, за товаром ездит сама. Привозит товар каждую неделю на такси. У нее есть маленькие дети, она оставляет их дома на  попечение свекрови. Торгуя на рынке она копит деньги на покупку квартиры. Кредит получает на увеличение товарооборота, а именно теплых видов одежды.
texts.en: Nargiza is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2002.  Her husband works as a barber.  Nargiza sells children's and women's clothing at a market and travels for merchandise herself.  She brings in merchandise every week, using a taxi.  Nargiza has small children and leaves them with her mother-in-law to look after.  She is saving money for the purchase of an apartment by selling at the market.  She is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman having five children. Margie is 36-years-old, residing at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Margie owns and operates a farm land, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale to earn a living and she's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 43,000.00 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay cost for farm maintenance. 

In 2000, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. In the future, Margie wants to make improvements to her house and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay cost for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the area of her store and purchase supplies and stock.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Fanta. She is a widow and has three children ages 25, 20, and 18 years. In 1990, Fanta established her frozen fish business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband with some responsibilities. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week for 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Fanta requires a loan to purchase more fish to resell. She hopes that this loan will support her through proper use. In the future, Fanta plans to erect a house and to make more profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of garri (150 to 200 bags)

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sabine Eulalie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, est âgée de 47 ans. Sabine Eulalie a très fréquenté l’école. Sabine Eulalie est mariée à conducteur du nom de Ibrahim. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Sabine Eulalie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Sabine Eulalie vend des boissons en canette dans sa région depuis six ans environ. Parallèlement à son activité, Sabine Eulalie vend également des conserves, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Sabine Eulalie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sabine Eulalie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement MAHOUGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons en canettes.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул сильная и мудрая женщина из района Кубадиён. Ей 50 лет и она замужем. Её дети очень любят свою мать. Старшие её сыновья находятся на заработках в другой стране. Сама Орзигул работает уборщицей в больнице своего района. Однако её зарплата очень маленькая и этой зарплаты нехватает чтобы купить даже один мешок муки.
