Поэтому Орзигул одновременно занимается растениеводством. Она каждый год сажает разные виды овощей и получит хороший урожай. Благодаря её упорной работе, она смогла прокормить свою семью. В этом году посеяла урожай, но у нее не хватило денег на покупку минеральных удобрений. Без удобрений она не сможет, получит урожай и в этом году останется без средств проживания. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется только на кредит.
texts.en: Орзигул сильная и мудрая женщина из района Кубадиён. Ей 50 лет и она замужем. Её дети очень любят свою мать. Старшие её сыновья находятся на заработках в другой стране. Сама Орзигул работает уборщицей в больнице своего района. Однако её зарплата очень маленькая и этой зарплаты нехватает чтобы купить даже один мешок муки. Поэтому Орзигул одновременно занимается растениеводством. Она каждый год сажает разные виды овощей и получит хороший урожай. Благодаря её упорной работе, она смогла прокормить свою семью. В этом году посеяла урожай, но у нее не хватило денег на покупку минеральных удобрений. Без удобрений она не сможет, получит урожай и в этом году останется без средств проживания. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется только на кредит.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Novissi-

texts.en:
The “Novissi-D.” Women’s Association represents an eight-woman solidarity group. They all run small businesses that bring in a modest income. However, these women and everyone in their village face a serious problem as regards drinking-water, which is desperately lacking locally. The consequences are severe, with continuing elevated rates of diarrhea and related illnesses, as well as infant mortality, in the area.

For reasons of health and daily life, these women are requesting a loan of $2,000 to drill a hole for a well. The resulting drinking water will be managed by the Association and sold to the population. This project therefore has not only an economic aspect but more importantly a humanitarian one, which merits support and financing. The conviction of these women, and especially their ability to manage and make their business activities profitable, is evidence that this project will be a fine achievement for the well-being of the entire village and its surrounding area.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J,V. Guy-Bray:

Le Groupement féminin « NOVISSI-D. » est constitué de 8 femmes organisées en groupe de solidarité. Elles ont toutes de petites activités sous la main qui leurs procurent de petit revenu. Cependant, ces femmes et tout le village sont confrontés au sérieux problèmes d’eau potable qui manque cruellement dans le milieu. Les conséquences sont lourdes avec des maladies diarrhéiques et la mortalité infantile encore élevée dans la zone.

Pour les besoins de santé et de vie, ces femmes sollicitent un crédit de $2000 pour construire un forage. L’eau potable sera gérée par le groupement et vendue à la population. Ainsi, ce projet a, non seulement un aspect économique mais plutôt humanitaire qui mérite d’être soutenu et financé. La bonne foi de ces femmes et surtout leur capacité de gérer et de rentabiliser leurs activités est une preuve que ce projet sera une belle réussite pour le bien-être de tout le village et ses environs.

loans.use: To drill a borehole for drinking water

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Sister Lydia is a trader who buys foodstuffs from farmers in the rural areas and transports them to the urban markets. She needs a loan of $850 to expand her business. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She is also familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She will be able to manage the loan because she keeps her records very well.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Azamjohn

texts.en: R. Azamjohn began his trade activity while still in school – to help his father and his large family. After he graduated, he worked for 3 years as his father's assistant and was entrusted with running the store on his own. He intended to enter the Commercial Institute for higher education, but has postponed this plan for a while because there is no one else to assist his father. He would like to use the loan to increase the supply of goods in the store and to eventually hire a salesman.

loans.use: To increase the supply of goods in his electronics store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a grocery stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Flor Ibeth

texts.es:
Flor separated from her husband and currently lives with her eldest daughter. After the separation, she decided to open a tire repair shop in the outskirts of the city. She thought it was a good business venture, but things did not turn out as she had expected.

Flor decided to try another business idea and opened a general store/catering service in her home. Her daughter is studying to obtain a technical degree in IT and also helps her mother with the store. Sales are good, especially on weekends because their shop is located in the main square of her neighborhood and she wishes to increase her product range to meet the demands of the clients who visit the town square after sunset.

Flor is requesting a $1200 loan to increase her stock. Let´s make a contribution so this hard working single mom can achieve her aspirations.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Flor vive sólo con su última hija; a raíz de la separación de su esposo, se dedicó a crear su propio negocio e instaló con mucho entusiasmo una vulcanizadota en las afueras de la ciudad creyendo que daría resultado sin embargo la realidad fue otra, abandonó su propósito y surgió en ella otra idea y aperturó una bodega en casa paralelamente incursionó en la preparación y venta de comida regional como actividad secundaria para percibir ingresos extras siempre contando con la ayuda de su hija que aparte de colaborar se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de computación e informática en un instituto de formación profesional de su ciudad.Por la aceptación y las buenas ventas, en especial los fines de semana, que obtiene flor debido a que su bodega esta al frente de la plaza en el barrio que habita, se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar sus productos, para poder atender la demanda de sus clientes que salen a recrearse a la plaza diariamente cuando cae el sol.La suma que solicita flor para cubrir las necesidades y poder tener los productos en stock es de 1200 dólares.Contribuyamos para que esta afanosa madre pueda alcanzar lo que se propone.

loans.use: Purchase stock to increase product offer

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: I am Arshad B.. I live in the small semi-urban town of Raiwind in Pakistan. I am married and have two boys. I live with my family in a one-room brick house. I am not educated, but I am aware of the importance of education. I have enrolled my elder son in kindergarten, but the other boy is too young to attend school yet. My husband uses his vehicle to provide public transportation. His vehicle needs maintenance and few spare parts. This is our only source of income. Please help us and lend us $225 for this purpose.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo A. is 27 and a married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She has been in this business for nearly five years. With the income she earns, she helps pay the family's expenses and pays for 25% of her children's school fees. With this loan, Mrs. A. would like to expand her business in order to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Adzo A. est agée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous à l'école. Elle exerce cette activité depus bientôt 5 ans. Avec les revenus de son activité elle participe aux dépenses du foyer et supporte à 25% la scolarité de ses enfants. Avec ce crédit madame Adzo souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bales of traditional cloth for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha B., age 30, is single and owns a small general store, which she started 3 years ago. She earns about $90 a month from this business.

In the past, Asha successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to purchase shop inventory for her business. She now hopes for a loan for the same purpose. Asha belongs to a loan group called Molemo.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Chahongir

texts.en:
Chahongir K. is 26 years old. He is married and has one adorable little girl.

Chahongir provides taxi services. Actually, Chahongir started his entrepreneurial activities ten years ago. He used to shoot video of his neighbors' wedding parties and other family events. Thus, Chahongir saved sufficient money to purchase his car. Certainly, he could not afford to buy himself a new expensive vehicle. Instead, Chahongir purchased an old car that was produced during Soviet times. However, the vehicle is in rather good condition, and has allowed Chahongir to generate significant income for his family for the last seven years.

Now, he needs to purchase minor spare parts and tire-covers for the vehicle. For this purpose, Chahongir requests 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. This is the first loan for Chahongir and he promises to repay it on a timely basis. He thanks everyone trusting and supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts and tire-covers for his taxi.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Uth S. is a 46-year-old housewife residing in Kampong Cham. She stays home and cares for the three children still living in the family home. Two of her five children are employed as garment factory workers. She wants to purchase a motorbike for her husband so he can save time on his commute to work at various construction projects.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the commute to work.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys Y. sells used clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Her business is doing very well, and now  she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for additional capital to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: This loan will be used as additional capital to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
For the past 5 years, Isabel has sold products from the EBEL cosmetics line. Her clients are friends and mothers of children from the school where she works; Isabel is a teacher at the primarly education level. She also places her products in the beauty salon her mother has in her home.

The loans she has requested have been used to buy more products from EBEL.

Isabel´s mother has a beauty salon in her home, and Isabel would like to start up another salon in partnership with her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel vende productos de la marca de cosméticos EBEL desde hace 5 años. Sus cientes son sus amigos y las madres de familia del colegio donde ella trabaja, ya que Isabel es profesora de Educación Primaria. También coloca sus productos en la peluquería que su mamá tiene en la casa.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para comprar más productos EBEL.

La mamá de Isabel tiene una peluquería en su casa, por lo que a ella le gustaría poner otra peluquería más, en asociación con ella.

loans.use: Purchase more products from the EBEL cosmetics line.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela raises cattle for a living. She sells the milk the cattle produce to the Industrialized Milk Plan. She lives in the Ninachiri community of Laja, a part of the Los Andes province, about three hours from the capital city La Paz. Graciela lives together with her husband a four children who range in age from 20-13 years old. Her husband works as a long distance trucker.

The requested loan will be used to purchase an additional high-breed milk cow in order to increase her home’s milk production and thus increase her income. This is the first loan Graciela has requested from IMPRO, but the evaluation completed by IMPRO has approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Graciela se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la comunidad Ninachiri de sector de Laja provincia Los Andes a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como transportista de larga distancia, y sus cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 14 y 13 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar su producción de leche, lo cual le dará posibilidades reales de aumentar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow in order increase milk production.

loans.name: Adibahon

texts.ru:
Adibahon M., 28, lives in the village of Kipchak in Gissar district. She and her husband have four children. In order to support her family, Adibahon has a trading stall at the district market where she sells clothing. She has been in business for three years and is now applying for a loan to increase her sales volume. This loan will help Adibahon develop her business and increase her family's income.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Мухидинова Адибахон проживает в районе Гиссар в поселке Кипчак. Возраст 28 , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью она занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Мубориз» Гиссарского района. Торгует одеждой. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ей развивать свой бизнес и увеличить доход семьи.

loans.use: to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
For two years now, Roxana has had a restaurant in her house where she offers breakfasts and meals. She opens at 8a.m. and closes at 5 p.m. She also sells beer and sodas.

In the beginning, Roxana opened her restaurant in a rented space, however, for health reasons, she decided to move her restaurant to her home.

In addition, her mother has a small farm where she grows fruits, so Roxana also works distributing fruits wholesale to nearby merchants.

On top of that, Roxana has started selling cosmetics through catalogues two months ago.

The loans she has requested have been invested in furnishing her restaurant and helping her mother to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to grow fruit.

Roxana would like to expand her restaurant and open a poultry store.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 2 años, Roxana tiene un restaurante en su casa donde ofrece desayunos y menú. Ella abre a las 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 5 de la tarde. También vende cervezas y gaseosas.

En un principio, Roxana abrió su restaurante en un local alquilado, sin embargo por motivos de salud decidió mudar el restaurante a su casa.

Asimismo, su mamá tiene una chacra donde cultiva frutas. Es así que Roxana también reparte las frutas al por mayor a los mercados aledaños.

Por si fuera poco, Roxana ha empezado a vender cosméticos por catálogo desde hace dos meses.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha invertido para amoblar su restaurante y para ayudar a su mamá en la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas que necesita para el cultivo de la fruta.

Roxana quisiera ampliar su restaurante y poner una pollería.

loans.use: furnishing her restaurant and helping her mother to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to grow fruit (Para amoblar su restaurante y para ayudar a su mamá en la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas que necesita para el cultivo de la fruta.)

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi S. is 49 years old and married with ten children.  She has five years of experience working with her husband in the fabric printing business, and for many years has sold printed fabrics to people in her village.  Emi earns about $125 per week and is only able to access capital through microfinance institutions because traditional banks are reluctant to lend to her.  Emi is now requesting a loan of $300 to help her buy new ink and fabric for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, carved design, paint and brushes.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás, para solventar sus gastos económicos. Viaja constantemente para adquirir los vehículos en otras ciudades y traerlos para su venta en Puno y Juliaca. El trabajo de Javier no tiene horario, ya que viaja a diferentes horas y días de la semana, según se de la oportunidad de adquirir un nuevo vehículo, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que viajar tanto, ya que no le permite permanecer demasiado tiempo en un solo lugar, haciendo que sea muy cansado, pero Javier ha aprendido a sobrellevarlo, ya que le gusta mucho los autos y también conducirlos. Este muchacho quiere trabajar, ahora que es joven, nos dice, y forjarse un mejor porvenir, para asegurarse económicamente y formar una familia, a la cual pueda brindarles lo mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo arreglará uno de los autos que compró para poder venderlo a un precio mayor. En el futuro Javier quiere tener una gran empresa de compra y venta de autos, y alquilar un local donde poder ofrecerlos.
texts.en:
Javier is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He makes a living by buying and selling cars, an activity that he has been doing for the past 4 years in order to pay his bills. He constantly travels in order to acquire the vehicles in other cities and bring them to sell in Puno and Juliaca. Javier’s job does not have a schedule because he travels at different hours and days of the week based on the opportunities to buy new cars. The most difficult part of his job is traveling so much because it does not allow him to remain in one place for long. This makes him tired, but Javier has learned how to overcome it and very much likes the cars and driving them. This young man wants to work in order to build a better future, including financial security and a family, who he would want to provide the best available. With this loan, he will fix one of the cars he bought so that he can sell it at a high price. In the future, Javier wants to have a big business of buying and selling cars, and to rent a location to offer this service.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and improve a car he bought in order to resell it at a higher price

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella se ha dedicado a la agricultura durante casi toda su vida, ya que es proveniente D. una familia netamente ganadera y agricultora, es así que constantemente siembra habas, trigo, oca, olluco; por épocas D. siembra y cuando llega la cosecha la lleva a Huancayo a vender. También se dedica a la crianza D. animales como la vaca, cerdos y ovejas. Esta muy satisfecha con la labor que realiza, además D. ser la herencia y legado que le dejaron sus padres. Persevera a pesar D. que en muchas oportunidades las condiciones del clima y las bajas temperaturas ocasionaran perdidas en sus cosechas. Es la quinta vez que Lorenza solicita un préstamo en MFP, es una D. las clientas que ha demostrado ser  fiel y responsable en sus cuotas. Solicita este préstamo para la siembra la papa, comprará sacos D. abono para preparar su tierra para la semilla.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She has worked in agriculture for almost her whole life, since she comes from a cattle-raising and agriculture family. Because of this, she always plants broad beans, wheat, oca and olluco (tubers indigenous to Peru). For sowing times and when the harvest arrives, she brings it to Huancayo to sell her goods. She also raises animals like cows, pigs, and sheep. She is very satisfied with the work that she does, in addition to it being the inheritance and legacy that her parents left her. She perseveres in spite of the fact that at many times the weather conditions and low temperatures caused losses in her harvest. This is the fifth time that Lorenza has asked for a loan from MFP. She is one of the clients that has proven to be loyal and responsible in her repayments. She is requesting this loan to sow potatoes. She will also buy sacks of fertilizer to prepare her land for the seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is married and has 4 children. She is a 58 year old woman. Despite her age, she’s still strong, bright, and doing well with her business. She started her business processing dried fruits and selling them at the market 10 years ago. The business has been growing little by little, permitting her to cover her family's needs, especially those of her children. Her goal is to grow as a business owner; she likes the work she is doing.

Marhamat is very hopeful about this business; you can help by fulfilling her loan request. She is requestinga loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD). With these funds, she will purchase dried apricots, which will help her to increase the range of goods she sells.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots to sell

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng V. was born and raised in a farming family. She started growing rice and some other crops in 1980. The output is just sufficient for her household.

Her husband works making string cow and selling them at the market. With his business activity, he can generally make about US$ 4/day in income to support his household. Because of their lack of capital, Chhen V. didn’t have any idea how to make other profit beside working at her rice field.

After learning about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors, V. thought of an opportunity to generate additional profit for her household. She would like to take a loan in the amount of US$ 600 to buy rice crops from the growers and re-sell the rice when the price is going up. She believes this will help her increase her income as well as improving her living conditions. (her husband is pictured )

loans.use: To buy rice crops from the growers to re-sell for a profit

loans.name: Dayandur

texts.en: Dayandur was born in 1970. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has one child. He started his clothes-selling business eight years ago, and he is requesting a loan to stock up on seasonal clothes for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: Claire

texts.es:
Claire es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Claire es casada tiene 5 hijos de 31,27,21,13 y 7 años, los dos últimos están en la edad escolar. 
Claire es de Iquitos no pudo terminar de estudiar por que salió embarazada, y se dedico a criar a sus hijos,  su esposo no quiso que trabaje, su esposo es profesor  renuncio al trabajo y con la liquidación  se compró un carro ahora él es taxista. 
Claire necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, los va invertir en su carro, va pasar por revisión técnica. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos le son de mucha ayuda. Económicas, las cuentas en el  Bancomunal son trasparentes, todo legal y encuentra unidad entre las socias.  
El sueño de Claire es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Claire is a member of the community bank Unidas Triunfaremos (United we will triumph). She is married and has five children, ages 31, 27, 21, 13 and 7. The two youngest are of school age. Claire is from Iquitos - she did not finish school because she became pregnant and dedicated herself to raising her children. Her husband did not want her to work outside of the home. He was a professor but left his job and with his settlement bought a car and he now works as a taxi driver. Claire needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in the car, which needs an overhaul. Since she has aligned herself with Finca, the loans she has received have been of great help. She has found them to be economical, transparent, and legal, and she has found a unity among the membership. Her dream is that her children enter into professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the car, which needs an overhaul.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela L. S. es una señora muy emprendedora que desde hace un año se puso a vender pan en las colonias. Ella pone su producto en un carro y lo va ofreciendo con una bocina y el cliente sale a comprar. Ahora ella requiere de ayuda para invertir y así tener mas ingresos en su panadería la cual es llamada “La Bendición”
Entre su esposo y ella elaboran el pan desde temprano para en la tarde salir a venderlo.
texts.en:
Gabriela L. S. is a very hard working woman who, for a year now, has dedicated herself to selling bread in residential neighborhoods. She and her husband make the bread early in the morning so that they can go out to sell it in the afternoons. She packs her bread onto a cart and goes around, using a horn so that her clients know to come out of their houses to buy some. Now, she needs help so that she can invest in her business and increase her bakery's income. The name of her bakery is La Bendición - The Blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Siapai

texts.en: Siapai T., 34, is married with three children. This is her first loan with Kiva partner, SPBD, and she is requesting funds for a food stall business. Although she has no previous experience, she will be selling to the public seven days a week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (WST). SPBD loans are Siapai’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of mutton flaps, sacks of flour, sacks of onions and a gas stove

loans.name: Hasanjon

texts.ru: Хасанжон - мужчина 44 лет. Женат, имеет пятерых детей. Хасанжон занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой молока, сметаны и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Хасанжон в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота и рад, что кредитуется у нас.
texts.en:
Hasanjon is a 44-year-old man. He is married and has five children. Hasanjon raises and sells large- and small-horned cattle. He purchases cattle at the market and, after feeding them for two to three months, sells them at the same market. His wife processes the milk and cream, and sells them at the market. She also helps out at home on the farm, assisting her husband so that their financial situation might improve. Hasanjon, in turn, wants to increase the size of his herd and is pleased to be a loan customer of MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and trading cattle

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is already 30 years old. She is a business minded woman who is married to Tito Mellares, who works as a tricycle operator in their village. Her family is very religious that is why their four children are all named after the bible names. Their eldest is Apo Calypsis, 11 years old, second is Tessalonica, 6 years old, third is Acaya, 5 years old and the youngest is Macedonia, who is 7 months old. Their family peacefully lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Their children are all loving and obedient. They always help each other in their household chores and in their studies.

Daisy is engaged in a vending business that serves as her source of income. She sells vegetables, fish, rice, cooked snacks like “pancit” (a type of noodle dish) and other different food products. With her business, she is gaining an income of 300 pesos daily and it is really of big help to her husband to provide for their family’s needs. For almost two years she has been operating her vending business, Daisy is still not able to increase her income from her business. Thus she wanted to avail a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 for the productivity and improvement of her vending. The loan will be of big help to make her business profitable and will help to support the needs of her children, especially their educational needs.

loans.use: Business Improvement--food production.

loans.name: Yuh

texts.en:
G. is married and has six children. She makes a living selling pigs and goats. With this loan she plans to buy two goats for about $30 each and two piglets for about $40 each, along with two bags of feed. She also plans to do small repairs to her home.

This is G.’s second loan from GHAPE in the last year. She has purchased goats before, and has experience in using a loan for this purpose. She believes she will succeed because she has already built a pig and a goat house, and knows that there is enough land for the goats to feed on. 

G.'s living situation  does not work well for her. Her husband has married a second wife and she is not pleased with his decision. On top of that, she has lost her parents in the last two years. With this loan, she hopes to continue feeding her family and pay for her children’s school fees. 	

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy two goats, two piglets and animal feed as well as do some repairs

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo P., 42, is married and lives with three of his children. He works as a taxi driver in the Battambang province, typically making $5 each day.  He is supported by his wife (pictured) who works in a grocery store. Three of their children are in school. To make more money, Keo would like to ask for a loan of $800 to add grocery inventory for his wife to sell to meet customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 32 años, vive en la casa de su suegra junto a su esposo Juan de 29 años, el cual es electricista y sus hijos: Luis Enrique de 13 años y Ángelo de 5 meses. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada que siempre ha trabajado desde que era adolescente ayudando a su madre en las actividades que realizaba, posteriormente trabajó en la venta de lencería hasta que se conoció con a Juan, su pareja, y conformó su propia familia. Desde entonces se viene dedicando a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas, los cuales son muy demandados, por lo que le gusta su mucho su trabajo y la hace sentir independiente y realizada. A futuro, Vilma quiere viajar a provincias cercanas a la ciudad de Lima, para ahí vender su mercadería, puesto ya que ahí hay más demanda y puede obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Vilma se siente contenta de trabajar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que con su pequeño Ángelo ahora tienen más necesidades que cubrir y pensar en su futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que obtenga lo usará para la compra de mayor cantidad de zapatillas, Vilma está muy ilusionada con su negocio y confía en que le dará buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Vilma is 32 years old. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband Juan, 29 years old and an electrician, and their two sons: Luis Enrique – 13, and Angelo – 5 months.

Since she was a teenager, Vilma has always worked hard. She started by helping with her mother’s business. She sold lingerie prior to meeting her husband and starting a family. At the moment, she sells shoes and slippers which are in high demand. She greatly enjoys her work because it gives her a sense of independence and accomplishment. In the future, Vilma wants to travel to nearby provinces around the city of Lima to sell her products. She believes there is more demand in those areas and opportunity for larger profits. Vilma is happy to work and help her husband with the household expenses, especially now that her little Angelo has many more needs and she is concerned about his future.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time. The money she received will be used to purchase more slippers. Vilma is very excited about her business and hopes it will result in good returns.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase selection of merchandise

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 45 years old. He is married with two children. He has been in clothing sales business for 7 years. Vasil used to work as an accountant.
He would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to increase his inventory. Vasil uses every business opportunity to increase his sales and profit.

loans.use: increase his inventory

loans.name: Filida's Group

texts.en:
M. Filida is 48 years old. She is married with 6 children between 20 and 30 years of age. She also has 9 dependents, including one adopted child who is 6 years old. Filida is a fish monger on Lake Victoria. She sells her fish at Mpunge–Buleebi Kachanga. Thanks to previous loans, she also has 12 cows and sells 40 litres of milk per week for additional income.

She is also a farmer and this helps to provide food for home consumption and the excess is sold off for an income. Her specific purpose for this loan is to buy more fishing materials and employ labour on her farm so that she could earn more.

loans.use: Buying fishing materials and employing labour on her farm.

loans.name: Precious Group

texts.en:
Vida started her fish sales five years ago. She takes delivery of fishes from Yeji in the eastern region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish many customers buy from her stand. She is now fifty four (54) years old she is divorced with five children. She is currently taking care of two in school whiles the others are working. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Precious’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members in this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes.

loans.name: Gertrude's Group

texts.en: N. Gertrude is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children aged between 28 – 12 years and she takes care of 2 other dependents. She is a businesswoman with a retail shop in Kyenda, Kitenga subcounty that she has been running for 5 years and she is able to make reasonable profit that helps to look after her family and put aside some savings. She is a friendly and hard-working lady and this is key in her good customer care skills. She needs a loan to be able to pay her children’s school fees and for restocking her shop with more products.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children and restocking her retail shop

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en: S. Patrick is a responsible and married man with 5 children all in Primary school. He is a hardworking and friendly man with a live stock business that he has been running for 1 year. Before this business, Patrick was and is still a farmer and it’s the savings from his farming that he started up the livestock plus the help from loans. Patrick says that his main business challenge is the expensive costs of feeds plus the disease out breaks that affects the growth of the birds. He says that he is grateful for his family’s support and he would like to grow his business more and build a family house so that he could stop renting which is costly. Patrick would like to grow his business more by buying more feeds and drugs for improved quality.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feeds and drugs for improved quality.

loans.name: Fatana Group

texts.en:
Fatana is the leader of the four-member Fatana group. The group want to take a loan to improve and expand their businesses.

Fatana wants to take a loan for bead working.

Fwrzhan wants to take a loan for her husband's car part shop.

Shokori wants to take a loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver.

Roshan Gul wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

They are very happy that Kiva lenders are able to support entrepreneurs all around the world.

loans.use: To expand and improve her bead-working business

loans.name: Ayet

texts.en: Ayet M. is currently in the business of selling beer, bread and charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Ayet is 22 years old and is married to a nurse. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar and a charcoal store. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T.  is currently in the business of selling fresh green vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase pulses (beans, peas, groundnuts) and maize flour to sell.  Lucia is 40 years old and is a widow.  She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase pulses and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Mrs. Nora P. is from the village of Magsaysay in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 school-aged children. She grows and sell rice in the local  community. She earns PHP 4,000.00 monthly from her business. 

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000.00 to use as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice business

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2000, she has been working as a silk weaver to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 in profit every day, while her husband sells grocery items. On average, he is able to make US$ 3 per day as well. This couple has one young child. Neange S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 which her husband needs to increase his grocery inventory. This will be a good chance for this family to better their standard of living.

loans.use: buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Noeurn N. is 32 years old and lives in Preaek Khmaer village in the Kandal province. He is the husband of Mrs. Tai Cham, who is a garment-factory worker. They have two children, who are 8 and 5 years old. They are both in school. 

Mr. Noeurn N. and his wife are farmers. This month is a season for cultivating rice but he does not have enough money to grow rice. Thus, he requested his third loan to buy vegetable seeds and rice seeds for cultivating in his own field.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and rice seeds for cultivating in his own field

loans.name: Mahamatmuso

texts.en:
Mahamatmuso A. is 28 years old. He is married with two children. Eleven years ago Mahamatmuso decided to start his own business selling carpet. Since he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur, Mahamatmuso began his business with his hard earned savings. He is familiar with the business and provides good customer service. He has many clients and his business keeps growing. In order to satisfy the high demand, he now needs a loan in the amount of $3000 USD which he will use to purchase more inventory. Be a part of this business and of Mahamatmuso's family by supporting his growing business, they greatly appreciate it!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. It is also a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase plates, dishes, jugs,and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Cesar Apolonio

texts.es: Cesar tiene 37 años de edad, casado, cuenta con dos hijos  un barón y una mujer, se dedica a prestar servicio de lavado de autos y parqueo, su esposa se dedica a cuidar la casa y los hijos, solicita un crédito a ASDIR para comprar una aspiradora que le servirá para mejorar el servicio. Anteriormente ha trabajado créditos y las ha pagado bien, es una persona que tiene muchos deseas de superar.
texts.en:
Cesar, 37, is married and has two children: one boy and one girl. He provides parking and auto-washing services; his wife takes care of the home and the children. He is asking ASDIR for funds to buy a vacuum cleaner that will make it possible for him to improve his service. He has managed loans previously and he has repaid on time; he is a person who wants to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vacuum cleaner.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is a 53-year-old businesswoman who has been a member of ASHI since 2004. She enjoys playing various roles being a woman. But apart from being a child who supports her parents, a supportive housewife and a loving mother to her 16-year-old child and grandmother to her six-year-old grandchild, what challenges her most is her role being a poor woman wanting to rise from poverty. Her membership in ASHI and the opportunity of getting a loan from that institution makes her feel hopeful that someday her dreams will come true.

Despite her busy schedule in managing and growing her small canteen, which was put up through the loans she received from ASHI, Merlyn makes sure that she can always attend ASHI’s weekly center meeting where she pays her weekly amortization, meeting her group members as well as the rest of the members of ASHI in their center. This is because Merlyn treasures the opportunity she has able to obtain because of ASHI. Now that ASHI has partnered with Kiva, Merlyn’s hope of expanding her business is strengthened. She is requesting a much larger loan to grow her canteen. Through the profits of her business, she wishes to support the education of her child and grandchild who live with her, until they graduate from college.  

For a microfinance that uses Grameen methodology, ASHI being the first practitioner in the field saw how these poor women mothers work hard to earn money for the cash flow of her family and to provide her children a better life. Because micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly in their villages and in the doorstep of their house, together with the loan handed over to them is giving them hope that someday they will “rise above poverty” (direct translation of Ahon Sa Hirap, in English).

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, utensils, and inventory for her canteen.

loans.name: Mohamed Alpha

texts.en:
Mohamed Alpha K. is married and has seven children, of whom three are school-going. He is 38 years old.

Mohamed entered the trading world as a petty trader selling articles such as Sudrex (pain relieving and fever reducing tablets), cream, Vaseline, paste, brushes, etc. Having raised some substantial amount of money he then switched from the sale of articles to textiles materials. He now owns a shop close to a popular cotton tree. He has ten years experience in business. 

Mohamed is therefore seeking a loan to buy more stock so as to generate more income. He intends to open a savings bank account that he will use to educate his children and eventually construct a dwelling house.

loans.use: To buy more textiles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Amanda Aurelia

texts.es:
Amanda de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 10 años, trabaja con su esposo en su taller de cerrajería. 

Amanda y su esposo se conocieron en un taller de cerrajería ella era ayudante y el era cerrajero, su amor fue creciendo y se casaron después de un tiempo ellos decidieron tener su propio negocio invirtiendo sus ahorros, ahora ella y su esposo trabajan en su propio taller de cerrajería, el taller esta ubicado en el garaje de su casa. Hacen puertas de metal, ventanas y todo tipo de cerrajerías. 

Con el préstamo Amanda quiere comprar hierro para su negocio. Tiene proyectado tener otro negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Amanda is 42 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. She has two children, ages 12 and 10, and works with her husband at their locksmith shop.

Amanda and her husband met each other at work where she was hired as an assistant and he was the locksmith. Their love for each other grew and they eventually married. After some time, they opened their own business using the money they had saved. Today she and her husband work from their own locksmith shop located in the garage of their house. They make metal doors, windows, and other types of items.

With this loan, Amanda will buy iron for her business. She has plans to open another business and help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron

loans.name: José Ignacio

texts.es:
José Ignacio V. J. es una persona trabajadora, esforzada y decidida quien tiene una mueblería la cual inicio hace aproximadamente dieciséis años. El con el crédito comprara materiales como madera, clavos, pintura etc.
Este señor de 49 años sueña con que su taller preste todas las condiciones y poder tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
José Ignacio V. J. is a hardworking, determined, and decisive individual who has a furniture workshop that he started sixteen years ago. His loan will be used to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint, and other items.

José Ignacio is 49 years old and hopes to provide suitable conditions for his workshop and eventually open his own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails, paint, and other items

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 25 años, vive  en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Jhonny (32), y sus  3 hijos.Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas oriundas de esta parte de la selva. Lo que más le gusta es encajonar las frutas, porque puede seleccionarlas, de acuerdo al tamaño y color; sin embargo le disgusta comprarlas de las mismas chacras porque le resulta difícil trasladarlas, hasta su negocio. Paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza, de diferentes marcas solicitadas entre sus conocidos y vecinos. Los negocios que tiene Florinda, son bastante rentables, porque le permiten brindar a sus hijos una adecuada calidad de vida. Actualmente esta adecuando un espacio en su casa, donde piensa instalar una tienda de venta de abarrotes. Además con las ganancias de las ventas de estos enseres, para más adelante, ya tiene planeado construir una vivienda más amplia para instalar  una ferretería.Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y esta gustosa de laborar en su banco comunal, de manera activa, porque los demás integrantes  son responsables, unidos y emprendedores como ella.El dinero que solicita lo invertirá, en la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas para que pueda continuar distribuyendo, y espera tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Florinda is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jhonny (age 32) and their three children. For the past eight years, she has been buying and selling fruits native to this part of the jungle. What she enjoys most is boxing her fruits because she is able to select the ones she wants to sell based on size and color. However, she dislikes buying the fruit directly from the producer’s fields because it is difficult to transport them to her business.

In addition to this business, Florinda sells beauty products of different brands that are requested by her acquaintances and neighbors. Her businesses are quite profitable because they allow her to provide her children an adequate quality of life. She is currently remodeling a space in her house so that she can open a grocery store and already has plans to build a bigger house so that she can open a hardware store.

This is the sixth time she has received a loan from MFP. Florinda enjoys working with her Communal Bank as an active participant because the other members are just as responsible, close-knit, and enterprising as she is. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of fruits so that she can keep distributing them and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of fruits to sell

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
El Señor Erasmo J. Cáceres de 21 años de edad, es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su familia, su madre y sus 3 hermanos menores ya que su padre los abandono cuando el tenia sus 18 años y desde entonces él se hace cargo de su familia.

El es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, trabaja como moto taxista en el sindicato CARRASCO en el cual ya va trabajando más de dos años, el cliente lleva diariamente para el sustento de su madre y sus hermanos  para que en un futuro ellos tengan y gocen de las comodidades de las que él no gozo en su juventud.

El señor Erasmo se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de una Motocicleta para así poder trabajar en la localidad de ivirgarzama ya con herramientas propia así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su madre y sus hermanos y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Erasmo J. Cáceres, 21, is single and works to take care of his family, his mother and his three younger siblings since his father abandoned them when Erasmo was 18. Since then he has been responsible for his family. He is a young man who is very dedicated to his work. He works as a moto taxi driver with CARRASCO, where he has been working more than two years. He transports customers daily so he can take care of his mother and siblings so in the future they will have and enjoy the things he didn't have in his youth. Erasmo came to the offices looking for a loan to buy a motorcycle so he can work in the town of Ivirgarzama with his own equipment and have more income for the well-being of his mother and siblings and for a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle for taxi service

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
These women are small scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 1,200,000, they will be able to add more stock, make more sales and more profit. 

Salamatu K. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. Salamatu was born in Makeni. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. Two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school.

For many years now, the 36-year-old has been selling cooked rice, fish, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnut/peanuts, etc. With the help of this loan, Salamatu will be able to expand her business by buying rice, fish, palm oil and groundnut at wholesale. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower, Wara F., who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy cooked rice, fish, palm oil, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Pil

texts.en: Pil S. is a 34-year-old rice and vegetable grower from the Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbage, rice, and morning glories. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. Pil S. has three school-aged children. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Pil S. does not have enough farm supplies to use on her field. Pil S. is therefore asking for capital to use toward purchasing fertilizers, seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo R. is from the village of Rizal. He is 55 years old. Arturo is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Arturo operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services. Arturo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Arturo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arturo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a motorcycle. Arturo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used for the maintenance of a motorcycle. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Arturo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the maintenance of a motorcycle

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es: Cruz Del Socorro tiene 55 años, su actividad económica es la venta de derivados de leche. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su negocio. esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido gratificante, Ella inicio por la demanda y la necesidad de de tener su propio trabajo ya que al no poder finalizar sus estudios universitarios busco la forma de mantener a su familia, con mucho empeño ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Este financiamiento es para la compra de leche, cuajada, crema y queso. Desea mejorar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cruz del Socorro is 55 years old and her economic activity is selling milk derivatives. For more than 22 years she has been dedicated to this business, and she is always looking for a way to improve her business. This isn't the first time Cruz has had financing, which has always been gratifying. She began working because of product demand, and the necessity of having her own work. Since she couldn't finish her university studies, Cruz searched for a form of maintaining her family. With much effort, she has been able to remain active. This loan is for buying milk, curd, cream and cheese. Cruz wishes to improve the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MILK, CURD, CREAM, AND CHEESE TO SELL

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet E. has been able to sustain her butcher shop thanks to a previous loan from KIVA lenders. She repaid that loan and used her profits to supplement her husband’s irregular income and pay for the education of her children.

Janet is determined to improve bother her business and the life of her family. Knowing that she can access financial support through loans has given her courage and faith that someday all four of her children, whose ages range from seven to 18, will graduate from college and be ready to face life on their own. She is very passionate about giving all of her children a brighter future.

To make that possible, she is applying for a new loan to expand her business and pay for the quarterly license she needs to run her stall.

loans.use: to expand her shop and pay for her quarterly license

loans.name: Bozo

texts.en:
Bozo K. is a 26-year-old man married to one wife. Together they have two children. Bozo owns and operates a retail shop in Mwangatini, Malindi town. The  customers of the business are mostly Malindi town dwellers and passersby. He has been in this business for six years.

Bozo was introduced to KADET Ltd. by an existing client of KADET Ltd. This is Bozo's first loan from KADET Ltd. and it is for KES 40000. He intends to use the loan to add stock to the shop and also renovate the premises and give it a face lift so as to boost the business. He wishes to use the anticipated profit coming from the business to continue looking after his young family and hopes that one day he may get to own a bigger, well established shop or even a supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock to the shop and renovate the business premises

loans.name: Nacianceno

texts.en:
Nacianceno is 37 years old. He lives with his partner and their three school-age children in the neighborhood of Montegrande in the town of Reque.  Reque is a town located 20 minutes south of Chiclayo in the coastal plain of northern Peru. It is primarily rural with many small farmers raising cattle or other crops. Nacianceno’s home has electricity and running water from a local well.

The family participates in a number of businesses. Nacianceno raises animals and also drives a moto-taxi in the area. He is currently renting a moto-taxi because his moto-taxi has broken down. Nacianceno’s wife works as a field laborer. These activities yield a fairly stable income stream which they use to provide for their familial needs and for the education of their children.

Nacianceno is requesting the loan in order to make the necessary repairs to his moto-taxi so that he can continue using it and terminate the expense of renting the moto-taxi. This will be his first loan and his first experience with a financial institution. He has good references from the community.  

Nacianceno is grateful for the opportunity to access credit at a reduced cost as a result of the funding from Kiva.

loans.use: Make repairs to his moto-taxi

loans.name: Not-Ayni

texts.en:
Mrs. Not-ayni S. (in the photo) is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. San Nan is 38 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have seven children--three sons and four daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Not-ayni and her husband are fishermen. They fish from the river and sell their catch in the village market. She is requesting her first loan of $900 to purchase new fishing gear because some of hers is broken and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing materials and repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Zenzontle lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Felix Hernández comerciante de cosa de honor, repostería popular a base de maíz y queso que se acompañada de un café por las mañanas o las tardes sabe muy rica. Ella desde hace 9 años se dedica a realizar este producto los cuales vende de manera ambulante.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María del Rosario G. quien vende cosméticos desde hace 4 años y Paula del Carmen Rodríguez quien vende cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The “Zenzontle” (Mockingbird) group is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  One of them is María Félix Hernández who sells “Cosa de Honor” (A Matter of Honor) which is a popular corn and cheese based pastry that is usually enjoyed with a cup of coffee in the morning or evening; it is very tasty.  She has been making this product for 9 years and she sells it as a street vendor.

The other group members are María del Rosario G. who has sold cosmetics for four years and Paula del Carmen Rodríguez who sells cosmetics and used clothes.

loans.use: For corn, cheese, milk, etc.

loans.name: Assumpta

texts.en:
Assumpta is 45 years-old and is married with one child who is ten years old. Assumpta's husband is a salesman.  They both work hard in order to obtain all of the basic needs for their family.  Assumpta owns a small business where she sells new clothes.  Her business is known in the area and well-organized. She works from 7.30am until 6.30pm every day and has 12 years experience.

Assumpta will use this loan to purchase additional clothing to sell. Assumpta will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit by expanding her stock. With any profits made from the loan, Assumpta plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 47 years old. Agnes is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Agnes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok T., 35, is a farmer who sells vegetables and fruits, earning an income of 3 USD per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of 5 USD per day. The family spends 11 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity and 20 USD on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 41 years old woman from Qalqilia city in North Palestine. Ilham is a very good tailor. She started tailoring for relatives and neighbors and now she started tailoring for more customers from the city.

One of Ilham sons is a Palestinian National authority employee while the other 4 sons and one daughter are students.

Ilham who is photographed in the picture took a loan from FATEN to purchase a sewing machine and thread that she needs for tailoring as the work load is increasing and is bringing in a better income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.fr: Dieudonné B.  est marié et il a deux enfants entre 1 et 4 enfants, et  Il a une éducation primaire.  Il est commerçant avec sa machine pour laver et sécher les habits. Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une pièce de rechange de cette machine qui a été  endommagé,  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour augmenter l’activité et se procurer le marché(les clients).  Il voudrait avoir une maison, et la réhabiliter.
texts.en: Dieudonné B. is married and has two children, between 1 and 4 [years of age]. He has primary education. He provides laundry services using his washer and dryer machine. He will use his loan to purchase a replacement part for the machine, which is damaged. His business strategy is to save money in order to expand his business and attract more clients. He would like to buy a house and furnish it.

loans.use: Purchasing replacement parts to repair his washer/dryer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice N. G. is a married lady with three children whom she hopes to give good education to the university level. Her business is located at Changamwe Magongo estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

She does photocopying and printing services to the local people. She also sells stationery which does very well as the business is situated near a primary school. She has been doing this business for the last three years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Beatrice is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy exercise books, pens and printing paper to grow her business. She hopes to open a bookshop in future. She describes herself as a very patient and aggressive business woman.

loans.use: To buy exercise books, pens and printing paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery goods

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily C. is a business lady who owns a dairy, whereby she buys milk from farmers and sells it to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years and earns an income of KES 5,000 per month. She is 45 years old, married to Richard, and they have four children.   

She has never borrowed from any other microfinance institution, and she learned about KADET Ltd. from a member of a group registered with KADET. She is applying for a fourth loan from KADET, with which she plans to buy enough milk from the dairy farmers and then sell it to her customers.          

Emily intends to use the anticipated profit to save, plough back into the business, and also meet the family's basic needs. In the future she  plans to grow her business and offer her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale

loans.name: Sofia Mercedes

texts.es: Sofía Mercedes tiene 58 años, su negocio es alquiler de sillas. Hace más de 9 años que tiene ese medio de vida.  Ella vive en casa propia en donde la mayoría de sus clientes ya conocen la atención que brinda, pues se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues llegan a realiza el alquiler para diferentes eventos como graduación, velas, piñatas, bodas entre otros. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día más y brindar un mejor medio de vida. Este financiamiento es para la compra de una mayor cantidad de sillas plásticas.
texts.en: Sofia Mercedes is 58 years old and she has a chair rental business. She has had this business for more than 9 years. She lives a house that is her own and the majority of her clients know the type of service that she provides. She is very happy with her business. She works every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. She has rental contracts for all types of events, such as graduations, funerals, piñata parties, weddings, and others. She dreams of improving her earnings every day to have a better quality of life. This loan will be used to purchase a large number of plastic chairs.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of plastic chairs

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 30 años, nacida en el distrito de Santa Rosa; esta casada con Frank de 35 años de edad y tienen 03 hijos. Juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la  armonía. Olga y su pareja son el pilar de sus hijos, desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a arar la tierra; ella es campesina y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno donde cultiva plantas de café y cacao; plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Hace 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los secaderos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio; lugar donde comercializa lo cosechado. En el futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras e incrementar su producción con plantas de café. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con el crédito solicitado más sus ahorros acumulados comprarán un lote de terreno en la ciudad de Santa Rosa.
texts.en: Olga is 30 years old and a native of the district of Santa Rosa. She is married to Frank, 35, and they have three children. They live together in harmony in their own home. Olga and her husband are the pillars for their children, who from a very early age were taught how to tend the land. Olga is a farmer and has four hectares of land where she cultivates coffee and cocoa, plants that originated from the rain forest area in the Apurimac River Valley. She has been dedicated to this activity for the past 11 years, and at harvest time she counts on the support of hired laborers to harvest the crops and transport them to to be dried. What she likes most about her work is harvesting the plants since she can see her months of hard work be repaid with quality fruit. The task she considers to be the most difficult is transporting the products from her community to the commercial centers where she sells her items. In the future she wants to purchase more land and expand her coffee production. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels proud to have repaid every loan punctually since she doesn't want to cause problems for her much loved fellow members of her community bank. With the loan and her accumulated savings, she plans to purchase a plot of land in the city of Santa Rosa.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy T. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. 

Juvy has been in this business for two years, and she also earns income from rice retailing.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like breads, groceries, etc..

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
La Sra. Sabas R. M. es comerciante individual y cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos varios que esta ubicado en una zona estratégica y de mayor comercio en el municipio de El Paraíso, lo que le permite el fácil acceso de sus clientes generándole mayores ventas en el dia, aparte de los productos tambien vende Medicina Natural siendo sus principales clientes las personas de las diferentes aldeas y caseríos vecinos,  los que se ha sabido ganar ya que les brinda un buen trato y les ofrece buenos productos, la experiencia que tiene le permite con facilidad recomendarle determinados productos medicinales a sus clientes.   
La sra. Sabas R. utilizara el credito para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir de productos su negocio y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Sabas R. M. is a small business owner who sells assorted products in a strategically located commercial area of El Paraíso, which allows her easy access to customers, thus generating better sales. Aside from selling those products, she also sells herbal medicine, her main customers being people from the different surrounding villages, people whom she has been able to win over because of her good customer service and quality products. Her experience allows her to recommend the appropriate herbal products to her customers with ease.

Ms. Sabas R. will use this loan to purchase wholesale merchandise so that she can restock her business, thus allowing her to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase deodorant, talcum powder, bathroom tissue, cosmetics, tooth paste, brushes, hair bands, and hangers.

loans.name: Batzorig

texts.en:
Batzorig is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batzorig’s mother is unemployed and looks after the household, and his father works in local council as a water distributor, distributing fresh water to slum district households. 

Batzorig runs a taxi business using his family's car. To run a taxi business without a warm garage is impossible, especially in the winter, because during winter nights cars freeze and people always have trouble starting them. 

Last year Batzorig started building a warm garage for his car and at the moment the basement is completed. The loan Batzorig is taking out will be used to complete the garage building project with the purchase of bricks, cement, and a garage door.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and a garage door and finish an uncompleted garage

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
