Mona is 38 years old and married to Ziad who works as a dustman at one the governmental entities. They have five children, all under the age of 18 years old.

Despite losing her right hand in a car accident a while ago, Mona wanted to do something to help her husband in supporting their family, since his salary is not enough to do so. 

Four years ago, Mona started a retailing business at their house, selling home products such as cups, plates, pans, etc. and it has been going very well. Now Mona is applying for loan to increase her storage of products so she can increase her profit and open a home products shop.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her retail business.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Bashiran is involved in a business sewing clothes. She runs her business from home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. Her clientele base is her neighbors. She receives orders from them and earns good profit after completing orders on time. She has been doing this business for the past many years and has a good reputation among her clients. She can sew designer and non-designer dresses easily. She charges from Pak rupees 180 to Pak rupees 200 for a single dress. Her earnings allow her to manage the household expenses. 

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to further improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is not producing quality work and takes a long time to sew a single dress. She hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her household income. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Bashiran.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Roswin

texts.en:
Roswin is married with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. She is 33 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur, with a fishing business in the Philippines. Roswin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment.

Roswin has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Jorge De Jesús

texts.es:
Jorge es un trabajador inigualable, pues para él cumplirle a sus clientes es una de sus prioridades, por eso considera que si debe extender su horario de trabajo hasta la noche se esmera por hacerlo de la mejor manera posible. 

Desde hace algunos años y gracias a la experiencia adquirida en trabajos anteriores, Jorge creó su  propio negocio, un taller de confecciones en el que trabaja también su esposa y dos empleadas más. 

Una de sus mayores dificultades es la falta de maquinaria, por ello, en algunas oportunidades no puede comprometerse con algunos trabajos debido a que no tiene la capacidad de respuesta para atender sus pedidos, por ello, este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar maquinaria y así crecer poco a poco y mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking man with no equal.  To him, pleasing his customers is one of his top priorities so he believes that he should extend his hours into the evening and he is making an effort to do it in the best possible way.

Jorge created his own business a few years ago, thanks to the experience he got from previous jobs.  He, his wife, and two other employees work in his sewing business.

One of their greatest challenges is the lack of machines and there are times when he can’t commit to some of the jobs because he does not have the capacity to fill the orders.  For this reason this entrepreneur needs this loan to be able to buy machines and increase his income little by little.  This will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. animales, actividad que lo viene realizando desD. hace 10 años. En ella, lo considera como su fuente principal D. ganancias, pues cada venta D. animales es D. manera periódica. Ante esto, se ha visto la necesidad D. capacitarse cada cierto tiempo, así garantiza un mejor crecimiento sostenible en la producción D. sus animales. Una vez alcanzado el peso exacto D. su ganado, son llevados para su venta en la feria ganadera D. su localidad. Ahora lo que más prioriza es mejorar la infraestructura D. su granja así como aumentar la cantidad D. animales que posee. Es su quinto crédito D. trabajo que tiene con MFP, considera a la institución como una gran aliada que le permite concretar sus proyectos D. desarrollo y demuestra su gratitud con la puntualidad D. sus pagos. En esta oportunidad invertirá su crédito en la compra D. materiales para la mejorar su establo.
texts.en:
Francisca lives with her husband in their own home.  The business she works in is animal sales, an activity that she has been doing for 10 years.  She sees it as her main source of earnings, as the sale of animals takes place on a recurring basis.  Given this, she has seen a need to undergo training every so often, so as to ensure greater sustainable growth in the production of her animals. Once her cattle reach the exact weight, they are brought for sale at the cattle market in her area.  Now her bigger priority is to improve the infrastructure of her farm and so to increase the number of animals she owns. 

This is her fifth business loan through MFP.  She considers the institution to be a great ally that allows her to focus on her development projects, and she  shows her gratituD. with the timeliness of her repayments. This time her loan will be invested in buying materials for improving her barn.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the infrastructure of her barn.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and married with three children. He is grateful because through his patience and hard work he is able to meet the financial and basic needs of his family.

Robert's business is providing public motorcycle transport in the village where he lives. He works mornings and afternoons, transporting people from their village to market and school. He has his own customers whom he takes to and from school. Through this daily routine, he is able to earn 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. He uses this income for his family's daily needs, paying electricity bills and allowances for the children.

Robert would like to request a loan of 10,000 PHP so that he can buy wheels and sprockets for his motorcycle transport. Some of the money will be used to buy fertilizer for his rice farming business. He hopes that he can maintain his motorcycle transport and rice farming business.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and sprockets for his motorcycle and fertilizer for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Finagnon Group

texts.fr: FINAGNON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont le représentant(celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Sogodo. Les membres du groupe vivent dans la même localité. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Sogodo est âgé de 38 ans et est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Lucienne. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Sogodo a appris la couture, activité qu'il exerce depuis une dizaine d'année et qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et d'assurer leurs différents besoins. Parallèlement, Sogodo vend des produits de mercerie dans son atelier. Sogodo s’approvisionne au Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Sogodo et aux autres membres du groupe FINAGNON, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
FINAGNON is a group made up of 3 people who all live in the same area. The group is requesting their first loan from ALIDé so that they can increase their working capital.
The group's representative is called Sogodo. He is 38 years old and is married to a saleswoman called Lucienne. The couple are raising 3 children who are all in school. After leaving primary school, Sogodo learned how to sew and has been working as a tailor for a decade. This has enabled him to feed his family and take care of their various needs. Sogodo also sells haberdashery articles in his workshop. He gets his supplies in Benin. This loan will enable Sogodo and the members of the FINAGNON group to increase their business levels, pull in more customers and raise their revenue levels.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery supplies for resale.

loans.name: Ayda Isabel

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aida, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 1 año, su hijo mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es artesano. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos complementarios que ofrece la institución.

Ella  es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al hogar  y al comercio, ella compra y vende adornos y cerámicas,  arrienda un  local en el centro de La Pila en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía hechos en barro y cerámica, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que compra sus productos a artesanos de la zona pero sin terminar, luego ella en las noches o en momentos que está desocupada les   da  el acabado para venderlas a mejor precio. Llevan 6  años con su negocio y le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva 10 ciclos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer  crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su propia local para no pagar arriendo que se le llevan gran parte de las ganancias.
texts.en:
The La Pila Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in La Pila, Montecristi canton. This area is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. There one can find a large variety of artisanry made by the locals in keeping with the customs of their ancestors.

Here we meet Aida. She is 23, married, and has two children ages 8 and 1 from this relationship. Her oldest child is in school. Her husband is an artesan. She has been part of the Communal Bank almost from the beginning and she likes it because of the benefits and the free loans that the institution offers.

She is a wonderful housewife who takes care of the home and is a merchant. She buys and sells decorations and ceramics. She rents a spot in downtown La Pila where she sells all kinds of clay and ceramic artisanry. She works every day from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She tells us that she buys her products from artisans in the area; however, she buys them unfinished. Later, at night or when she has free time she finishes them to sell at a better price. She has had her business for six years and it has gone very well for her.

This loan is for buying more artisanry of all shapes and models to stock her business. She has been in the Communal Bank for 10 cycles, and she likes it because she used her first loan to start her business.

Her dream is to have her own location so that she won't have to pay rent, as a large portion of her earnings is spent on rent.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Jypargul's Group

texts.en: Jypargul is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up five children, all of whom study at school. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Jypargul started to take orders to sew Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. At the moment her business runs well and she earns about 10,000 soms per month. Jypargul applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase fabrics and materials which are needed for sewing. In the future she dreams to show her products in foreign countries. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Josefa Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Herlinda es casada, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó el tercer grado de educación básica, tiene 1 hijo el cual no estudia, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo con su esposo, lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo en la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y clases y poder producir mas cortes típicos, ya que espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande.
texts.en: Josefa is married, 22-years old and has a third-grade education. She has a son who is currently not in school. She makes a living in weaving, and she started the business four years ago with her husband. She is requesting the loan to increase her capital to purchase different colors and styles of thread so she can produce more traditional products. In the future she hopes to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing and Avon products

loans.name: Lisbet Mayra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth;  La socia tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la atención de su panadería, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de harinas, levaduras, para elaborar los panes, pasteles, kekes que la socia prepara en su panadería, la socia tiene una muy conocida panadería – pastelería; la socia desea ahora el préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, grageas, caritas, todo esto porque la socia elabora pan gua gua, esto quiere decir que en el mes de Octubre e inicios del mes de noviembre es tradición preparar panes guaguas, lo que quiere decir los panes los preparan en formas de bebes envueltos y esto compran las familias para todas las niñas en casa y para los varones se prepara en forma de caballo con la carita de cerámica de un caballito, esto compran para aquellos que tienen en casa un niño; esta tradición es casi una obligación en nuestro país. 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Lisbeth belongs to the communal bank "Kantus."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

Lisbeth is 25 years old.  She lives with a partner and has a son who is 2 years old.  Lisbeth has a bakery, and she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of flour and yeast to make the breads, pastries and cakes that she prepares in her bakery.  She has a bakery/pastry shop that is very well known.  She wants a loan now to invest in flour, yeast, sprinkles and cookies with little faces to use in making "gua gua" bread, or "bread babies."  This is because in the month of October and the beginning of November, it is the tradition to prepare these "bread babies," which are breads formed in the shape of babies that have a sweet filling.  During this time of year families buy these for all of the girls in the house, and for the boys, they buy cookies in the form of a horse with the ceramic face of a little pony.  These cookies are purchased by those who have a child in the household; this tradition is almost an obligation in our country.  

Lisbeth is grateful for this loan, and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sprinkles, and cookies with little faces to make the traditional "gua gua" bread.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and lives in Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children.
 
Wilma has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Wilma hopes to have a lot of capital because she wants to earn money in order to build a shop. Wilma is a good mother and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Munhktsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 36, runs a rental grocery store. Actually she sells the beverages such as a vodkas and beers.  She has been doing her business since last year, and she has enough experience to run this kind of business because she used to work as a seller in her friend’s store.
 
Lately she needs to increase her store's working capital substantially, because her income has decreased in the last several months due to having less working capital. Therefore she is taking a loan to purchase beverage commodities such as some kinds of vodkas and beers for increasing her store's working capital.

loans.use: To purchase beverage commodities, such as some kinds of vodkas and beers for increasing her store's working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Melania

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Espori Mi Bankito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una gran riqueza natural, colonia y cultural, es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, es desde 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente y sus tradiciones la hacen una ciudad cálida.

Doña Rosa tiene 50 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 31, 21 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija estudia en la universidad y su ultima hija en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene un bar, actividad que la desempeña hace dos años, trabaja de lunes a sábados todo el día. También labora en la preparación de bufetes para todo tipo de fiestas sociales.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de su casa.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the community bank "Espori Mi Bankito." She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has a great natural, colonial, and cultural richness. It is knows as the Santa Ana of the Four Rivers. Since 1999 it has been a world heritage site, and its traditions make it a warm city.

Doña Rosa is 50 years old. She is divorced and has three children ages 31, 21, and 16. Her oldest son works and helps her economically. Her second child, a daughter, studies at the university, and her youngest daughter is in high school. She doesn't have her own home, so she rents.

Señora Rosa has a bar, a business that she began two years ago. She works all day from Monday to Saturday. She also prepares refreshments for all types of social occasions.

She has been a member of her community bank for five years, and she is going to invest her loan in the purchase of construction materials for the construction of her house. 

Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nyawak

texts.en: Nyawak is a 23 year old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past three years she has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a simple man full of hopes. He always believes in the saying, “If others can, why can’t I?” 

Loreto is married to Josephine, who is working as a recruiter of domestic helpers wanting to work abroad. They are blessed with three healthy children. They live in the village of Rizal, one of the farthest barangays in Quirino province, wherein farming is the major source of livelihood. Loreto works as a farmer in their village, however, his income is not enough to meet all the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business. Loreto dreams that someday he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Nelida tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, ella nació en el distrito de Anta de la provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco pero vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Nelida trabaja en un hotel pero también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Nelida requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
The “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” communal bank’s members are responsible, hardworking people who support their families.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco where they also carry out their economic activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

Nélida, 27, is in a common law relationship.  She was born in Anta District in Anta Province, Cusco Department and lives in the city of Cusco.  Nélida works in a hotel but also raises small farm animals.   She’s been in this business several years now and does very well.  On this occasion Nélida needs the loan to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Flor Del Durazno Group

texts.es:
El señor Mario está casado, tiene 39 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y café, inicio este trabajo con sus padres hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizante, para poder mejorar su producción de maíz y café, ya que en el futuro quiere tener más extensión de terreno para sembrar mas café y mas maíz. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al mismo trabajo. el capital es pagado al vencimiento.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizante para siembra de maiz y cafe

loans.name: Raqiba

texts.ru: Ракиба очень веселая женщина в возрасте 50 лет, она замужем имеет 3 детей. Ей нравиться заниматься откормом скота, это ремесло имеет много препятствий и трудностей, потому что скот может заболеть если не вовремя сделать прививку или другие необходимые лекарства. Если плохо ухаживать и плохо кормить скот может похудеть и не давать потомство. Поэтому в бизнесе помогает сын и муж. Ракиба положительная женщина имеет большую дружную семью. Для содержания своей семьи Ракиба приходится много трудиться. Она занимается животноводством и переработкой молока. В этом деле ей помогает и муж. Полученный доход от содержания крупного рогатого скота и продажи молока они расходуют на семью и понемногу помогают пожилым родителям. Ракиба хочет дать хорошее образование детям . Это является её мечтой так, как сама он не смогла получить хорошее образование. Для воплощения её мечты в реальность она должна трудиться ещё больше и увеличивать свой бизнес. Для увеличения поголовья ей не достает небольшой суммы. Ракиба брала в прошлом кредит в "Арванде" и так, как обслуживание и условия предоставления кредита в этом банке удовлетворяют её потребности она решила повторно обратиться в Арванд. Сейчас она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Raqiba is a very cheerful woman of 50. She is married and has three children. She enjoys her work of fattening up livestock. This trade has a lot of obstacles and difficulties, because the livestock might fall ill if they are not vaccinated in time, or given other necessary medicine. If they are badly taken care of and poorly fed, the livestock might lose weight and not produce offspring. Thus her husband and son help her with the business. 

Raqiba is a positive woman, and she has a large and amiable family. Raqiba has to work a lot in order to support her family. She works in animal husbandry and milk processing. Her husband helps her with this business. They spend the income received from raising cattle and selling milk on their family, and some goes to helping their elderly parents. 

Raqiba wants to give her children a good education. This is her dream, since she herself was unable to receive a good education. In order to make her dreams a reality, she must work even more and augment her business. In order to increase her herd she needs a small sum of money. Raqiba has previously taken a loan from Arvand, and since the service and conditions for granting the loan in this bank are satisfying to her demands, she has decided to once again apply to Arvand. Now she has applied to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy livestock. She is hoping very much for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jesus Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jesús Elizabeth con 32 años, de estado civil madre soltera,vive en casa propia, junto a sus hijos, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,pollo,cerveza, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 5 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerveza y para la cancelación de un préstamo con otra entidad. De esta manera le facilitará obtener mejores ingresos.

Jesús Elizabeth es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para la compra de cerveza y para la cancelación de un préstamo con otra entidad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy half bag for each cereals amounting to 9 bags of cereal food

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: M. Allahverdi Khangulu Oglu is a local farmer from Beyler village of the Saatli region. He has a big family: his wife, 4 children and his parents. Animal husbandry is the only income source for the family, besides pensions received by his elderly parents. His business is very small and he keeps only milking cows. So he decided to improve his business by having a new product – calf breeding for meat production. To realize this idea, he requested from “Agroinvest” 700 USD for purchasing young calves and feed.

loans.use: Purchase calves and feed

loans.name: Hercilia Madalena

texts.pt:
Hercilia Madalena T. was born on the 27th of July, 1975, in Maputo. Her parents separated when she was only 5 years old, and she started living with her father. She attended school until the 10th grade, and at the age of 19 she met her husband, with whom she would have 2 children. At the age of 23 she decided to start a business to increase the family's income. She worked several jobs and was most successful selling clothes, which she practices to this day. She thought about renting a store where she could sell her clothes, but she had insufficient funds. Through a friend, she met Hluvuku and asked for a loan of 1,2000 dollars to continue with her store project, having decided to work arduously at building savings to help her further her store.

This business has a positive impact on her family, helping her husband support their children and allowing them to purchase a car, which will greatly help her business in traveling for purchases to South Africa and in her deliveries. Her business' impact on the community is also positive. By supplying clothing at reasonable prices to her community, she saves her neighbors time and money from travelling to South Africa. Selling clothes door-to-door is very demanding, and in the future, she intends to build a shop where she can display her clothing.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hercilia Madalena T., nascida em 27 de julho de 1975 em Maputo, seus pais separam se quando ela tinha apenas 5 anos e passou a viver com o pai. Estudou ate 10ªclasse, aos 19 anos junta se com seu marrido o qual praticava os seus negocios, com o qual tiveram dois filhos. Aos 23 anos decide iniciar o negócio para aumentar a renda familiar, fez vários tipos de negócios tendo tido sucesso no negócio de roupa o qual pratica ate entao . Pensou em alugar uma loja onde pudesse colocar as suas roupas mas, não tinha fundo suficiente e, através de uma amiga, ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo solicitado emprestimo no valor de 30.000,00 MT e com este valor não foi suficiente para continuar com o projecto da loja tendo decidido continuar a trabalhar arduamente no sentido de fazer crescer este fundo e que futuramente poderá continuar com este projecto da loja.

Este negocio tem impacto positivo na sua família uma vez que consegue ajudar o marido no sustento dos filhos e na base deste negocio esta comprando um carro faltando pagar a ultima prestação o qual irá ajudar lhe muito no seu negocio uma vez que faz compras na Africa do sul e também lhe ajudará nas entregas. Na comunidade também tem impacto positivo pelo que fornece roupas sem que as pessoas se desloquem a africa do sul ou a cidade para adquiri las poupando lhes o tempo e dinheiro assim como lhes cria facilidades de pagamento. Futuramente pretende construir uma loja onde poderá colocar as suas roupas uma vez que é transtornante e despendioso trabalhar em regime ambulatório.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a grown son. They live in Zaporozhye. Nataliya sells seasonal clothing at the central city market. She usually sells swimsuits in the summer and leather footwear in the fall and winter. Nataliya travels to Hungary to purchase swimsuits wholesale there. Her sister lives in Hungary which helps her save money each time she goes to buy another lot of inventory. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. Presently, she has about $2,000–$2,400 in inventory. Her monthly profit is about $300-$400.   

Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new inventory wholesale for further retail sale in her kiosk. Nataliya is an experienced entrepreneur. Her ultimate goal is to grow her business and introduce new clothing items which would be in demand among her customers. We believe her focused approach and integrity will ensure prompt repayment of this current loan.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for the fall season

loans.name: Punyabati

texts.en:
Mrs. Punyabati S. is 29 years old and lives in Dhalko.  Dhalko is situated in Kathmandu Valley, and most of the people in this place are engaged in business activities. 
Mrs. S. has only one son, who is eight years old and studying in grade 3. Her husband, Mr. Narandra S., and she both prepare fried dry fish. They sell their product in grocery shops and department stores.
Now Mrs. S. is requesting a Rs10,000 (US$175) loan to buy fish and spices necessary for their work. Her income is to be used for the better education of her children.

loans.use: To buy fish for her work

loans.name: I Putu Agus Sumerta

texts.id:
As head of his household, I Putu Agus Sumerta is responsible for meeting all of the needs of his family. He currently has two children, Intan and Noval, and his income is what ensures their survival. In 2002, the Bali bombings almost completely destroyed the Balinese economy. One of the hardest-hit industries was tourism. After the bombings, hotels had to lay off many of their employees. Unfortunately, due to the circumstances, I Putu Agus Sumerta was let go from his job at a hotel in Denpasar. Like many others, he had to return to his home village to begin looking for a new source of income. He decided to go into the clothes tailoring business. To learn the trade, he studied with his mother, at the home where he was born, in the village of Candikusuma. With a completely manual sewing machine (they have no electricity), he is now able to make a full outfit worth 40,000 Rupiah in just one 8am to 5pm work day. He has been very successful in his business, gaining more customers every day. For major holidays he has lines of customers waiting to put in orders. In fact, due to the limitations of the tools he is using, he is having to decline more and more customers because he is afraid he won't be able to complete their orders on time. I Putus Agus Sumerta would like to borrow 2,000,000 Rupiah to purchase a Dynamo electric generator that he can attach to his sewing machine to increase his production and therefore better help his family meet their day-to-day needs. His oldest daughter is in her final year of primary school, and he also wants to use his increased income to pay for her continued education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai Kepala keluarga yang harus bertanggung jawab dalam memenuhi seluruh kebutuhan keluarganya , I Putu Agus Sumerta yang kini telah di karuniai dua orang anak yakni Intan & Noval sangat memerlukan pekerjaan yang bisa menjamin kelangsungan hidup keluarga. Hal itu sebenarnya sudah pernah terwujud ,sebelum suatu kejadian (Bom Bali )terjadi,yang membuat hampir seluruh perekonomian di bali terpuruk , khususnya dalam bidang perhotelan .Banyak hotel maupun usaha yang berkaitan dengan pariwisata mengalami kebangkrutan yang Berdampak pada pemutusan hubungan kerja. Seperti yang terjadi terhadap Putu Agus Sumerta.Mantan seorang karyawan salah satu hotel di Denpasar ini harus rela balik kekampungnya dan harus memulai mencari sumber pendapatan yang baru . Menjahit pakaian menjadi pilihan Putu Agus ,ketrampilan yang di peroleh dari Ibu kandungnya itu di jalankannya di rumah tempat kelahirannya yaitu di desa Candikusuma . Dengan mesin jahit manual (tanpa tenaga penggerak listrik) dalam sehari Putu Agus bisa menyelesaikan satu stel pakaian dengan ongkos/upah sebesar Rp 40.000,- ini di kerjakan mulai jam 8 pagi sampai jam 5 sore. Hasil jaritan Putu Agus Sangat baik sehingga pelangganyapun bertambah banyak lebih lebih menjelang hari raya banyak pelanggan yang antri untuk di buatkan Baju maupun pakaian lainya . Bahkan tak jarang Putu agus harus menolak pesanan karena takut tak bisa menyelesaikan tepat waktu karena keterbatasan alat yang dimiliki. Putu Agus memerlukan pinjaman modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp 2 .000.000,- untuk membeli Dinamo listrik yang dipasangkan pada mesinjahitnya sebagai tenaga pengerak Agar hasil produksinya meningkat dan pendapatannya juga bertambah Sehingga dapat memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan putri sulungnya yang sekarang sudah kelas 5 SD

loans.use: To buy a Dinamo electric generator for a manual sewing machine

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: My name is Nasreen K., and I am the wife of Muhammad Arshad. I live with my family in a small town, Borewala, in Pakistan. I need a loan for my husband to repair his tractor. He uses his tractor to plough the fields. I plan to repair my house in the future, if our income increases. I mostly do my household chores, but whenever I get time I embroider clothes that I get on order from the women in my neighborhood. I have a few friends in my neighborhood who are my loan group members as well, let me introduce them to you: Safia W., who plans to use the loan for her son’s salon; Rafia B., who became divorced two years ago, and she runs a beauty salon to make her living and now needs a loan to improve her business; and Nasreen N., who will invest the loan in their used items trading business.

loans.use: Get our tractor repaired

loans.name: Banda B8 A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Joyce W.. She is currently in the clinic business and is requesting a loan to buy a microscope and more drugs. Joyce is 40 years old and married. She has 15 children ranging in age from 3 to 24; four of them go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another clinic.

Joyce has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 300000 (~ $175 USD), to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Elizabeth B., Anyesi K., Sauda A., and Janet K.. Elizabeth B. sells clothing and wants to purchase more clothes. Anyesi K. is currently operating a canteen and wants a loan to add to her stock. Sauda A. operates a canteen and wants to increase her stock of goods. Janet K. has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clinic equipment and boost business

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nahim lives with his own family in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 6 children. He has a small business. He has a plot of land which he cultivates. In all the seasons of the year, he is supporting his family with this business.

Mohammad has requested an individual loan to purchase necessity materials, specially seeds, so that his land can bring in more income. He is intent on helping his family and enrolling his children in better schools. He is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: purchasing necessity materials for his little farm

loans.name: Selina's Raha Group

texts.en:
Selina is 36 years old and is married with five children. Selina owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 10.30am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member, Zuhura, who has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Anna

texts.en:
Elizabeth Anna T. is married with three children. She has a business selling sewing materials that is doing well, but she wishes to increase her sales.

As she is running out of stock, she is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more sewing materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Feoonuu

texts.en: Feoonuu is an experienced businesswoman. She has fully engaged in running her business so that she will meet the needs of the customers everyday. The business is her major financial support. She will use the loan to buy a freezer, plus sugar, rice, salt, lamp chops and chicken thighs.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and more food stock

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
Maria Andrea is a 37-year-old woman who works as a housekeeper. She is a single mother who has always had to watch over her 3 children all on her own. She now only looks after 2 school age children, whom she hopes to help so that they can finish their studies and become decent men.

She invests the income that she accrues from her job into her cosmetics business, in so doing generating a bit more revenue to help her family get ahead. She hopes to one day move her business forward and make a living off of it alone. However, she is now concerned with her house. She needs a loan in order to roof her patio because during winter, her home’s interior is affected by water that leaks in.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Andrea es una mujer que a sus 37 años de edad se desempeña como trabajadora doméstica, es soltera y por toda una vida le ha tocado velar por la vida de sus tres hijos ella sola. Ahora tiene a su cargo solamente a dos hijos los cuales estudian y a los cuales ella espera poder ayudarlos para que terminen su educación y sean hombres de bien.

Del salario que ella devenga ha invertido en el negocio de venta de cosméticos para así generar un poco más de ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Espera algund dia poder sacar adealnte su negocio y vivir solamente de él. Pero ahora su preocupación es su casa de habitación, requiere del préstamo pra techar el area del patio de su casa de habitación, yaque con el invierno el interior de su casa se ve afectado, debido a que el agua se mete en su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to roof her courtyard

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua Y. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Ekua and her five children. Because there is good demand for her fish, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock and expand her sales.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Chhoeub

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoeub C., 23 years old, makes charcoal to sell in his area. He has been running his business since 2005 and earns around US$ 4.30 per day. Chhoeun sells the charcoal to his customers and other retailers. He is married but has no children; he and his wife live in Chubkarav Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

To increase the family's income, Chhoeub wants to sell his charcoal by transporting it to customers' homes and needs oxen with a cart for transportation, but he faces the obstacle of lacking money to purchase oxen and a cart. Hence, Chhoeub would like to request a loan to achieve his plan. Chhoeub is in the picture, standing near his charcoal kiln.

loans.use: Purchase oxen and a cart

loans.name: Mr. Uong Teng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank [solidarity group] consists of 15 people and is located in Sre Sa Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mr. Uong T. is the village bank president. He owns a small kiln where he can make coal to sell for an income. His wife, Mrs. Doeuk Hon, has a plot of land to cultivate rice. Besides this, she is a breeder who raises three cows. Mr. Uong T. is 58 years old and the father of six children, who are all attending the local school. Although Mr. Uong T. and his wife both have businesses, they still cannot effort to build a new house for their household. In order to meet this need, Mr. Uong T. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a house for his family.

Mr. Doeurk C. did not come to take out a loan, but his wife did and is shown in the picture instead of her husband.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK [Kiva’s Field Partner] has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To help build a house for his family

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
In Kisumu, Kenya, numerous small restaurants, which are known locally as "hotels", line the sides of the streets. Regina A. C. is the 36-year-old owner of one such hotel. From options of tea, bread, or porridge for a light breakfast, to heartier meals of fish, meat, or vegetables, Regina feeds her community what she calls "fast food".

The hotel is poorly built, and Regina longs to improve the building. She would like to take out a loan of $250 USD in order to plaster the walls and pay for structural improvements and maintenance, which will make the hotel more stable and her business more attractive to customers.

Regina is a single mother of four children; one is just out of high school, while the other three are in primary school. She wants to use some of the profits from her business to pay for her children's education: college for her eldest, and school fees for the younger three.

loans.use: To make building improvements on restaurant

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que son estudiantes, vive junto a su esposo, quien está de acuerdo con sus propósitos trazados. Ella se manifestó en el arte textil desde muy temprana edad, a razón de haber estudiado para ello. Aprendió en un principio empíricamente, sin embargo la experiencia y la práctica hacen de esta mujer una máquina de trabajo, ya que es muy solicitada por su buena labor, la que viene realizando desde hace 15 años, lo que le gusta de su actividad diaria es hacer sus prendas bien, le es rentable porque cuenta  con sus clientes desde hace tiempos y por recomendación, consigue aún más. Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado quiere ampliar su taller textil e invertir en un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca, 40, has 3 school-age children. She lives with her husband who supports her plans. She has displayed skill in textile art from an early age, and has studied in this area. She learned empirically, and experience and practice have made this woman into a working machine. She is much sought-after for her work, which she has been doing for 15 years. What she likes best about her daily activity is making her garments well. This is profitable for her because she has long-term clients, and with recommendations, she is gaining even more. This is the second loan she has taken with MFP. With the money she wants to expand her textile workshop and invest in a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of her textile workshop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. started her restaurant three years ago in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 32 years old and married with a child, who is currently in school. 

She serves many kinds of local dishes, including fufu, rice balls and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or soup. These are the popular local dishes most Ghanaians enjoy very much.

With the loan, Alice wants to buy the supplies -- such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood -- she needs to expand her business. She hopes to use part of the loan to finance her child’s education. She is a member of a borrowing group called the Favour Trust Group. Members of this group agree to help each other repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies, including bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, năm nay 54 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 4 người con và hiện còn đang đi học, nguồn thu chính của gia đình là từ hoạt động kinh doanh buôn bán hàng tạp hoá,  hoa quả của chị và phần lương hưu của chồng với tổng thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 để mua thêm các mặt hàng bánh, kẹo, và các hàng tạp hóa khác về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 54 years old. Her family has four children of school age. Her family's main income comes from a store selling convenient goods and fruits. Combined with her husband's pension, her income totals at 2,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in goods such as cookies, candies and other convenient goods for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. sells clothing, footwear and saucepans and also manufactures palm oil.  She has been in this business for three years.   Mercy has a junior high education.  She is married, her husband is a farmer, and she has 6 dependants. They live near Dosi near the Cape Coast.

She supports her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more shoes, clothing and saucepan and also buy more palm fruit for the production of the oil.  Customers are demanding more of her products. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more shoes, clothing and saucepans and also buy more palm fruit for the production of the oil.  There is an increased demand by her customers.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio G. G., reside en San Martín, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Hace ocho años que cuenta con una tienda, en la cual vende productos de primera  necesidad tales como cereales, pan, sopas entre otras más. José Antonio desea aumentar los productos de su tienda para que de esta manera logre obtener mayores ventas, las cuales le beneficien a su economía familiar. José Antonio sueña con ver que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y logren ser personas profesionales en un futuro, es por ello que el solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda mejorar su negocio y de esta manera lograr mejores ingresos familiares los cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio G. G. lives in San Martín, together with his wife and two children. He has had a store for eight years now, in which he sells basic necessities such as cereals, bread, and soups, among other items. José Antonio wants to add to the quantity of products in his store so that he can increase sales levels, which will benefit his family financially. José Antonio dreams of seeing his children continue with their studies and manage to become professionals in the future. It’s for this reason that he requests a loan, through which he will be able to improve his business. This will help provide greater economic stability for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products in his business.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who runs a clothing shop in the Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases some items from wholesale shops in the Kariakoo business city center and imports others from Zanzibar Island. He then resells on a retail basis to customers in Tandika. He has been in the business for six years.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000. to buy more items to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana S., 35, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Moana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemical weeds, bush knives, filling knives

loans.name: Anefa Group

texts.en: Anefa is the group leader of Anefa group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for the progress of their business. Anefa wants to take a loan for her bakery. Mashda wants to take a loan for her brother who has a general store and Mashda's brother wants to expand his business and buy more materials, especially the things that are most in demand. They want to take a loan of about 28000 Afghani for a term of 10 months. They thank AFS and Kiva who can support all the world.

loans.use: to improve their businesses

loans.name: Ni Kadek Widiantari

texts.en: Ni Kadek Widiantari (DNR.M-0670) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has a school-aged child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Kadek Widiantari joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Kadek Widiantari is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI. Ni Kadek Widiantari is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Ni Kadek Widiantari - (DNR.M-0670) merupakan 33 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Kadek Widiantari memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Kadek Widiantari sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek Widiantari menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Kadek Widiantari bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Kadek Widiantari telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Kadek Widiantari berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La señora Benigna es cliente antigua trabaja con la institucion desde el año 2006, la actividad economica que realiza es la atencion diaria de la tienda de barrio que esta ubicada casi al frente de su domicilio en la cual expende viveres, conservas, golocinas, lacteos y fruta.  Los dias viernes y sabados vende fruta de temporada en el Mercado Rodriguez, popular mercado de La Paz.  Ella vive en la casa de su suegra conjuntamente con sus hijos que son quienes le ayudan en la atencion de la tienda. La señora Benigna invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de viveres(arroz, fideo y azuar) por mayor ademas tambien comprara fruta para surtir el puesto que tiene en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Benigna has long been a client with the institution (since 2006). The economic activity in which she is engaged is tending a neighborhood store every day which is located in the front of her house. She dispenses provisions, canned foods, sweets, milk products and fruit. On Friday and Saturday she sells seasonal fruit in the Rodriguez Market, a popular market in La Paz. She lives in her mother-in-law's house together with her children who also help her with tending the store. Señora Benigna will invest her loan funds in buying provisions (rice, noodles and sugar) for the most part, but she will also buy fruit to stock up the stand that she has in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Beun

texts.en:
Beun S., 41, lives in the Battambang province with her husband and four young children. She grows and sells vegetables, making $3 US a day, and is supported by her husband who collects palm juice, making $3 US a day. Her family is aided by four of her children who are employed.

In light of these times of economic difficulties, Beun S. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Despite her age, 21-year-old Julieta R. already knows the importance of taking responsibilities seriously. She got married and became a mother of one at a very young age, yet she knows her obligations very well. 

In order to contribute additional income in the family, Julieta used her experience in farming to start her own business. She confessed having only Php 2,000.00 as starting capital. But no one can really guess where one is heading, especially if that person exerts a lot of hard work and has unwavering determination. This is true of Julieta, who has a growing business at present.

Now, she actively participates in the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and enjoys its quality services. Julieta is applying for a loan which she will use in purchasing fertilizers. She also finds CEVI to be a good avenue for improving her knowledge on handling business, through the institution’s free training and seminars.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama K. is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She lives with her family in Mariakani, Coast Province. At the centre of Mariakani Market, Dama operates a fish-selling stand. She has been in this business for the last 12 years and she mainly deals in small dried fish.

This loan will be Dama's second one from KADET. With the money from this loan, she plans to purchase five bags of small dried fish to resell. People in Dama's area eat the small fish as a staple food, which makes the fish very marketable.

In future, Dama hopes to become a major supplier of dried fish and also wants to start selling bigger, fresh fish as they are also gaining popularity in the area.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy five bags of dried fish to resell

loans.name: Hel

texts.en:
S., 33, with her life partner Morn, 35 (shown in the picture), has been operating a business since 2000. Their marriage has resulted in seven children who are still young and attend school. S. has a skill of making local kitchen accessories by hand with bamboo and Morn has a skill of decorating wood for building. After a while, she could earn much more and her husband could also make a better living. 

The family wants to earn more income by operating another line of work, farming, with their savings. So S. and Morn decided to take a loan of 1,300,000.00 Riel (Khmer currency) to buy a plot of farmland located next to her house. She dreams of having a bigger house and a degree for her children. S. was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland located next to her house

loans.name: Francisca Magaly

texts.es: Francisca Magaly R. C. tiene 35 años de edad. Francisca se dedica a la venta de sillas y mesas plásticas, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar. Hasta la fecha doña Francisca ha estado trabajando con financiamientos de Fundación León 2000 y nuevamente hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como: mesas, sillas  y bancas plásticas. Su deseo es lograr administrar de buena forma su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca Magaly R. C. is 35. Francisca sells plastic tables and chairs. She has obtained fixed customers since she started her business. This has allowed her to get earnings that have helped pay the household expenses. Francisca has worked with loans from the Fundación León 2000. She now turns again to this organization. She needs a loan to buy certain articles like plastic tables, chairs, and benches. Her wish is to run her business well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hye Woho Den Group

texts.en:
Florence is a hair dresser by profession. She is 25 years old, single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called "Hye woho den", meaning "Strengthen Yourself". The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply their local market and nearby communities and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has been employed to operate a motorcycle taxi business in Naivasha town for the last 2 years.   He is 37 years old, married to Annah Njeri and they have three school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend.  This will be his first loan and he plans to set up a grocery shop for his wife, to boost the family's income.

He also plans to buy his own motorcycle in future which will enable him to be self employed.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To assist wife with capital to set up a grocery shop.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a divorced man who owns a small business making and selling timber. His production site is located in the Stryi area, and is surrounded by woods that are used to produce timber. Igor is hardworking and disciplined. He has been in this business for 12 years and, during this time, he has been able to develop a good client base and run a profitable business.

Igor would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase his working capital. This loan will allow him to increase the assortment of his products and attract more clients.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch S., 65, is married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and children. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of US $10 per day. The family is also assisted by all of her children who are currently employed in a local garment factory, and another one is a teacher at a local primary school. They all help cover the household expenses.

To make a living, S. is engaged in selling clothes, earning an income of approximately US$3 per day. This is her third loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She and her children are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Onome

texts.en:
Onome lives in Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells groceries, drinks, fruit and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. With her combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members.

Onome is 49 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a commercial tailor. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Onome is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more fruit, drinks and groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and fruit to sell

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Most of the Cambodian people earn a living as farmers. One of these people, Ben S., 40, is a low-income farmer living in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a good and determined mother who has tried to feed her four children since they were very young. Her husband is a local teacher and helps her plant rice when he is not teaching. In the past, Ben S. always rented a neighbor’s cow to help plow her farmland and right now, she hopes to own a cow. To cut the rental cost, Ben S. requested a Kiva loan to buy a cow for her farming activities.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her farming activities

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem Y., 45, is married with six children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at her home in the village, earning an income of US $1.50 per day. Her husband is a deputy village chief with a monthly US $20 wage. The family is also assisted mainly by two of her children who are employed as construction builders. They are able to contribute to the family US $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. Y. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase pineapple seedlings for growing. With the remainder, she plans to expand her grocery business. This is her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. Y. is pictured while she is sitting in the hummock.

loans.use: buy pineapple seedlings and groceries to expand the business

loans.name: Smas

texts.en: Smas R., 46, is a humble mother who has three children. All three children are studying at the local public school. Currently, Smas R. stays at home to care for the children and to do housework. This family is supported, financially, by Smas R.’s husband. He sells a variety of merchandise from province to province. He also buys items in bulk, on credit, from market sellers in Phnom Penh. He then supplies his products to people who are sellers in small markets in each province. Smas R. finds that her husband’s enterprise is a very profitable one and he is able to earn enough money to meet what her family needs. She would like to ask for a loan for her husband to accrue business capital.

loans.use: To accrue his business capital.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia Q. is a 35-year old married woman who lives in the village of Brgy Binicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by food vending, pig fattening and selling ice candy.

Alicia’s husband Pepito Q. helps his wife in running the businesses. They have 4 children who are between 10 mos and 16 years old. Three of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Alicia Q. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in food vending, pig fattening and ice candy business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 35,000 from her business activities.

Alicia Q. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her food vending and ice candy, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 16th loan, in the amount of Php 19,000, which she intends to use on food vending, pig fattening and ice candy. Alicia Q. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspiration for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata T. Ekasiba is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children who lives in Igara Busia District and sells cereals in the nearby Miyanga market, a business she started in 2005 as a source for generating income.

With her future goal being educating her children, Consolata would like to increase her stock to be able to generate enough income to achieve this. It is for this reason she would like to get a loan worth Ksh. 10,000 that will be (to some extent) influential to her business putting her somewhat ahead as far as fulfilling her goal is concerned.

loans.use: increase cereals stock

loans.name: C2137 Abakundana Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 19 years old and single. She lives in a village called Kabuga, in the Gasabo district of the Kigali province.  Kabuga is not far from the Rwanda International Airport.

Francoise owns a small business selling foods such as beans, sorghum, and so on. Even though she has her own business Francoise is also a group representative of the ABAKUNDANA group; this group contains eight people: six women and two men. 

Francoise has chosen the business of selling foods because in her region it is needed. Her business is well organized as well as known in the region, this is very helpful for her because it is a good way to get more customers from her community; Francoise employs one of her neighbors as an assistant. 

Her business is open from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening even during the weekends. Right now Francoise is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sorghum and beans to sell. This loan will allow her to earn more profits which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy beans and sorghum for resale

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been working as a baker for the past ten years. After this long experience, she decided to open a small snack and bakery in her town to earn additional money for her family. She became well-known for the delicious food products she offers to her clients, especially her Lebanese bread.

Today, Laurence is requesting $1,000 to buy additional merchandise like flour, oil, dairy products, etc., to increase her sales and so her income, and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Rabacca

texts.en:
Rabacca sells groceries at retail prices to her customers, who are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because she is able to support her husband in meeting the basic needs and necessitates of the family.

Rabacca is 36 years old and is married with four children. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband works and he also supports their home.

Rabacca is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío La Estancia, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de cinco años, actualmente siembra maracuyá, que es una fruta muy producida en la zona, los agricultores se han venido asociando y actualmente existen diversos fundos (extensiones de terrenos agrícolas colindantes pertenecientes a diversos agricultores) especializados en el cultivo de esta fruta, esta asociación les permite conseguir desarrollar su cultivo de una manera óptima para poder obtener productos de buena calidad, así como también conseguir vender sus cosechas en el mercado a un buen precio.

Elio desea aplicarle a su cultivo fertilizantes y riegos para que la producción sea de calidad, siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maracuyá.

El es un hombre bastante responsable y entregado a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como productor agrícola y mejorar su calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Elio is a 34 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the village of La Estancia, a rural area of the Olmos district, which is in the Lambayeque province, two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked in the fields for the last 5 years. More specifically, he sows passion fruit, which is a very common fruit in the area. The farmers have been collaborating and there exist various estates (extensions of adjacent agricultural lands belonging to different farmers) specializing in the cultivation of this fruit. This association permits them to pursue the optimal cultivation of the fruits so they can obtain high-quality products and also sell their crops in the market at a good price.

Elio wishes to apply fertilizers to his crops and to irrigate them to obtain a higher quality. With this in mind, he has sought his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva partner) for 1500 Peruvian Soles which he will use in the maintenance of his passion fruit crops.

He is a responsible man and is committed to his work. His biggest wish is to continue growing as a farmer and to improve his quality of life. His neighbors and friends consider him a trust-worthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and irrigation for his crops

loans.name: Djénèbou

texts.fr:
Djénèbou K. N.est une veuve de 37 ans et mère de cinq enfants  qui vit avec ses enfants chez son défunt époux à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Djénèbou K. N.mène une activité d’achat et de vente   des draps de lits,  de pagnes wax et  de bois de chauffe depuis plus de quatre ans. 
Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. 
Après plusieurs prêts solidaires, et deux prêts individuels, elle est à son troisième individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 20 paquets de draps de lits, 5 complets de tissus brodés et 5 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, respectivement à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso.  
  Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djénèbou K. N.is a 37-year-old widow and the mother of five children. She lives with her children in her deceased spouse's home in Wayerma I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso. For four years Djénèbou K. N.has been running a business buying and selling bed linens, pagnes wax (colorful West African cloth), and firewood. She has a good reputation in the business and receives many orders, but her resources do not permit her to fill them. After several group loans and two individual loans, she is seeking her third individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy twenty sets of bed linens, five suits of embroidered cloth, and 5 cartloads of firewood, in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) and in areas surrounding the city of Sikasso. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCA, which will be used to contribute to family expenses and to pay interest on her loan, with the remainder to be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La señora Sandra Maria tiene 36 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación posee un pequeña tienda, madre de 2 hijos una niña de 6 años y un niño de 10 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la planta como albañil. Ella tiene 5 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a diferentes clientes pues estos recursos lo ha obtenido han sido por los financiamientos que han sido de gran ayuda. en la actualidad esta solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día en ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 36 years old and sells clothing around her town and out of her home where she has a small store. She is the mother of two, a daughter who is 6 and a son who is 10. Her husband works as a construction worker. For the past 5 years she has worked in clothing sales and she sells her products to many different customers. She obtained the resources to start her business through loans which have helped her substantially. She is seeking a loan to buy raw materials. Her desire is to improve every day in selling her products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jader Ismael

texts.es:
