Jader Ismael de 28 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Esther Garcia con quien tiene un niño de 8 añitos de nombre Jean Carlos que esta estudiando el 3er grado de primaria. Jader trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace mas de 2 años como operario de limpieza.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de reparar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado, y si el dinero lo permite hacer un pequeño anexo de madera donde pueda tener la cocina, el lavandero y el baño que actualmente estan en el patio, y como ya estamos comenzando el invierno desea cerrar y ponerle techo para mejor comodidad de su familia, ya que con las lluvias es dificil cocinar al aire libre.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, pues son su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Jader Ismael is 28 years old and married to Sra. Esther Garcia. They have an eight year old son named Jean Carlos who is in third grade. Jader has been working for the Town of Juigalpa for more than two years as a janitor.

He is requesting his third loan in order to repair the roof of his house, which is in bad condition. If there is money left over, he will build a wooden extension into his current patio that will house the kitchen, a laundry area, and a bathroom. Since winter is approaching, he wants to enclose the area and put a roof on it so that his family will be more comfortable. It is difficult to cook outdoors when it is raining.

His greatest wish is to provide his family with better living conditions since they are the reason for his existence.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of his house & enclose the kitchen area

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Madame Fati B. is 32 years old and married with five children. Her husband works as an exporter of goods. To supplement her family's income, she has been selling soap and other personal products in Lome's main market since 2003. She also sells her products throughout her own neighborhood. Madame Fati has requested her first microloan from WAGES of 150,000 CFA in order to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase soap and other products

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Vecinas está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Maritza del Socorro O. G., coordinadora del grupo quien 1980 inicio con el comercio de frutas y verduras. Ella tiene nueve hijos de los cuales el mayor de 30 años es el que le ayuda en el negocio y los cinco menores que están a su cargo y estudian ellos tienen 9, 13, 15, 19 y 23. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Elizabeth del Socorro Mercado quien vende ropa desde hace 20 años y María Estavana L. comercializa pipián, ayote, cebolla y tomate.
texts.en:
The Las Vecinas ("The Neighbors") Group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Ms. Maritza del Socorro O. G., who coordinates the group. In 1980, she began selling fruits and vegetables. She has nine children, five of whom are still in her care. They are 9, 13, 15, 19, and 23 years old. Her fellow group members are Elizabeth del Socorro M. O., who has been selling clothing for 20 years, and María Estevana L. G., who sells pipián and ayote [types of squash], onions, and tomatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetable crops

loans.name: Liuli

texts.es: Liuli, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijas y su nieta. Tiene dos oficios, durante el día trabaja como empleada del hogar y por las tardes vende productos de belleza.  En este último trabajo, sus ventas lo realiza previamente mediante catalogo, mostrando a sus vecinas y amistades de trabajo, de esa manera le hacen el pedido y tener que esperar cierto tiempo hasta que le traigan el producto en demanda, puesto que el no contar con suficiente presupuesto no le permite tener productos en stock.  Lleva 3 meses esta labor y esta muy contenta con el negocio que realiza. Sus planes a futuro es tener una tienda, en donde pueda dedicarse su hija que se encuentra desempleada, además considera que es más rentable que el negocio actual que tiene, por otra parte construir su casa a base de material noble. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas, además se siente satisfecha con sus compañeras de grupo por lo responsables que son. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar estantes y productos para instalar su tienda y de ese modo su hija se dedique en ella.
texts.en:
Liuli, 40, lives with her 2 daughters and a granddaughter in a house that she owns. She has two jobs. During the day she works as a housekeeper and in the evenings she sells beauty products. She sells beauty products from catalogs, showing the products to her friends and neighbors who then order from her. Liuli doesn't have enough money to keep products in stock, so she only orders products when she has a firm order from her customers. Consequently, she and they to wait a time for the products to arrive. Liuli has operated the business for 3 months and she is very happy with it. In the future, she would like to have a store where her daughter, who is unemployed, could work. She also thinks it would be more profitable than her current operation. In addition to her goals for the business, Liuli would like to make improvements to her house. This is her fifteenth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She says, too, that she is pleased with the other members of her group because they have demonstrated that they are responsible. Liuli will use the loan to buy shelving and products to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and supplies for beauty products business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old widow woman. She has three children. After the death of her husband, she found herself alone taking the responsibility for her children. As a result she decided to work in the occupation she knows, so she established a tailoring business in her home in 2000. With her business income, she was able to support her family. Now her children are starting to work and they help their mother to satisfy the heavy demands of their life.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase tailoring supplies and additional textiles to produce a variety of products for her clientele so as to earn more income.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Micro-finance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free Kiva loans to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase tailoring supplies and additional textiles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Nakanja is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Mary has a business selling matooke (green plaintain), which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more matooke.  With this loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees. In the future, Mary hopes to own another business like charcoal sales. Mary is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to deal with customers through financial literacy training. 

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more matooke

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar de 29 años, con quien trabaja en la chacra y juntos desean poderle brindar a su querido hijo Aldair una mejor vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Marcela trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su esposo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará 5 sacos de semillas de arveja, en lo cual invertirá todo el dinero, ya que cada saco le está costando seiscientos nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcela, 39, is a very cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Oscar, 29, and she works with him on a farm. Together, they want to provide a better life for their beloved son, Aldair. Working arduously each day in their fields, Marcela is changing their lives. With her husband she plants beans, corn, and gladioli, which they sell in the markets of Tarma and La Merced, since this is where they can obtain the best prices. What she likes most about her work is to care for the plantings so that they remain free of diseases and pests. She has been doing this work for 19 years, and what she considers most difficult is to take her products to the markets where they are sold, since she must carry sacks that are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and in this way obtain better prices. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will be very beneficial in helping her to grow as a farmer. In her communal bank she is a very active and cooperative member. With the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy 5 sacks of pea seeds. She will use all of the loan proceeds this way, since each sack is costing her 600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence B. lives the village of Salamague Lamut, Ifugao. He is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last two years, he has made a living by raising livestock. He earns about 5,000 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Lawrence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his first loan, for 10,000 PHP, to expand his business. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve his family's living standards. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small livestock business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She established, 7 years ago, a tailoring business out of her home. She is specialized in sewing beads on the textiles.  As with the majority of Lebanese women, her story illustrates the day-to-day challenges in running a business to help their husbands with household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase textiles and beads in order to expand her business operation to earn more profit.  This will be her second loan.

loans.use: purchase textiles and beads

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité “La PrimaV.” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Estanislao en la zona de Bertoni Calle San Blas . Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, fabrica de carbón, cría de animales,  etc.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
 Este comité está empezando con el primer  ciclo, con muchas ganas de sobresalir adelante con este grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Leopoldina quien se dedica a la cría de animales, especialmente gallinas ponedoras, así ella vende huevos diariamente en el negocio que tiene en su casa.
También tiene cría de pollos s que una vez que estén listos o con el peso ideal para la venta ella ofrece a sus clientes y estos le dejan buena ganancia. 
Ella trabaja mucho para atender todas las actividades que tiene en su casa ya que tiene diversos como sus animales, su negocio, sus hijos y su casa, pero se encuentra muy satisfecha con todo ya que nos comenta que se siente realizada haciendo todas las actividades.
Quiere continuar y mejorar en cuanto a cría de pollos y gallinas para lo que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The “La PrimaV.” committee was formed with the union of several residents of the city of San Estanislao in the Bertoni Calle San Blas area. All of the members of the committee have different independent activities, such as sales, manufacturing charcoal, raising animals, etc. The members formed a very close group capable of undertaking activities together that strengthen their unity. 

This committee is starting its first cycle and is very eager to get ahead with this group. One of the members is Leopoldina, who works raising animals, especially laying hens. She sells eggs everyday in the business she has at her house.  She also raisies chickens that, once they are ready or at the ideal weight for sale, she offers to her customers and this leaves here with a good profit. 
 
She works a lot to attend to all of the activities she has at home since they are very diverse: her animals, her business, her children and her house. But she is very satisfied with everything and she tells us that she feels fulfilled with all of her activities. She wants to continue and improve with raising the chickens and the hens and that is why she is asking for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and other materials.

loans.name: Rehma

texts.en: Rehma is 30 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of two and ten. Her children go to school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and Rehma sells clothes. She has had this business for ten years. With this loan she will buy more clothes to sell. With the profit she will put aside savings. Her business is successful because she serves many customers. In future, Rehma would like to make 50% return on her investment.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bella Isabel

texts.es:
Bella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) y ropa. Vive con su esposo en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal y ropa. Poco a poco a incrementado su cartera de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u, cremas, ropa. Una de las preocupaciones que tiene es la delincuencia ya que comprar mercadería y la deja en stop. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Bella sells Yambal products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to begin selling items independently) and clothing. She lives with her husband in Primavera de Duran (semi urban area with a loss to its ecology on the outskirts of Guayaquil).

To help her husband with the household expenses, Bella began working by selling Yambal products and clothing. Little by little she has been increasing her customer base because she works from very early in the morning by selling her products to her neighbors and friends; she sells perfumes from $ 20.00 to $ 75.00 per unit as well as creams and clothing. One of her concerns is the delinquency that hurts her business.

With the loan, Bella wants to buy Yambal products like perfumes, creams and clothing. In the future, she wishes to finish building her home.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, and clothing.

loans.name: Tania Rani's Group

texts.en:
Tania Rani S. A. lives in the second largest city of Pakistan, which is called Lahore and is known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Fareed town with her family in a two-room brick house. She moved here after her marriage a few years ago.
 
She is 33 years old, married to S. A. and has four sons. All of them are enrolled in local school and are getting their education.
 
Her husband works in a banquet hall and Tania supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from the wholesale markets of Lahore named “Ichra and Shahalmi” and sells them to her local area clients. She is very supportive in nature and always ready to support her family in every difficult time. Her earning allows her to pay for the school fees of her children and also the utilities expenses of her house.

Tania has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her brother, who operates a welding shop in the market. He repairs various iron items and spare parts there and earns income. With the loan, he will buy another welding machine, which will help him work better and provide his customers better services.
 
Tania is hopeful that this investment will be helpful for her brother and will be able to improve his business. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for welding business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza R. lives in the village of West Poblacion, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last two years, she has made a living by selling food and beverages, and now earns about 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this yerar, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem N. was born in 1959 and is a villager in Thlok Doun Tum village in Takeo province. She is a widow with two children; one is a laborer at Malaya, the other is attending public school. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. 

She earns little income though she tries to work hard. So Mrs. Loem N. is asking for a loan to add to her savings--she will start a new business by buying a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan she is going to hire farming laborers to harvest rice.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rukia Bini

texts.en: Rukia Bini A., 42 years old, is married to Ghalib. Rukia owns a beauty shop and has been in this business for the last two years. She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this marks her second loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase hair products, creams, soaps and shampoo for her business. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. Rukia's dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase hair products, creams, soaps and shampoo

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. 

Sylvia has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Sylivia sells her products from home, by means of retail.  

Sylvia has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more passion fruits. The main business challenges for Sylvia include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transport and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.   

Sylvia lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruits

loans.name: Vuffie

texts.en:
Vuffie is 35 years old and married with three children who are two, four and 14. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. Vuffie is described as friendly by her neighbors and friends. She is a rice farmer and hog-grower and earns money by selling harvested rice and fattened pigs. Vuffie works hard to sustain her family and to be able to extend help to her friends also. 

Vuffie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI to purchase fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes to have a stable business and says that receiving this loan would help her immensely.


About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Kakiya

texts.en:
Kakiya N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and presently has no children. Kakiya has a business selling shoes, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Kakiya has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kakiya hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Kakiya hopes to build rental houses. 

Kakiya is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 48-year-old single mother of one.  She has been able to bring up her 22-year-old child with the income she gets by selling health products. She left employment seven years ago and went into business so that she would earn better income.  She hopes to have a fully established business in the future.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for the business training that they offer. She has requested 20,000 Kes from Faulu Kenya to buy depressor and a blood pressure machine.

loans.use: To buy a depressor and blood pressure machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Grupo Unidas Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel desD. chica vivía a orillas del río Paraguay con su padres y cinco hermanos: tres varones y dos mujeres; su padre era pescador y su madre vendía pescado.
Cada vez que el río subía tenían que abandonar su casa debido a que esta quedaba bajo agua y en aquella época no existía todavía el muro D. contención, ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer curso por que cuando cumplió quince años su padre les dejó y como ella es la hermana mayor tenía que trabajar para ayudarle a su mamá a criar a sus hermanos.
Empezó a trabajar como empleada doméstica, a los 19 años tuvo su primer hijo y tuvo que irse a trabajar en una estancia como cocinera para poder criarle a su hijo.
Actualmente la señora Isabel vive en la ciudad D. Concepción en el barrio San Francisco con su pareja, Carlos Alberto D. 32 años, quien se dedica a ayudante D. motosierrista, tiene además dos hijos: Daysi D. 15 años y Jose Miguel D. 8 años, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. ropas y zapatos.
Ella es miembro del Comité Grupo Unidas, el cual se formó con 19 integrantes, quienes desean superar la pobreza en la que viven con sus familias, pero necesitan para ello la ayuda económica D. Kiva mediante Fundación Paraguaya, por eso solicitan este crédito, D. modo a que puedan progresar, generar mayores ingresos y percibir una mejor calidad D. vida.
El crédito se invertiría en la compra D. ropas y zapatos para la reventa, teniendo en cuenta que las compras en grandes cantidades reducen los costos y aumentan las ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel lived on the banks of the River Paraguay with her parents and five siblings (three brothers and two sisters) since she was a little girl.  Her father was a fisherman and her mother sold fish.

Each time the river rose they had to leave their home because it would end up under water.  Back then there was still no retaining wall.  Isabel could only study up to her third year of secondary education because when she was 15 her father abandoned the family and, as the eldest daughter, she had to work to help her mom raise her siblings.

Maria Isabel started working as a cleaner.  At the age of 19 she had her first child and had to go and work on a farm stay as a cook in order to be able to raise her child.

Isabel currently lives in San Francisco neighborhood, in the city of Concepción with her partner, 32 year-old Carlos Alberto, who works as an assistant chainsaw operator.  They have two children: 15 year-old Daysi and 8 year-old José Miguel.  She currently works selling clothes and shoes.

Isabel is a member of the 'Grupo Unidas' committee which has 19 members who all want to escape the poverty that they live in with their families.  However, in order to achieve this they need the financial help of Kiva through Fundación Paraguaya.  They are requesting this loan so that they can make progress, make more income and enjoy a better quality of life.  Isabel will invest her loan in buying clothes and shoes for resale, bearing in mind that purchasing goods in large quantities reduces costs and increases profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old man living in Bint Jbeil. He has five kids. Working as a hardware dealer, Ali has 10 years of experience. He has good reputation for his commitment to his work. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the fourth time, in order to buy new products to increase his income. His previous loans had a good impact on his family’s social situation.  He is intent on buying a big, modern pick-up in the future, that can fit a larger number of products to sell.

loans.use: To buy new products to increase his income.

loans.name: Tomas Adan

texts.es: Tomas tiene 57 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos años que están a su cargo. Su negocio es el destace de cerdo. Inicio su negocio con el apoyo de su familia tiene trabajando en esta actividad 5 años aproximadamente, los desafíos que el enfrenta son de salud ya que tiene que recorrer distancias muy grandes para comprar los cerdos que le ofrecen. Su sueño en el futuro es brindarle mejoras a su vivienda y brindarle una mayor comodidad a su familia. El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Tomas, 57, is married and has two children in his care.  His business is butchering pigs.  He started the business with help from his family and has been in this line of work for about 5 years.  The challenges he faces are health related because he has to travel long distances to buy the pigs he’s offered.  His dream for the future is to do some home improvements and provide greater comfort to his family.  He will use the money to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 21 years old.  She is married and has 1 child.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

Elma runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years.  She sells a veriety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, etc.   

Elma has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like sardines and other grocery items.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua cooks foods such as fufu (mashed cassava), banku (fermented maize dough), groundnut soup, okra soup and others at Ankwanda, a village near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Efua has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy ingredients such as cassava, plantains, maize, groundnut paste and other food items to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better place.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as cassava, plantains, maize, groundnut paste and other food items.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa and her family own a wheat flour mill business. Maysa and her husband work in it. Due to the closure in the Gaza Strip, Maysa and her husband managed to have flour produced in their house and distribute it to houses and stores within Deir Al balah in the Gaza Strip. 

Maysa and her husband need pieces and accessories that should be added to the mill to enhance its performance, as well as bags to pack the flour. Maysa received a loan from FATEN for this purpose. 

Maysa is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed in her place.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour mill accessories and bags to pack flour in

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is married with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Honorata is 46 years old and has 5 children who are in school.

Honorata has a sari-sari (convenience) store business in the Philippines. Honorata requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Honorata has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Honorata would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sacsayhuaman Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hayde; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es soltero y tiene 3 hijos, de 25, 24 y 19 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la elaboración de comidas caseras, la socia tiene un stand en el mercado San Blas en la misma ciudad de Cusco, la socia desea el crédito para comprar víveres y poder comprar los ingredientes al por mayor como aceite, arroz y papa, que es lo básico para elaborar la mayoría de los platos, también comprara fideos entre otros ingredientes. La socia comenta que ella aún apoya a la menor de sus hijas que está estudiando en el instituto la carrera profesional de Contabilidad; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los diferentes platos.
Las socias Alejandrina, Elba, Evelyn, Felicitas; estan en ese orden en la parte superior de la foto grupal, las socias tenian permiso de retirarse antes y dos de ellas llegaron despues.

Los socios desesan invertir el prestamo en la compra de instrumentos musicales, artesanía, implementar la imprenta. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank SACSAYHUAMAN.  This bank is in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province and department.

The member is Hayde and she is 49-years-old, single, and has three children who are 25, 24, and 19-years-old.  She works preparing home-cooked meals.  She has a stand in the San Blas market in Cusco.  She would like to use to loan to buy food and to be able to buy ingredients at wholesale prices such as: oil, rice, and potatoes which are the basic ingredients used to make the majority of the dishes she prepares.  She will also buy noodles, among other ingredients.  She comments that she still supports her youngest daughter who is studying the professional career of accounting in an educational institution.  She is requesting the loan to invest in ingredients used to prepare the different dishes.

The members Alejandrina, Elba, Evelyn, and Felicitas are in this order in the upper part of the group photo.  The members have permission to leave early and two also arrived later.

The members would like to invest the loan in musical instruments, artisan products, and printing.

She is very satisfied with and thankful for the support that they have offered her through this medium and she promises to follow through with the payment of her debt in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing different dishes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa lives in Choluteca, Honduras where she makes a living selling cosmetics, basic foodstuffs, and freshly made tortillas out of her home. She has been engaged in this activity for many years and has a reliable customer base. Elsa is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase basic foodstuffs, cosmetics, and ingredients for making tortillas. She is a returning client and is grateful for the support she has received from Prisma.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, cooking oil, meats, soft drinks, firewood, lime, lotions, perfumes, and moisturizers.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia works hard to support her family. Arsenia is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Arsenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

Arsenia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un luchador incansable que nunca se ha rendido ante las dificultades pues hace 20 años cuando fue despedido de su empleo decidió empezar como independiente en el centro de la ciudad a vender diferentes productos.  

Hoy después de ser reconocido en el sector, Pedro se dedica a vender mercancía propia de las diferentes épocas del año y aunque por ser vendedor ambulante enfrenta con dificultad las épocas de lluvia, esto no es un impedimento para salir adelante. 

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de prendas y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Pedro is a tireless fighter who has never given up in face of difficulties because twenty years ago when he was laid off from his job he decided to start independently selling various products downtown.  

At present, having become well known in the sector, Pedro sells seasonal items during the different times of the year.  Even though being a street vendor is difficult during the rainy season this has not been an impediment for his getting ahead.

He needs a loan now to buy larger amounts of articles of clothing to improve his profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en:
Tsengel is 54 years old and lives with her five daughters and grandchildren in an apartment in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. One of her daughters works at the leather processing factory in Ulaanbaatar city. Another daughter is a college student. 

Tsengel has been a single mother for many years. She started to trade animal raw materials, such as skin, hooves, and horns, at the local market in 1995. She has many years of work experience. She is planning to expand her business and increase her business profits. She has taken 10 loans from XacBank previously. With those loans, she managed her business and personal life very well. She takes small amounts of loans and covers the operational expenses. She carefully manages her financial calculations and expenditures. She is a hard-working and diligent woman who is requesting 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal hides and to increase her capital turnover.

loans.use: to purchase more animal hides.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 31 year old, resides in Siem Reap province, an area full of ancient temples. She is a housewife. and her husband is a soldier earning $4.50 per day. She has two children, and both of them are in school. Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. 

Pov would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike to transport watermelons to sell. This loan will help Pov to have a new career that can earn some money for her living expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport watermelons to sell.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is single and has no children. He has a general store where he sells goods such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil. He has been selling these products for one year on a wholesale basis. This business has enabled him to meet the needs of his extended family. Denis needs a loan to be able to expand his business by buying more foodstuffs. With his profits he wishes to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La socia sigue con su tienda de abarrotes, ella esta creciendo cada mes gradualmente y le va muy bien, ella con lo que ingresa de la venta de sus productos en la tienda de abarrotes puede apoyar en los estudios y alimentación en el hogar para con sus hijos, la socia ha podido terminar de consturir su vivienda con los ingresos que le genera la venta de sus productos y gracias al prestamo quew solicita ella puede implementar su negocio, en esta oportunidad la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes y comprar panetones al por mayor, harinas en bolsas grandes, aceites en bidones, leche en cajas, arroz en sacos, azucar y todo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y asi poder continuar con el ingreso de dinero al hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida y el pago de los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Estela continues with her grocery store, which is growing gradually every month and is going very well for her.  The money that comes in from the sale of products in her grocery store can support the studies and nourishment at home of her children.  She has been able to finish building her house with the income from the sale of her products, and thanks to the loan that she is requesting she can stock her business.

With this loan she wants to stock her grocery store and buy panettone in bulk, flours in large packages, canned oil, boxed milk, packaged rice, sugar, and everything necessary to stock her store.  In this way she can continue bringing money into the home and improve her quality of life and the payment of her children's studies.

loans.use: to invest in buying products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Luis Mariano

texts.es: El Luis Mariano es un hombre trabajador que siempre está al pendiente de los que su familia necesita. El se dedica al transporte de carga pesada. Desde hace mas de 14 años  que tiene experiencia con este tipo de actividad. Luis conoce a todos sus clientes y lo que le solicitan es por eso que él se esfuerza todos los días por brindar un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas y brindarle otras mejoras al camión. Se siente muy agradecido por la confianza depositado en su persona.
texts.en: Luis Mariano is a hardworking man who is always on top of what his family needs. He works in heavy cargo transportation. He has more than 14 years experience in this type of activity. Luis knows all of his customers and what they ask of him. That is why he works hard every day to offer a good service.     The reason for the loan is to buy tires and do some improvements on he truck. He is very grateful for the trust put in his person.

loans.use: to buy tires and do some improvements on his truck.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a responsible wife who helps her husband in managing their corn field business to support their needs. Due to financial difficulties in financing their business, the 30-year-old woman is now asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn seeds and insecticides for farming. Profits will be used to pay for hired labourers.

Despite the fact that it is difficult to work in the field, she wanted to save for the educational purposes of her two children, so instead of hiring one or two helpers on their farm, she saved the money for their school allowances. This caused her to help her husband to improve their sources of income. In this regard, Analyn is aiming to increase their yields in the coming harvesting season. 

In the future, she is hoping that her children will become degree holders and will be of big help to lift up their poor lifestyle into something better.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and insecticides for farming

loans.name: Shukurullo

texts.ru: Шукурулло проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 20 лет. Он холост. Шукурулло уже 2 года занимается торговлей. У него смешанный ассортимент товара. Он берет кредит для приобретения торговой точки на рынке.
texts.en: Shukurullo lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 20 years old and single.  Shukurullo has been involved in sales for two years.  He has a mixed selection of merchandise.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new retail outlet at the market.

loans.use: to buy a new retail outlet at the market

loans.name: Purevdulam

texts.en: Purevdulam is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in her own apartment in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur and her son is a school student. She started her business in 1999 by renting a counter in market. Many new markets have opened in town therefore, she decided to build her own shop made with sandwich panels (a type of construction material). She has already planned where to build a shop, and it is located in a much more crowded place. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy sandwich panels. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My son will join college next year therefore, I need to act aggressive to increase my income."

loans.use: To buy sandwich panels to build a grocery store

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 20-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Yar requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 31 years old, single, and has one child. She lives in Gotocan Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Christy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years.

Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP through her business. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items in order to expand her product offerings. Christy has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

location.town: Gotocan Daku, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ibrahima Layré

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de trois enfants. Il conduit un taxi de transport urbain dans sa localité.Son activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Il assure ainsi les frais de scolarité, de santé et les dépenses d'alimentation. Malheureusement, son taxi est tombé en panne de moteur.C'est pourquoi, il sollicite un pret de 450 000f pour acheter un moteur neuf afin de reprendre son travail et entretenir sa famille.Son ambition est de disposer d'un parc de taxi de transport dans la ville.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man and father of three children.  He drives an urban transport taxi in his area.  His business is what allows him to meet his ends and those of his family. Through this, he is able to pay for tuition, health, and food expenses.

Unfortunately, his taxi broke down. This is why he is asking for a loan of 450,000 francs [XOF] in order to purchase a new engine so he can start working again and continue to support his family.

His aspiration is to have a fleet of taxicabs in the city.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine sells cows; she has been running this business for the past four years. Christine is 37 years old, and she has four children who are between 6 and 17 years old. They all go to school. She has requested the loan to buy more cows to sell. With the profits, she will pay school fees. She would like to own a motorcycle which could be useful for generating income in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a married father of 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is a serious farmer who sees the need of expanding his project to animal rearing.  

Kenneth thanks Kiva for the loan given to him that allowed him to purchase eucalyptus seedlings for planting.  He is sure this long term project will help him in the future. 

Kenneth's other business is a motorcycle transport business where he transports people from one place to another at a cost.  On realizing that he does not have the qualifications for formal employment, he decided to employ himself by selling a piece of his land to earn income to buy a motorcycle.  

Kenneth did not stop here, he also started farming to supplement his income.  As this is not enough income, he would love to reduce his milk buying expenditures, and has requested a loan to buy a cow for milk production.  He is challenged by unpredictable weather changes, just like other farmers. Kenneth took a photo with a motorcycle which is one of the businesses he does.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production.

loans.name: Akouélé Christine

texts.en:
Miss Akouélé Christine T. was born in Aného on June 19, 1980. She dropped out of secondary school due to lack of resources and started selling various discount products (secondhand items, shoes, underwear, etc) to meet her own needs. At age 26, she is obliged to take care of her two parents who are both suffering from facial hemiplegia after a car accident. But the income from her small business does not cover all of her needs. She thus requested financial support in the amount of $550 which was paid back without incident. Miss Akouélé Christine T. has requested a new credit of $900 that will be used as capital for purchasing and selling soap, perfume and imported drinks. This will increase her revenue and allow her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mlle T. Akouélé Christine est née à Aného le 19 Juin 1980. Elle arrêta les études au niveau secondaire faute de moyens et entreprend la vente des produits de liquidation (friperie, chaussures, slip…) pour assurer ses propres besoins. Agée de 26 ans, elle se trouve dans l’obligation de prendre en charge ses parents tous 2 atteints d’une hémiplégie faciale après un accident de voiture. Or, le revenu de son petit commerce n’arrive pas à couvrir tous ces besoins. Malgré. Elle sollicita alors un appui financier de $550 qu’elle avait bien remboursé sans incident. Mlle T. Akouélé Christine sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $900 qui va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente de savon, de parfum et des boissons importés. Ceci augmentera ses revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: to purchase and sell soap, perfume and imported drinks

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing I. is 34 years old and married with five (5) children. She gained business experience working with her mother, and she started her own business in 2001. She will use the loan to help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Seruz

texts.en: N. Seruz Nuru Oglu has small food shop in Saatli town. The scale of his business is low in comparison to his increased family expenses. Food products should be stared in refrigerators, but he has only one small refrigerator and summer knocks on the door. So Seruz deiced to purchase one more refrigerator for storage of  food products. He needs 700 USD to purchase the refrigerator.

loans.use: He needs 700 USD to purchase refrigerator for food storage

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Mr. Wilmer D. is an enterprising young man who is in the business of selling construction materials. The business was founded by his father more than fifteen years ago and now he is in charge of it. He is requesting for a loan to buy more new materials (cement, lime, sand, etc.) that will allow him to obtain bigger profits once these are sold. Mr. D. told us that he is very proud of his business and what satisfies him the most is to know that he has generated 4 jobs in a very poor country like Nicaragua.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Wilmer D. es un jóven emprendedor que se ha dedicado al negocio de vender materiales de construcción. El negocio fue fundado por su padre hace más de quince años y ahora él está a cargo del negocio y está solicitando el crédito para abastecerlo con nuevos materiales (cemento, cal, arena, etc.) que le permitirán obtener mayores ingresos cuando estos sean vendidos. El Sr. D. nos comentó que está muy orgulloso de su negocio y lo que más le satisface es saber que está generando 4 puestos de trabajo en un país muy pobre como Nicaragua.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. is a single 55 year old man with three children. His 24 year-old son lives and works with him; his 21 and 28 year old daughters both live with their mother in Japan.

Francisco buys charcoal in bulk quantities, divides it into smaller quantities and repackages it for resale in the city of Villa Elisa. He distributes his charcoal using a truck that he owns. Francisco wishes to invest his loan in the purchase of charcoal by the ton, in order to lower the cost of his merchandise and obtain a better profit margin on his sales. He looks forward to taking advantage of an offer he has received of a large quantity of bagged charcoal.

loans.use: Purchase of Charcoal

loans.name: Flora Marte

texts.en:
For more than eleven years, this intrepid and diligent woman has been working to help her grocery store grow. She was only 19 and had just had her first child when she started the business. At the beginning, she operated the grocery store only four days a week, and she was selling just some foodstuffs. But, over the years, the business has grown considerably and Flora now can operate it all the days of the week.

With profit from the business, and with her husband’s help, Flora can provide her four children with a very good education and housing. Bi-weekly, Flora goes to Monte Plata (located about a one-hour drive from Yamasá) to purchase the goods for her grocery store.

With the loan requested, the entrepreneur will purchase goods such as sacks of rice, bunches of plantains and bananas, gallons of vegetable oil and some sacks of beans. Flora will also buy red wine and some energy drinks so as to diversify inventory and attract more clients.

loans.use: With this loan, the entrepreneur will supply her business with products like rice, vegetables and other goods so that she can continue with her sales activity and attract new clients.

loans.name: Savrinisso

texts.en: Savrinisso J. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 3 children.  She works in the joint-stock company “Navbakhor” and sells suits.  She has been an active, strongly motivated client of MicroInvest since 2006.  In addition to selling suits, she has a sideline dying and painting leather.  She is experienced in this craft. Mrs J. is asking for a loan of $600  to develop this parallel leather business so as to increase the family income and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To develop leather-dying/painting business

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en: Fahima is a young, 24 year old young woman living in the region of Mount Lebanon. Fahima is a very ambitious and hard working person who is currently helping her fiancé set up their future home. Fahima owns a grocery store and is requesting a loan -her third from Al Majmoua- to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat K. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 3 children. She started the business practically from scratch but now she has her own trade outlet to sell household goods. She trades different wares that are necessary in daily life (haunches, ropes, kettles, clothespins, thermostat phials, anionic detergent, etc.). Now Mrs. Saodat K. seeks a loan of 2200 TJS ($650) to purchase new household wares from China.

loans.use: To purchase new household wares from China.

loans.name: Rukia's Raha Group

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 40 and 25 years old. Rukia owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling cloth, chips, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Salma's Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Salma is 36 years old and is divorced with three children, ages 14, 10 and 7. Salma started selling charcoal and cloth in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her clothing and coal business.

loans.name: Flor Del Cerro 2 Group

texts.es:
The women of the group called Flor del Cerro 2 are hardworking people. The reality of their lives makes any woman who wants to improve the quality of life for her family a real fighter. This group of women maintains the customs and traditions of Cerro de Oro. As you see in the photos, all of the women wear a traditional skirt with great pride, and most wear the traditional blouse. The mother tongue for these women is Maya Tzutujil, but many of them speak Spanish well.

All of the women work in textiles. Half of them used their loan to buy thread for making the traditional skirts. These skirts are the same as you see in the photos. The other half used the money to buy clothing to resell. Several of the women earn money buying and selling American style clothing, while others sell the traditional clothing.

One of the nice characteristics of this group is that the loan obligations are shared. They are all requesting similar amounts of money, and they are growing their businesses at the same time. This helps make it a cohesive group, as the women feel they are all more or less at the same level.

The women feel that it's important to work with the methodology of the communal banks, because other forms of credit wouldn't be available to them. The majority of them don't have much to use as collateral, so the loans via communal banks work well for them.

These women share the dream of improving the quality of life for their families. The situation in which they live is not ideal for the optimal development of their children, as the community lacks good services. This is why through Kiva, we can help these women realize their dreams and continue to help their families.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Emily Charnes

Las mujeres del grupo Flor del Cerro 2 son unas personas emprendedoras. La realidad en la que viven las mujeres en Cerro de Oro hace a cualquier mujer que quiere salir adelante junto con su familia una verdadera luchadora.

Este grupo de señoras mantienen las costumbres tradicionales de Cerro de Oro. Como se puede ver en la foto todas las señoras lucen su corte, o falda tradicional, con mucho orgullo, y todas excepto una lucen sus mágicos huipiles o blusas. La lengua materna de estas mujeres es el Maya Tzutujil, sin embargo algunas tienen la facilidad de desenvolverse bien en el idioma español.

Todas las señoras trabajan en el área textil. La mitad de ellas invierten su crédito en la compra de hilo para elaborar los huipiles tradicionales de Cerro de Oro. Estos huipiles se asemejan a los que ellas mismas lucen en la foto. La otra mitad de señoras invierten su crédito en la compra de ropa para su reventa. Algunas de ellas trabajan comprando y vendiendo ropa americana, mientras que otras revenden ropa tradicional.

Una de las buenas características de este grupo es que en general el rango de préstamos es reducido. Las mujeres están sacando una cantidad de dinero similar. Esto implica que las mujeres se están desarrollando empresarialmente al mismo tiempo. Este rasgo ayuda a la cohesión del grupo, ya que las mujeres sienten que todas están al mismo nivel.

Las señoras sienten que es realmente importante trabajar bajo la metodología de bancos comunales porque de otra forma ellas no podrían acceder a un crédito. La mayoría de ellas no tienen muchas pertenencias o escrituras que pueden dejar como colateral, es por eso que trabajar bajo esta metodología se les hace muy conveniente.

El sueño de estas mujeres es el de sacar a sus familias adelante. La situación en la que viven estas mujeres no es ideal para el óptimo desarrollo de sus hijos e hijas debido a la falta de buenos servicios en la comunidad. Es por eso que nosotros por medio de Kiva, las tenemos que ayudar para que ellas así puedan cumplir su sueño, sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FABRIC AND THREAD FOR THEIR BUSINESSES MAKING TRADITIONAL CLOTHING,  AND ALSO TO INVEST IN MORE AMERICAN STYLE CLOTHING WHICH THEY RESELL.

loans.name: Kimhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhoun C., 57, and her husband, Mr. Vandy Ou, 67, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1960 and have six children, one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married; one of these lives in the family home, selling French sandwiches and soft drinks in front of the house. Of the other four children, two weave silk at home, one has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, and other one is a hairdresser.

Mrs. Kimhoun has been a silk weaver for ten years, having acquired this skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and for her daughter to expand her business selling French sandwiches and soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and expand business selling French sandwiches and soft drinks

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa is married and is 62 years old. She studied elementary school and hast 4 kids who are independent now. She lives in the district of La Esperanza, Province of Trujillo, La Libertad. She belongs to the Community Bank of “Bellavista”. Her main activity is selling groceries. She buys the products in the Hermelinda market and sells them in a grocery store installed in her own home. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 (Soles), which she invested on buying new products. With this loan of S/ .800.00, which will be pay in 6 months; she will buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, etc. She is planning to request S/. 1,000.00 to supply her business. Mrs. Teresa, would be willing to keep on working with Manuela Ramos (Feminist Peruvian organization), but she requests a larger loan, because the loans are not enough. She decided to request the loan to get independence, and her goal is to have a Minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa, esta casada y tiene 62 años. Estudió primaria completa y tiene 04 hijos que ya son independientes. Vive en el distrito D. La Esperanza Provincia D. Trujillo, La Libertad. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “BELLAVISTA”. Su actividad principal es el comercio D. abarrotes. La socia compra los productos en el mercado La Hermelinda y venD. en la bodega instalada en su propia casa. El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00, el cual invirtió en la compra D. mercadería. Con este préstamo D. S/ .800.00, el cual será pagado en un plazo D. 06 meses; comprará arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, etc. Piensa solicitar S/. 1,000.00 para surtir el negocio. El desafío personal que la empresaria hace frente es la superación. La señora Teresa, sí estaría dispuesta a seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos, pero solicita que le otorguen un préstamo mayor, porque los créditos no son suficientes. Decidió solicitar el préstamo, para independizarse, tiene como meta tener un Minimarket.

loans.use: To buy several products at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de diversos productos.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Nigina K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 28 years old, unmarried, and has a high school education. For the past five years she has been selling children's clothing at her stall in the market in Dushanbe. Nigina lives with her parents, and her business is the family's only source of income. In order to increase the volume of sales, Nigina decided to take out a loan to be paid back over 15 months. This will help her increase profits and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Нигина Алматовна жительница города Турсун-Заде. Ей 28 лет. Она не замужем . Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей детской одежды. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Душанбе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет. Живет с родителями и единственным источником дохода их семьи является ее бизнес. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот планирует получить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев. Это поможет ей увеличить доходность бизнеса и улучшить условия жизни.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel to retail in her community

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
S. Abdurahim is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Only one of his children is married and has his own family. Abdurahim owns a small stall in the city of Dushanbe in Tajikistan, where he sells children's clothing. Since he joined IMON’s loan program, his life and business have changed dramatically. Abdurahim now has enough inventory to earn what he needs to meet his family’s basic expenses. Abdurahim says his business is like having land where he can grow food, and the loans from IMON are like seeds he can plant to produce food for his children.

Abdurahim is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000) so he can purchase more new clothes to increase his sales and expand his business. This will help his family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more new children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es: El grupo Alfa y Omega esta compuesto por tres personas, trabajan solamente con Emprender, y son muy buenas clientes. La lider del grupo es doña Wilma que se dedica a las manualidades, como el bordado D. manteles, pintado en tela, y confección D. sets D. baño y cocina. Para estas fiestas D. fin D. año realizará arreglos naviD.ños,  que hace a pedido por ser muy conocida en su zona. Doña Silvia se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo, tiene bastantes pedidos D. perfumes, y en esta ocasión invertirá en el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo. Doña Rosario se dedica a la confección D. edredones, D. cuatro y tres plazas, confección D. almohadas D. colores vivos que son muy solicitados entre su clientela. Las tres señoras son muy responsables y puntuales.
texts.en:
The Alpha and Omega group is maD. up of three people, all of whom are very good clients and work exclusively with Emprender (i.e. they don't have loans out with any other microfinance institutions). Doña Wilma is the leader of the group, who makes handicrafts like embroidered tablecloths, fabric paintings and kitchen and bath sets. She is currently preparing Christmas arrangements for end-of-year festivities; she gets many requests for these items since she is very well-known in the area. Doña Silvia sells cosmetics from a catalog. She receives many perfume orders and plans to use this loan to increase her working capital. Doña Rosario sews quilts of different sizes as well as brightly colored pillows, which are very popular with her clients. All three women are very responsible and punctual with their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger M. is 40 years old, married, and one of the banana growers in Calinan District, Davao City. He began his banana farm in 1996 by renting a 1/-hectare piece of land. The produce was delivered to Minda Maing, a banana wholesaler and buyer in his town. During harvest, he hires workers to help him transport his produce to the area where he sells his produce. His wife and siblings help him run the business and have been thankful for CEV credit assistance to improve their yield.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seedlings. Bananas are his main crop and these products will help him produce more. He an active CEV client who has access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance benefits the organization offers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and banana seedlings.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Mrs. O. is employed by National House Insurance, working as a consultant in the department calculating pensions and allowances. She has been working in this office for 7 years, since 2001. She has a monthly income of 2701.85 lei. Ana is married and lives with her husband in their apartment in Ungheni City. She has one child at home who is a student. Ana's husband gets a monthly salary of 2500 lei. 

She has not benefited from other loans from Microinvest. She has requested a loan worth 10,000 lei 
to improve their living conditions, to purchase equipment for heating. The total cost of the investment is 18,000 lei because her own contributions are worth 8000 lei.

loans.use: To improve living conditions

loans.name: Koeng

texts.en:
Koeng T., 42, lives in Kandal Province where he owns and runs a pigpen next to his home. The pigs he raises can be sold to the slaughterhouse within three months after he begins to raise them. He can make several sales each year.

His wife, Mom Chantha, 35, works in the garment industry and currently earns between 80 and 90 US$ per month.  They have three children, all single.  One daughter works with her father, raising the pigs.  Another daughter contributes to the family's food needs by also working in the garment industry. 

Mr. Tong recently sold all of his pigs and hopes to acquire others to raise and sell.  He will add the loan money to his savings to buy more piglets and to buy materials to distill wine to sell, as an extra source of income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata Traoré est une femme mariée de 40 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier hérémakono nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Depuis 20 ans, Madame Aminata Traoré  fait de la restauration qu’elle a appris auprès de  sa soeur. Son restaurant est situé en face d’un carrefour très fréquenté par beaucoup de monde.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwasi. Après trois prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, Madame Aminata envisage acheter régulierement des pintades, des poulets, de la viande et  divers condiments alimentaires pour la préparation des plats alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environants. Elle a une clientèle diverse et variée.  La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA.qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son restaurant et aider son époux à subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Traoré is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives with her husband and her children in the North Hérémakono area in the town of Bougouni (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For 20 years, Mrs. Aminata Traoré has run a food service business, which she learned with her sister. Her restaurant is situated opposite a crossing used very often by a large number of people. In her search for complementary financial resources, she decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwasi, a microfinance institution. After three group loans with an association in her area, she is seeking her second individual loan. All of her previous loans were repaid properly. With this second loan, Mrs. Aminata intends to buy guinea-fowl, chickens, meat, and various condiments for the preparation of food dishes. She supplies herself in Bougouni and in the neighbouring villages. She has a diverse and varied clientele. The turnover of her business is very high, and she hopes to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used to improve her restaurant and help her husband in meeting the family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea-fowl, chickens, meat, and condiments

loans.name: Reveca

texts.es:
Reveca es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Reveca es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Reveca vende flores por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, además Reveca también se dedica a la producción de flores pero en menor proporción.
Reveca necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de remedios y abono.
Los sueños de Reveca son tener una florería en un local estable y brindar buenos estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reveca is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy which means Harvest in Quechua. Reveca is married, 32 years old, and has 4 children. Reveca sells flowers wholesale and retail as a street vendor in the Magdalena Market. In addition, Reveca dedicates herself to flower production but in smaller proportion. Reveca needs a loan of 1000 PEN, money which will be invested in the purchase medications and fertilizer. Reveca’s dream is to have a flower shop in a stable locale and to offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medications and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. sells fish that she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Ayisa in Elmina. Dora has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Dora has been selling fish since 1990. She is responsible for assisting her husband with housekeeping expenses. Her loan will increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Her loan will increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Domullo

texts.ru: Домулло 39 летний мужчина, женат, имеет троих детей. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Домулло 12 лет работал инспектором в ГАИ, но в связи с ухудшением здоровья он вышел на пенсию. Его пенсия не хватает на жизнь, поэтому он решил заняться бизнесом откорм и продажи скота. Этим бизнесом он занимался и раньше, но теперь он полностью отводит время на скот. Его здоровье на много улучшилось и он вполне готов продолжать свою работу. Для увеличения оборотного капитала, он решил взять кредит. На снимке его жена, сам Домулло отсутствовал во время мониторинга.
texts.en:
Domullo is a 39 year old man, he is married and has three children. His wife works as a teacher in a secondary school. Domullo has been working as a traffic cop for twelve years, but has retired early due to worsened health. His pension is not enough to cover life expenses and this is why he decided to start a business by raising and reselling cattle. He is familiar with this business and has done it before, but now he is fully devoting his time to cattle. His health has improved a great deal and he is ready to continue his work. To increase the working capital he decided to get a loan. His wife is pictured here because Domullo himself was not present during the screening session.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cattle

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is formed by two borrowers and Mr. Sem V., aged 30, is the group leader. V. owns a motorbike and uses it to pick up passengers for income. His wife's name is Phally, 29, who sells a few groceries out of their home. The modest couple has two children who are going to the local public school.

Recently, the grocery store ran out of stock. Because the business is profitable, and to earn more income, Mr. V. and his wife have decided to ask for a loan to increase the stock of groceries for sale.

The other borrower is Mrs. S., 39, who sells breakfast foods in the market, and who is looking for a loan to purchase a used motor for her family's requirements.

loans.use: To increase the stock of grocery items for sale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian D. is currently selling foodstuffs like rice, beans, fish, meat and many others items at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to extend her restaurant by building another room to accommodate as many customers as possible for the continuous business operation that can lead to great expansion of her business. She is a woman, 38 years old, whose husband is an army officer in the Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement (SPLA/M). Lilian has a total of three children who are all boys and all of them go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build another room to accommodate more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beef, sugar, beans, chicken, cooking oil, sodas, eggs, Presto coffee, charcoal, and American rice.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suweli

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Suweli - (DNR.M-0702) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Wayan Suweli owns & operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Ni Wayan Suweli has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 750,000 IDR a month from these activities.
