In 2007, Ni Wayan Suweli joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Wayan Suweli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 500,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Ni Wayan Suweli is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the third loan she has taken out from DINARI.  Ni Wayan Suweli plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Wayan Suweli - (DNR.M-0702) merupakan 51 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Suweli memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuka toko umum.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Wayan Suweli sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Suweli menghasilkan sekitar 750,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Suweli bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Wayan Suweli meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli peralatan & perkakas baru untuk mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Wayan Suweli berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Guinda

texts.en:
Guinda B., 52, has a stable farming business. Yet she admits that the process of getting to her present status was very tough. She faced the ups and down of farming. But her big struggle was being unable to support every need of their two children. Thus, together with her husband, Guinda strives to improve their business. 

She joined a growing microfinance institution in the Philippines called Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and observed what assistance this MFI could extend to her and to other striving business-fellows. Finally, she found out that she’s on the right track because CEVI offers a variety of good services to clients like her. That includes the granting of loans, which Guinda is applying for now. She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She also enjoys the insurance benefits.

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 1 hija, Nancy tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy son que su hija sea profesional y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is 35 years old, single, and has one daughter. Nancy operates a store out of her parents’ house where she sells groceries and beverages every day.

Nancy needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy milk, rice and sugar. She dreams that her daughter will become a professional and of growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice & sugar

loans.name: Faraja

texts.en:
Faraja is a member of the Dodoma In Kihesa,Iringa,she is35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 15,13,9 years.

 Faraja started her own clothing business selling used clothes 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is fajara`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Faraja hopes to save more money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Norwing Jose

texts.es: Norwing, esta solicitando su primer crèdito con el  fondo kiva, para repellar una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia, se caracteriza por ser un joven que ha luchado por seguir adelante en sus labores y por profesionalizarse, actualmente esta estudiando 2do año en la universidad URACCAN, muy responsable con sus deberes y es muy querido por sus alumnos y padres de familia, su sueño es terminar de estudiar la licenciatura en ciencias de Educacion, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia  ya que son una familia de escasos recursos economicos que desean tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Norwing is requesting his first Kiva loan. He will use the funds to plaster a room in his home, thereby improving the living conditions for his family.

Norwing is known as a young man who struggled to get ahead in his work and his education. He is currently a second year student at the University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua (URACCAN). He is very responsible in his schoolwork and beloved by the other students and his family.

Norwing dreams of completing his Bachelor of Science degree in Education and finding a stable job since his family has limited resources and desires to have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster a room in his house

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Veronica is sixty years old. She is divorced and has give birth to five children, all now out of school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso, a commercial and farming town in the Western Region of Ghana.

Veronica is a trader, trading in textiles. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Joy and the group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They sell in their local market and nearby communities and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly T. is married to Jerome T.. Joy Anne is their only daughter now in grade 1 primary level. At the age of 26 Shirly is already a business minded, always aiming high for the improvement of their business because she wants to help her husband in giving their child a better future. Her husband is now working as an agent in selling land. This is one of the sources of their income but it does not enough for the expenses in the house especially for the studies of their child. So Shirly pursue her business which is the making of Tinapa. Tinapa is a processed fish, usually made in fish that only found in the Philippines like bangus, tamban and galunggong. According to Shirly, in making a tinapa you will boil all the fish in a big bowl together with their ingredients, and then after boiling cook again in a big container. This business gives them an extra income.

So Shirly decided to use all her loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in buying necessary things needed in her business because she wants to expand this to earn more income. Shirly only hoping what is the best for her family so she will never be tire of doing all the right way to improve their lives.

loans.use: Will be use to finance her business

loans.name: Marshy

texts.en:
Marshy C. is from the village of Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Marshy is single. To make a living, Marshy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marshy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marshy joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marshy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marshy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing new items to expand the range of products offered

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun P., 40, is widow with three children: one son and two daughters. The eldest daughter is garment factory worker and another one is in school. They are living along National Road Number One approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Saroeun has been selling vegetables for about 10 years. She buys them from farmers in her village for resale in Phnom Penh market. Also, the house where she lives is broken down in some parts so she decided to repair it, but she doesn’t have money to pay for repairing costs.

Hence she is asking for her first loan of US$ 300 to pay for her house repairs.

loans.use: To pay for her house repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by adding a variety of goods.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun V. is 44 years old, married and the mother of eight children, one of whom is married and seven who are still single. Two of them are garment workers and another two assist her in weaving baskets. Her husband is named Yorng Hoeun, and he is 48 years old.

This family depends on a small handicraft business, weaving bamboo baskets to sell, for a daily income. They have also cultivated a rice crop. Sun V. is taking out her loan to hire a laborer to harvest her mature rice and to buy more raw materials for weaving baskets.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to harvest her rice and to buy more raw materials for weaving baskets

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Teofilo), de 47 años, y con sus dos hijos; Humberto de 10 y Reñidla de 5,quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.
Su negocio está ubicado en uno de los parques más céntricos de la ciudad de Juliaca, su puesto de golosinas es uno de los más concurridos, ya que está bien surtido y la gente sabe que ahí encontrará la golosina que está buscando, esto ha hecho que su negocio sea muy rentable y que se dedique de lleno a él.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin descuidarlo. 
Con el tiempo, anhela alquilar un local en la misma zona, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el quinto préstamo al que accede Lucia en MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Lucia, 43 years of age, is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house along with her husband (Teofilo), 47 years of age, and their two children: Humberto, who is 10 years old, and Reñidla, who is 5. They are the reason she puts forth so much effort to succeed. Her business is located in one of the most central parks in the city of Juliaca. Her snack stand is one of the busiest, given that it is well stocked and people know that they will find what they are looking for there. This has made her business very profitable, and motivates her to dedicate herself fully to it. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with her customers, as this helps ease the burden of all the long workdays. She has been carrying out this activity for 2 years, and she considers the most challenging aspect of her business to be at her stall all day long without pause. Over time, she hopes to rent a site in the same area where she could provide a higher level of service to her patrons. This is the fifth loan that Lucia has accessed with MFP, and she knows that the funds will help her improve her future prospects. However, she also knows she must make her payments on time in order to not create any problems for her cooperative bank. She will use the 1,000.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more mechandise, in order to better supply her snack stand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun V., 37, is married and lives with his young child in Battambong town, Cambodia. V. is engaged in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer and is able to earn an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family’s expenses. He spends time on his plot of farmland every day to take care and grow crops. His wife (pictured here) sells used clothes at the market, earning an income of USD 4 per day. V. and his wife try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, V. is requesting for a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to purchase more used clothes and wood to build a suitable stand for this current major business. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah V. is a single woman who supports her family by making and selling juice. She lives in Brgy Binicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her juice-making business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,800.

Leah V. is now borrowing PHP 12,500 so that she can expand her business operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leah V. aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice O. grows maize which she sells in Igara Busia District where she also lives with her seven children. She is 40 years old, is married, and started her business in 2007 after quitting selling liquor because the business was marred by police interference almost on a daily basis.

Beatrice buys her stock every two weeks and wishes to upgrade her farming with a loan of Ksh 25,000. Her future plan is to be economically stable that will make her be self reliant keeping poverty at bay.

loans.use: To upgrade her farm

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Fernando (72) y su última hija, Rosario (20), ya que sus otros 4 hijos son mayores y ya se han independizado.

Desde hace un año instaló en la sala de su vivienda una pequeña tienda de comestibles, ya que por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia. Atiende durante todo el día desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Su esposo (en la foto) se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pero en algunas oportunidades le ayuda con la atención de la bodega. A Susana le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues es tranquilo y puede interactuar con sus vecinos y conocidos. En la actualidad vende de todo un poco en productos de primera necesidad, también gaseosas y cervezas, las que tienen bastante salida durante los fines de semana.
Y siendo una mujer muy trabajadora tiene planeado para el futuro ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda y colocar unas mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes cuando desean tomar alguna bebida.

Este es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito, con el cual podrá seguir trabajando para salir adelante. A su vez, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo porque está integrado por personas muy responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. Susana tiene planeado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su tienda, ya que quiere surtirla con mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana, 60, lives in her own home along with her husband Fernando, 72, and her youngest daughter Rosario, 20. Her other 4 children are adults and are already independent. One year ago she set up a small food store in a room of her house, since in the neighborhood where she lives there is no competition. She attends to the store from 10 in the morning until 10 at night. Her husband (in the photo) works in agriculture, but at times he helps her attend to the store. Susana likes her work very much, since it is quiet and she can interact with her neighbors and acquaintances. She currently sells a little bit of everything, from basic necessities to soft drinks and beer, which she sells a lot of during the weekends. And, being a hardworking woman, she has plans for the future to expand the facilities of her store and put in some tables and chairs for the comfort of her customers when they want something to drink. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made her loan possible so that she can continue working to get ahead. At the same time she is very content with the work of her group because it is made up of people who are very responsible and punctual in their payments. Susana plans to use the money she now requests to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for her store, since she wants to restock it with a greater variety of products to offer the best to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City with her husband, a driver for a road transportation company in Benin. She is a good helpmate to her husband due to her role in the home. 
Esther owns a grocery store where she sells all sorts of grocery items. She wants to stock her shop with more goods as this will attract more customers to her shop and boost her profits. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. Esther will repay her loan at its due date. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Takku Liggey N°30 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement Takku Liggey est la sous branche de l’Association des Femmes pour le développement de l’entreprise (AFDE) présente dans la caisse de Médina Fall une caisse de U-IMCEC Thiès. 
 Cette association, l’AFDE,  est une organisation de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thiès, une ville environ 70 Kms de Dakar. L'association a été fondée en 1993 par vingt femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cette politique ne permettant pas de financer au même jour tous les membres, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, qui portent le nom de Takku Liggey dans la caisse Médina Fall, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années, mais changent souvent de membres selon le financement des besoins et d'autres considérations.
 L'AFDE organise des réunions de membre mensuellement où tous les sous groupes et branches sont conviés et dirige une coopération pour ses membres, en leur permettant d'acheter du riz et d'autres produits à de meilleurs prix.
 L'AFDE est dirigée par une Présidente du nom de Madame Mame Diarra MAR et une trésorière Madame Ndeye Ndella Diouf toutes habitantes de Thiès. 
Ainsi, le sous groupe Takku Liggey N°30 regroupe 5 femmes qui font la même activité. Elles vendent du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffage sous le contrôle du service des Eaux et Forêts afin de ne pas contribuer à la dégradation de la nature disent-elles. Ce prêt leur permet de développer leur activité et de renforcer par la caution solidaire leur solidarité. C’est un sous groupe dirigé par Madame Tabara D. âgée de 50 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Cette dame connait bien son domaine et capitalise une expérience de 6 ans. Elle est dans ce groupe avec Madame la trésorière Anta Guène, Madame Ndeye Ndella L., Madame Ouzine L. et Madame Khady B..
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey group is a sub-group of the Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l’Entreprise (AFDE), which is represented in the Medina Fall branch of U-IMCEC in Thiès. The AFDE is an organization of women in small-scale commerce working in Thies, a city about 70 km from Dakar. This association was founded in 1993 by twenty women entrepreneurs to increase their purchasing power by way of a tontine (a revolving credit system in which each member periodically pays a suitable amount and which funds its various members by turns). This policy does not allow every member to be financed on the same day. The members decided to join IMCEC in order to award loans without guarantee requirements. Thus, the members are divided into sub-groups of five, each with a designated president and a treasurer. These sub-groups, which are called Takku Liggey in the Medina Fall branch, can be the same for several years but often change their members according to the financing of needs and other considerations. The AFDE organizes member meetings each month, when all the sub-groups and branches are invited. It facilitates cooperation for its members, enabling them to buy rice and other goods at better prices. The AFDE is lead by a president by the name of Ms. Mame Diarra MAR and by a treasurer, Ms. Ndeye Ndella Diouf , both residents of Thiès. Thus, the sub-group Takky Liggey n° 30 regroups five women in the same business. They sell charcoal and firewood under the control of the Water Affairs and Forestry department to avoid contributing (as they say) to the degradation of nature. This loan allows them to develop their activity and reinforce solidarity through their group deposit. The sub-group is led by Ms. Tabara Tiagne, 50 years old and mother of seven children. This lady knows the business and has an accumulated six years’ experience. She is joined in this group by the Treasurer Ms. Anta Guène, Ms. Ndeye Ndella L., Ms. Ouzine L. and Ms. Khady B..

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Obtain charcoal and firewood supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Antonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
El sueño de Antonia es tener una sucursal.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Antonia is 36 years old and married with three children. She has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meat. She works there every day. Antonia needs a loan for 1050 soles, money she will use to purchase sugar and rice. Antonia's dream is to have her own office.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: Mrs. Mat F., a 24-year-old homemaker, has two children who attend the local public school. Mat F. relies on the income from her husband’s job as a merchandise trader. Her husband appears in the photo here. He buys many products in bulk from his wholesale suppliers and retails them, around the provinces of Cambodia, from which he gains profit. He needs capital to improve his current business. This is why Mat F. is applying for a $300 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To improve the business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales dispersas por toda su extensión. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de seis años a la compra y venta de cerdos: el compra cerdos a sus vecinos y los engorda para luego vender su carne por kilos. El negocio le provee de ingresos que utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el sostenimiento familiar. Durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando se ha hecho conocido y ahora su negocio siempre tiene acogida en la zona ya que la carne de cerdo es muy estimada por sus vecinos.

Santos desea adquirir mas animales para engordarlos y venderlos, de este modo planea ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder ofrecele a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona el es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old, is single and lives in his parent's house. The house is located in the hamlet of Lagunas in the Mórrope district, a district characterised by having the majority of its population concentrated in rural zones dispersed throughout its area. Mórrope belongs to the Lambayeque province and can be found 1 1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Santos has worked for more than 6 years buying and selling pigs: he purchases them from his neighbours and fattens them to later sell the meat in kilos. The business provides him with earnings that he uses for his personal costs and in maintaining his family. During the time he has worked he has become well known and his business is always received well in the zone, as his meat is very well regarded by his neighbours. Santos wants to acquire more animals to fatten and sell, and in this way plans to amplify his business and obtain better earnings. To achieve this, for the first time he is seeking a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Santos is a very responsible person and very hard-working. His biggest desire is to be able to offer his parents a better quality of life. In the zone where he lives he is very well known and well regarded by his neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra Brigida;  Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad, La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos Nuestra socia alternando sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la administración de una granja, ella cría pollos, y otros animales como chanchos y cuyes para consumo  y para la venta al por menor. Nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora ella también es agricultora y en Angostura tiene un terreno en el cual siembra papa, maíz y según la estación diferentes productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA.” She lives in the Angostura district, Saylla province, and Cusco department.

Our member is named Mrs. Brigida. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates between housekeeping and administering a farm. She raises chickens and other animals such as hogs and guinea pigs for consumption and for retail sale. She is a hardworking woman as well as a farmer. In Angostura she owns land where she grows potatoes, corn, and other products depending on the season. She requests the loan for the purchase of more materials.

She values and is infinitely thankful for the loan offered since this will allow her to grow her business and improve her standard of living. Likewise, she commits herself to repay the loan payments in the established periods.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more materials.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Javier; El socio tiene 42 años de edad y el socio es casado y tiene 1 hijo, el socio es abogado de profesión, él socio se considera a sí mismo independiente, debido a que él no tiene una oficina establecida pero ejerce su carrera de forma independiente y es que a él,  la gente en su barrio y amigos lo conocen y lo buscan para tomar sus casos, El socio  solicita el préstamo para incrementar sus ahorros y junto a estos poder comprar un auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con sus proyectos y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "ARCANGEL GABRIEL". He lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco in the department of Cusco. Sr. Javier is 42 years old, married and has 1 child. He is a lawyer by profession. He considers himself a freelancer due to the fact that he doesn't work in an established office, but practices independently. His neighbors and friends request his services. He is asking for a loan to increase his savings and to buy a car. He values and infinitely appreciates the loan since it will allow him to grow with his projects and improve his quality of life. He is committed to repaying his loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his savings and to buy a car

loans.name: Elsa Concepción

texts.es: Elsa Concepción M. D. V. D. 48 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo D. 21 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a trabajar. Elsa vive en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual también desarrolla su trabajo. Ella se dedica junto a su esposo a comprar chatarra y hierro, la cual posteriormente comercializa por mayor, cada día salen en su pick up a comprar o recoger la chatarra y así mismo la reparten por colonias como Alta Vista, Soyapango, Ilopango y otras más las cuales se encuentran siempre ubicadas en el departamento D. San Salvador. Esta es la forma en que tanto Elsa como su esposo se ganan la vida, es por ello que dependen en gran manera D. este para salir adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo para contar con el monto necesario para invertir en el negocio y así sacarlo adelante, ella desea poder comprar hierro y chatarra por mayor y D. esta forma poderle ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes al venderla. El mayor deseo D. Elsa y el D. su esposo es el D. contar con una vida más estable en la cual cuenten con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Elsa Concepción M. D. V., age 48, lives with her husband and their 21 year old son. Their son works. Elsa lives in the San Salvador department, and she works there as well. She and her husband buy scrap materials and iron, which they later sell wholesale. Everyday they go in their pick-up to buy or gather the scrap material. They also distribute it in neighborhoods like Alta Vista, Soyapango, Ilopango, and others; which are always located in the San Salvador department. This is the way that Elsa and her husband earn a living. That is why they greatly depend on it to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to have the needed money to invest in her business and get it ahead. She wants to be able to buy iron and scrap materials wholesale. That way she will be able to offer a greater quantity for her customers to buy. Elsa and her husband’s greatest wish is to have a more stable life where they have all of the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron and scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is from the village of Unidos. She is 62 years old. Remedios is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people from Pou village, TaK. province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Mao S., 32, is the village bank president who was selected by the other members, each of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Chea Sou, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. She also owns a general store in the local village while her husband is a policeman. 

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Mao S. wants to expand. So  she  is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy two piglets to raise to start a new business. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Orión (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Macarena V. Guzmán, vive en Tecpatan Estado  de Chiapas México.es madre soltera con dos hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad, Roberto Mario de once años, le dicen (tito), la otra es linda patricia (pati) de seis años de edad y la bebe que esta por nacer en unos meses el cual será niña y está ansiosa de tenerla en sus brazos.

  Ella es maestra de primaria desde hace once años en una comunidad  que se llama madero y está retirado de su localidad, pero aun así le va bien y ha sacado adelante a su familia, ya que la gente lo trata bien por el servicio que le das a sus alumnos y no quieren que por ningún motivo ella salga de su trabajo por ser muy buena persona.

  Comenta que solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para su taller manualidades como son: hilos. Argollas, madera y agujas. Para la elaboración de hamacas, bolsas, cuadros de paisajes, y mecedora. Tiene trabajando esta actividad hace diez meses y dice que le va bien ya que sus clientes le compran  al mayoreo y también se los da a facilidad de pago.

  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su venta compra más material a si tenga como elaborar sus manualidades y cada día tenga mejores ingresos para que con eso pueda pagar el préstamo que solicito en fundación realidad y tenga mejores oportunidades de trabajar con  el crédito.

  Lo que quiere es poder a horrar para que con el tiempo logre construir una casa más amplia para que sus hijos vivan cómodos, como también tener una papelería  donde venda artículos de mejor calidad , así sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y buen futuro. 

  Macarena formo parte del grupo ya que la invito una amiga la señora Flor  Delva quien es representante del grupo a participar en el préstamo ya que tiene facilidad de pago y es menos el interés, se animo y fue así como ella se integro. El grupo se llama orión la razón del nombre es por que donde ella trabaja ay un callejón que lo nombran de esa manera.

 Las personas que integran en el grupo son cuatro señoras y cada una con diferente actividad son la siguiente:

 Macarena V. Guzmán: invierte el préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de manualidades como son: hamacas, mecedoras, cuadros y bolsas.

 Flor Delva Guzmán L.: invierte el préstamo para compra y venta de zapato, sandalias y bolsas para  dama.
 María Elidía M. Jiménez: utilizara el préstamo para la compra de catálogos para vender zapatos de marca como son: impulso y maga shoes.
 Adalea V. Guzmán: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de catalogo de fuller, jafra y blondy, para vender perfumes  desodorantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Macarena lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a single mother with 2 children who are reliant on her: 11 year-old Roberto Mario, who they call Tito, and Linda Patricia (Pati), who is 6. And the baby who will be born in a few months will be a girl, and she is eager to hold her in her arms. She has been an elementary school teacher for 11 years. She teaches in a community called Madero, which is some distance from where she lives. But she is still doing well and has been able to help her family get ahead. People treat her well thanks to the service that she gives to her students and they don't want her to leave her work for any reason because she is a good person. She says that she requested a loan to buy materials for her craft production, being: thread, rings, wood, and needles to make hammocks, bags, landscape pictures, and swings. She has been doing this work for 10 months and says that it is going well as her customers buy in bulk and she gives them payment schemes. With the income that she makes from her sales, she buys more material so she can make more crafts, and every day she has more income and will be able to repay the loan that she is requesting from Fundacíon Realidad and the loan will give her better work opportunities. She wants to be able to save so that in time she can build a larger house and make her children comfortable. She also wants to have a stationary store where she can sell high-quality goods. She wants this so her children can have a good education and good future. Macarena became part of the group when her friend, Flor Delva, who is the group's representative for the loan, invited her. She was interested because the loan payments are easy and the interest is low, so she joined. The group is called "Orión" because where they work there is a street of that name. There are 4 women in the group and each has a different business, being: Macarena will use the loan to buy materials to make crafts such as hammocks, swings, pictures, and bags. Flor Delva will use the loan to buy and sell shoes, sandals, and women's bags. María Elidía will use the loan to buy catalogs to sell shoes from the Impulso and Maga brands. Adalia will use the loan to buy catalogs from Fuller, Jafra, and Blondy to sell perfumes, deodorants, and other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de hamacas, cuadros, mecedoras entre otros.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Moris Odhiambo

texts.en:
Moris has been working in auto repair, operating in Naivasha town, since 2000.  He is 31 years old, married to Pamela Apiyo, and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid the first loan well and on time.  He plans to use the cash to buy a battery charger which will enable him to diversify his services by offering a battery-charging service.

Moris hopes to open up his own garage in future as he is currently an employee.

loans.use: To buy a battery charger

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela tiene 55 años tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es a quien ella ayuda en sus estudios actualmente su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general desde hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy gratificante inicio por la  necesidad de obtener un poco mas de ingresos incrementado su capital de trabajo inicial. Ella se ha valido de esta actividad para poder solventar sus gastos familiares y sacar adelante a los suyos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como toallas, sabanas, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela is 55 years old and has three children, one of whom she is helping with his studies. She currently manages a store where she has been selling general merchandise for more than 15 years. This is not the first time she has requested financing. Ángela says she finds the loans very rewarding because they have helped her generate a little more income and boost her initial operating capital. Through her business, she has been able to meet her household expenses and move her family forward.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as towels, bed sheets, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.use: Purchase towels, bed sheets, cosmetics, and shoes

loans.name: Joyce Wamaitha

texts.en:
Joyce is 36 years old and married to K. Mwai. They have three children. For the last nine years, Joyce has operated a food stall in Olkalou town. She also is a farmer. 

Joyce was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan easily and in good time.  She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and bulk dry goods for her food stall. 

In the future, Joyce hopes to expand her food stall to be able to serve more customers at a time.

loans.use: to buy dry goods for the food stall and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 34 años, esta casado María de 32 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos menores, juntos  viven en su casa que es propia y su fin es salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años instaló un negocio que le prometía buenos resultados económicos, y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar en el estampado de polos, pues es una labor que le genera regulares ganancias. En la comodidad de su casa tiene su pequeño taller donde estampa polos en planchas semejantes a mesas, ahí puede pintar  hasta 12 polos a la hora y avanza muy rápido con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos mayores. Además como tiene todos los instrumentos necesarios ha logrado captar una buena cantidad de clientes y mayoristas que prefieren encargarle los trabajos, por la calidad de trabajo. Lo que no le gusta es que no sale mucho pues su taller esta en su vivienda, pero sabe que el trabajo con empeño le permitirá seguir progresando. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio y lograr estampar mayor cantidad de polos, para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Alejandro tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una mesa para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera espera mejorar su producción y sus ganancias, ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes que espera concretar.
texts.en: Alejandro is 34 years old.  He is married to María, who is 32.  Together they have 4 small children, and together they live in the house he owns.  His goal is to move ahead in life.  Three years ago he began a business which promised him good economic results, and since then he has not stopped working printing polo shirts, as it is work which brings him regular income.  In the comfort of his home, he has his small workshop where he prints polos in irons similar to tables.  In this manner he can print up to 12 shirts an hour and move along very quickly with the help of his wife and his older children.  Also, as he has the necessary tools he has managed to gain a good number of clients and wholesalers who prefer to put him in charge of this task because of the quality of his work.  What he doesn't like is to not get out much, as his workshop is in his house, but he knows that determined work will permit him to move forward in life.  As he is a man who plans for the future, he has planned to grow his business and to be able to print a larger number of polos in order to improve his earnings.  This is the first loan that he has taken with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually as he doesn't want to displease the people who make possible this load that will permit him to continue working in pursuit of progress.  Alejandro has planned to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a table in order to grow his business and in this manner he hopes to improve his production and his earnings, as he already has various pending orders that he hopes to secure.

loans.use: To buy a table to grow Alejandro's workshop

loans.name: Paytsar

texts.en:
Paytsar H. is 37 years old. She lives in Sevan with her husband, two school-age children, and parents-in-law. For about 10 years, Paytsar was engaged in clothes trading, but in 2005 she decided to change her business area. She started to run a fruit and vegetable trading business because, in her opinion, it’s more profitable in Sevan. Her husband helps her in this occupation, and, thanks to this fact, they sell fruit and vegetables from a stall and deliver goods to neighboring villages as well.
  
Thanks to the business’s income, Paytsar and her husband have been able to provide for their family and buy a car for their business, and now they are collecting money for their children’s further education.
 
Paytsar asks for a 1,000,000-AMD loan to buy fruit (especially citruses) and vegetables for her business. Paytsar has received loans from Nor Horizon 10 times without delay.

loans.use: To buy fruit (especially citruses) and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Aurea Mercedita

texts.en: Aurea Mercedita B. is 52 years old and from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Aurea Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Aurea Mercedita is just starting this business. In 2005, Aurea Mercedita joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from PMPC. Aurea Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future and for construction materials for flooring their house. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her agricultural business

loans.name: Seoum

texts.en:
Seoum M., 56, is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. M. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend $37.50 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $15 on other necessary expenses every month. One of her children is employed, earning an income of about $10 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

M. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for the child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the child to commute to work

loans.name: Faheem

texts.en:
Faheem R. is a Palestinian from Ramallah city. Faheem owns a small cake bakery. He is married and a father of two daughters and two sons. Faheem produces cakes, cookies and bread and sells to shops in Ramallah and the neighboring cities.

Faheem took a loan from FATEN to purchase a dough mixer which will save time and increase the production. Faheem's oldest son is a National Palestinian Authority and will help his father repay the loan.

Faheem was photographed in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase a dough mixer

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.ar:
مصطفى في عمر 23 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المناقيش اي فرن له في عمله 16 سنة يحب عمله ويريد دائما التطور والتجدد في العمل
متزوج وله 2 اولاد يحب اولاده ويسعى دائما الى تأمين الحياة الكريمة لهم وسبل العيش السليم في منزلهم لديه رغبة في تطوير
وتحسين المجتمع حوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تصليح ودهن وتغيير مستلزمات المنزل يعمل بكد ونشاط يسعى وراء لقمة العيش
فقد ازداد عمله لانه يحب التطور والتحسين
texts.en: Mostafa, 23, is married with 2 children. He has been working at a bakery selling Manakeesh (a pizza-like popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat). Mostafa loves his children and seeks to secure a decent life for them. He also wishes to improve the status of his community. Mostafa wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to repair, paint, and buy new items for his house. Mostafa works hard to earn his living. His business booms as he always works for its development.

loans.use: To buy painting materials and new items for his house

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Soutoura sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de boissons, d’œufs, de savon, de la friperie (yougou-yougou), d’encens, de pagnes wax et de crème à peau. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire.
Madame Mamou  Dembélé compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un colis de friperie au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Médine à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Mamou  Dembélé espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge la scolarisation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Soutoura group are for the most part married in polygamous families and are on average 35 years old with four children. They all live in the Medine neighborhood of Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and got acquainted through neighborhood ties and their revenue-generating activities at the Medine Market of Segou.

Group members buy and sell beverages, eggs, soap, used clothes (yougou-yougou), incense, “wax” pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), and body cream.

In order to increase their working capital group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan cycle.

Ms. Mamou Dembele will use her loan to buy a bale of used clothes at the Segou general market. Retail sales are for cash or credit through home delivery, as itinerant vendors or at the Medine Market, to both men and women customers. 

Ms. Mamou Dembele hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA to be reinvested in the business and to take care of her children's schooling.

loans.use: Buy used clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su madre, su hijo pequeño y su pareja, juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace tres años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la producción de prendas de vestir (como polos, pantalones cortos y otros de tela) en el taller que administra  al lado de su pareja; ahí trabaja su conyugue al lado de un ayudante. Esta muy satisfecho pues el negocio es muy productivo ya que la producción en prendas de vestir aumentó en los últimos tiempos; pero lo único que lo ha detenido en su negocio es que no tiene un local de material noble donde desempeñarse con tranquilidad  y con frecuencia debió trasladarse de un lugar a otro. Como es un hombre emprendedor tiene planeado en el futuro ampliar su taller y comprar mas maquinas de coser para contratar mas personas, con el objetivo de comercializar en mayor cantidad y obtener mejores ganancias.

José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción que le hacen falta para terminar el taller que con mucho esfuerzo esta acabando de edificar. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
35-year old José lives in his own home with his mother, young son, and his wife. Together they work hard to make progress on a daily basis. For the last three years, this enterprising man has earned a living making clothing such as polo shirts, shorts etc. in the workshop he and his wife run with the help of an assistant.

José is very content as his business is doing well and production increased in the last few months. The only thing holding him back is that he doesn’t own even a simple stall where he can do his job in peace and quiet so he has to move frequently from place to place.

As José is an enterprising person, he is making plans for the future. He wants to expand his workshop and buy more sewing machines so that he can employ more people, sell more products, and earn more money. He is planning to use the loan to buy the construction materials he needs to complete the workshop he is working hard to build.

loans.use: construction material

loans.name: Marlene Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Marlene, tiene 57 años de edad, es originaria de Telpaneca  municipio  de l departamento de Nueva Segovia, pero actualmente vive en centro del departamento de  Estelí, es casada, tiene2 hijas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida y alquiler de cuarto. Inicio este negocio en el año 1998 para cuando sucedió el huracán Mitch en ese entonces ella tenia 45 años, sus primeros clientes fuero unos extranjeros que pertenecen a una iglesia mormona . A la edad de 17 años  comenzó a trabajar en el negocio de sastrería, sus padres la ayudaron para que estudiara un curso de sastrería esta actividad la ejerció  hasta 1998 que fue cuando inicio con su  negocio propio.  
Para  administrar su negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor, también recibe apoyo de un hermano que vive en los Estados Unidos.
El alquiler de cuarto lo comenzó motivada por unos extranjeros que tocaron su puerta preguntando por alquiler de cuartos. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar una ventana de aluminio, vidrio,  cerámica, pintura, remodelar cuartos de su negocio. Con el préstamo podrá mejorar el servicio a sus clientes para que tengan  un buen confort  y mejorar la presentación de su vivienda, ya que al mejorar la infraestructura delas habitaciones  podrá atraer mas clientes y expandir su negocio.  
Tiene como plan futuro construir más habitaciones, ponerle garaje a su negocio. Como metas principales  terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios a su hija menor quien actualmente esta cursando tercer año de administración de empresas y poner un  negocio de fritanga  a fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
Marlene is 57 years old and she is originally from the municipality of Telpaneca of the department of Nueva Segovia. But she currently lives in the central region of the department of Esteli. She is married and she has 2 daughters. She is a merchant and she sells prepared foods and she rents out a bedroom. She started this business in 1998, when hurricane Mitch happened, at which time she was 45 years old. Her first clients were foreigners that belonged to a Mormon church. She started to work at the age of 17, working at a tailoring shop. Her parents helped her to attend a course in tailoring.  This was her business until 1998 when she started her own business.

Her eldest daughter helps her to manage the business and she also receives some support from one of her brothers who lives in the United States.

She started renting out a bedroom because she was motivated by some foreigners that knocked at her door inquiring about lodging.

The loan that she requests will be used to purchase a window, glass, ceramic tiling, and paint to remodel the rooms she uses for her business.  With the help of this loan she will be able to improve the service she provides to her clients in order to improve their comfort and to improve the presentation. Improving the infrastructure of the bedrooms will attract more clients and she will be able to expand her business.

Her plan for the future is to build more bedrooms and to put a garage in for her business. Her primary goal is to finish paying her youngest daughter's university tuition fees. She is currently in third year of business administration. She also plans on setting up a fast food business in her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to remodel bedrooms used fpr lodging

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Don Salomón , tiene  53 años de edad, es casado, tiene  7 hijos , es originario de la comunidad llamada Ocotolillo, en Estelí , de oficio agricultor ,lleva 20 años de edad, debido a su condición humilde  solo llego cuarto grado de primaria para poder llegar al colegio tenia que caminar 2 horas . Aprendió la agricultura  con su papa que se dedicaba a la caficultura y el trabajo jornal , a la edad de 6 años  ayudaba a arriar bueyes para siembra de granos básicos.  A los  23 años se caso . Con 10 metros de tierra que su padre le dejo comenzó a trabajar, se independizo y asi  ha ido aumentando a 5 metros  mas de tierra.
Solicito el crédito para darle mantenimiento de la finca del café y aumentar el área de siembra. Con esto espera que su producción de quintales de café aumente, mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su capital de trabajo. Dentro de sus planes esta tener una finca productiva en un 80%  de granos de café mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
Tiene como meta preparar a todos sus hijos para que puedan ir a la universidad y sean personas de bien y útiles a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Salomón is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. He is originally from a community called Ocotolillo, in Estelí department. He has been a farmer since he was 20 years old. Due to his humble means, he only reached the fourth grade of primary school. He would have had to walk two hours to reach the high school.

He learned farming from his father, who worked as a coffee farmer and day laborer. When he was just six years old, Salomón helped drive oxen for planting basic grains. He married when he was 23 years old. He became independent when his father left him ten meters of land that he began to work, and since then, he has expanded his land by another five meters.

Salomón is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on his coffee farm and to increase the area that he will plant. He hopes that this will increase the amount of coffee he produces, thereby improving his sales and boosting his working capital. His plans include having a farm that produces 80% coffee beans, and improving the infrastructure of his house.

His goal is to prepare all of his children so that they can attend university and become good people who are useful to society.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee farm and to increase the area that he will plant

loans.name: Miler

texts.es: Miler tiene 41 años; convive desde hace 18 años con Eva. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huanchan. El carisma que irradia es producto de su trabajo. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus cultivos de papa y arveja, los cuales siembra desde hace 11 años. Lo que más de gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir el dinero ganado en el bienestar de los suyos. El trabajo constante, es su principal característica. Ya que también se dedica a la ganadería; con las 6 vacas lecheras realiza queso; los cuales vende a los intermediarios que comercializan en el producto lácteo a los diferentes mercados de abastos. Aparte de ello en épocas de campaña agrícola, trabaja en el trasporte de papaya a la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde le pagan por el traslado de la fruta.  Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo pues necesita un soporte económico para los gastos familiares. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión huanchan”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, pues encuentra una oportunidad de lograr sus objetivos. Miler, invertirá el crédito en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, asimismo de varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Miler is 41 years old and has lived with his partner, Eva, for 18 years.  They have three minor children who live with them in their own home in the Huanchan rural area.  His charisma is a result of his work since his life has centered on caring for his potato and pea crops.  He has been growing brops since he was 11 years old.  What he likes best about his work is being able to spend the money he earns on his loved ones.   His main characteristic is that he is constantly working and also raises livestock.  He has 6 dairy cows and makes cheese which he sells to merchants who sell dairy products to the many wholesale markets.

Apart from this, during harvest season he also transports papaya fruit to the city of Pucallpa where he is paid for the transportation.  His main difficulty is the lack of working capital since he has to cover household expenses.

He belongs to the "Unión Huanchan" communal bank and this is his fourth loan through MFP, where he feels he has been able to develop and have the opportunity to reach his goals.  Miler plans to use the loan to buy bags of pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed belongs to the Fazal colony which is a small housing colony located in a small city called Arifwala. Arifwala is located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. 

She married M. A. and has four children. Two of them are studying and the others stay at home. Khursheed herself sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to bear the financial burden with her husband. She operates her business from her home. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He put fruit on his cart and visits different streets of the city to sell the fruit. Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new cart because his current cart has become rough and needs replacement.  On the new cart, he will be able to put more fruit which will enable him to operate his business better. 

Khursheed is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and will help him make his business more profitable.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo V. de 49 años vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde tiene un criadero de pollos y cerdos; él desde hace más de 12 años, aprendió esta actividad,  gracias a que acompañó siempre a su padre cuando  transportaba alimentos para una empresa de cría y comercialización pollos. Así fue que junto a él y sus hermanos, iniciaron con 10 galpones en el patio de su casa y 100 pollos;  cuando este negocio fue creciendo obtuvo logros comerciales como el de inscribirse como proveedor de una empresa del estado y con estos alcances también aparecieron grandes desafíos, pues en el lugar de instalación de sus galpones se  presentaron problemas de luz y de agua y  algunas  pérdidas; fue así como Alfredo decidió trasladar su negocio hace tres años con la ayuda de un familiar,  para una vereda que reunia todas las condiciones requeridas para una cría adecuada;  esto le ha facilitado su trabajo y ahora está mas tranquilo y entusiasmado, en mejorar la productividad de su negocio y se ha vinculado al Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje,SENA, donde participa en un proyecto comunitario de asesoría técnica para la  cría y levante. Su financiamiento con Kiva, es el primero con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo requiere para comprar 500 pollos, 9 bultos de concentrado, 65 gallinas ponedoras de huevos y 10 cerdos, asi incrementaría su capital de trabajo y aumentaría a 1000 pollos su cobertura comercial para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Alfredo V. is 49 years old. He lives in the municipality of Malambo, where he raises chickens and pigs. He learned this business more than 12 years ago, thanks to the fact that he always accompanied his father when he was transporting feed for a business that raised and sold chickens. Thus, together with his brothers, he began with 10 poultry sheds in the yard of his house and 100 chickens. As the business grew, he achieved commercial successes such as becoming registered as a supplier for a state enterprise. However, with these achievements also came great challenges: for instance, there were problems with electricity and water in his poultry sheds and he suffered some losses. Because of this, three years ago Alfredo decided to move his business with the help of a family member, relocating it to a lane with all of the necessary conditions to raise animals appropriately. This made his work easier, and now he is more at ease and enthusiastic about increasing the productivity of his business. He has joined with the National Learning Service, SENA, where he participates in a community project providing technical consulting for raising and fattening animals. His loan with Kiva is the first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he needs it to buy 500 chickens, 9 packages of concentrated feed, 65 laying hens, and 10 pigs. This will allow him to increase his working capital and expand his commercial coverage to 1000 chickens, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens, 9 packages of concentrated feed, 65 laying hens and 10 pigs.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Marieme works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending and selling coconut wine. 

Marieme has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.  She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Wolale  Marakasso 1 Group

texts.fr:
WOLALE MARAKASSO 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  exclusivement du sésame.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans  et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de campagne. KADIA, la première assise à droite avec une écharpe noire, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, de la semence de sésame, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, la récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de SAN, de DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 29000 à 30000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
Wolale Marakasso 1 is a group of married women from the village of Cinzara in the San prefecture of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 38 years old with at least five children.

They grow exclusively sesame. To make their crop-farming profitable, group members decided two years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Having successfully repaid previous loans, they are now on their second agricultural loan cycle.

Kadia, first sitting on the right with a black scarf, wants to use her portion of the loan to buy sesame seeds, small farming equipment and agricultural inputs at the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in San, Dah and in surrounding markets, retail (often in bulk) against cash mainly to customers coming from large towns.

After selling their agricultural products each member of the group hopes to achieve profits between 29,000 and 30,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and operating as a wholesale seller in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra, a 53-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, has been planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living for over 30 years, earning approximately Php 8,000 a month. She is requesting a new loan of Php 16,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds for her farm.

In the future, Patricidra plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La sociaLa socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Saylla, Provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia tiene 4 hijas D. las cuales dos D. ellas son independientes y y aún apoya a las otras dos; la socia desea que sus hijas prosperen y ayudarlas en sus estudios, una D. ellas viajo a Estados Unidos por unos meses, la socia tiene una chicharronería restaurante ubicado en el distrito D. Saylla, la socia venD. ricos chicharrones, trucha frita con papas doradas, caldos D. gallina, chayro, entre otros platos; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en esta ocasión en la chicharronería, la socia está ampliando el baño público y desea invertir en la compra D. materiales, para ampliar el baño y accesorios para el mismo, la socia también invertira una parte en la compra D. carne D. cerdo y D. papas por arroba. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. carne, papas y comprar accesorios para la implementación del baño público D. sus restaurante chicharronería.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Remigia, 49, is a member of the “Rosales D. Saylla” communal bank which belongs to Saylla District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and has four children, two of them independent and two still dependent.  She wants her children to progress and she wants to help with their schooling.  One of them traveled to the United States for a few months. 

Remigia has a ‘chicharronería,’ a restaurant in Saylla district where she sells delicious fried pork, fried trout with fried potatoes, chicken soup, and ‘chairo’ (traditional soup from Peruvian highlands), among other dishes.  She wants to invest the loan in the chicharronería.  She is expanding the public rest room and wants to buy materials to enlarge the bathroom and furnishings for it.  She will also use part of the loan to buy pork and potatoes by the sacksful.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of meat, potatoes and to buy furnishings  for the chicharronería restaurant’s public bathroom.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Sabentee Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Sabentee” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to invest into their own businesses. 

Salamatu is the leader of this group. Salamatu is 48 years old and married with 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Salamatu sells soaps and has been a businesswoman for 18 years now. With the help of this loan, Salamatu will invest in her business by buying soap making materials like palm oil, caustic soda, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of soaps for sale.

loans.use: to buy soap making materials such as palm oil, caustic soda, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of soaps for sale

loans.name: 58 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thúy is the leader of the four-member group, the 58 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. She is 52 years old and is married with two children. Thúy lives with her family in Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall where she sells meat. Thúy’s main business challenge is the lack of capital. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid one previous loan.  

Thúy is requesting a loan to purchase meat to sell. With the profit from her loan, Thúy hopes to buy a motorbike and more land. She also hopes that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Desde joven Leonardo ha sido emprendedor y ha considerado que trabajar independiente le permite generar ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, desde hace algún tiempo, Leonardo tiene una tienda donde vende diferentes productos de la canasta familiar, así mismo cuenta con un criadero de cerdos que le permite obtener mayores ingresos.
