Cuando tenia 17 años se dedicó a la agricultura, en ese entonces trabajaba con ahínco para que su producción de papa, arveja y habas; sean rentables y generen muchas ganancias, con el tiempo, consolidó una familia y desde ahí pudo adquirir mayores ganancias y con el dinero ahorrado pudo comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Ahora Carlos vende papa en grandes cantidades, “con mi producción pude educar a mi hijo”, afirma. Sin embargo, él, planea comprar una pequeña casa en la ciudad de Ica, ya que quiere estar en compañía de su hijo, ahí piensa abrir una pequeña bodega de comestibles. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y agradece el apoyo obtenido en todo este tiempo, donde asegura, pudo conseguir muchos éxitos y alegrías. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono, con ello quiere asegurar su sembrío de papa el cual cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en: Carlos is a self-confident person. He is 48 years old and he lives with Nidia, 37 years old, and  they have one son together, Henry who is 18 years old. But they live on their own in the rural community of Santa Clara (in the Peruvian mountain range). Some years ago their son started University at Ica (in the coastal regions of Peru) and according to Carlos, it was then when their dreams and aspirations changed.  When he was 17 years old he started work in agriculture and in those days he worked with great zeal on his plantations of potatoes, peas, and fava beans. His plantations were successful and generated great earnings. In time he started a family and since then he has seen an improvement in his earnings. With the funds he saved he managed to purchase more farmland. Today Carlos is able to sell potatoes in very large quantities. He states "with these harvests I was able to send my son to school".  He plans on buying a small house in the city of Ica to be closer to their son. There they plan on opening a small grocery store.  This is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is grateful for the support he has received through all this time. With these loans he was able to find many successes and much happiness. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer to secure a good harvest in the coming months.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to secure his harvest.

loans.name: Turganbubu

texts.en:
Turganbubu K. is 49, married, and has three grown children. In 1990, in order to support her family, she began her business in cattle breeding.   Currently, she has a barn and three cows, twenty sheep and one goat at her farm. In summer, she pastures her livestock in mountainous areas with natural grasses, which leads to reduced expenses.  With the revenue from this activity,  Turganbubu managed to give a good education to her children.  Now, Turganbubu plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase three bull calves.  Using the revenue, she plans to give a dowry to her daughter. 

In future, Turganbubu plans to build a house for her family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Afi Mawussé

texts.fr: Mawussé est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a 40 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce de bijoux. Elle est née à kpalimé mais habite à adidogomé à Lomé et cumule dans ses activités près de 4 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou au Benin  et revend à adidogomé. Pour satisfaire plus de clients, elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt.
texts.en: Mawussé is married and the mother of three children. She is 40 years old. In order to contribute to her household expenses, she has a jewelry business - altogether, she has been in this business for almost four years. She was born in Kpalimé, but she now lives in Adidogomé in Lomé. She purchases her supplies in Cotonou in Benin and resells the goods in Adidogomé. In order to satisfy more clients, she is requesting a loan from the microfinance organization WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 40-year-old married man and father of three kids, who has been working as a car painter for 20 years. Amer is an expert in his field; he is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products for his business. 

Amer seeks perfection in his work and perfection in his family members whether in raising his kids or in teaching them. He hopes to provide them with good talent and a secure living. Amer’s clients believe that he’s a man of honor, who respects his word. Amer dreams of opening a big garage in the future

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy B. is from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old and widowed with five adult children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and beverages in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Nancy joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to purchase inventory and use as working capital. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like junk foods and biscuits. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products like junk foods and biscuits

loans.name: Dzigbodi Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa  a 4 enfants et est mariée à un agent de douane. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait  la vente de charbons de bois. Elle a commencé en  1990 cette activité et s’approvisionne à Anié. Elle revend ensuite les charbons à la devanture de sa maison. Elle est dans son troisième cycle de prêt. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 25 nouveaux sacs de charbons.
texts.en: Mrs Akossiwa has four children and is married to a customs officer. To contribute towards household expenses, she sells charcoal. She began this activity in 1990 and gets her supplies in Anié. Then she resells the charcoal in front of her home. This is her third loan cycle. She applies for this loan to buy 25 new sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is currently in a business of selling mixed goods.  She is 30 years old and married to a seller of mixed goods.  She has 4 children, 3 of whom go to school.  She requested for a loan to stock more mixed goods.   Gladys hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more mixed goods.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar:
فاطمة في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان وعلى عاتقها زوجها ايضا حيث انه لا يعمل بل يساعدها في عملها لها في عملها في بيع 
الخبز والمناقيش حوالي 20 سنة تحب عائلتها وهي المعيل الوحيد لهم تريدهم دائما من العاملين والمنتجين في المجتمع حيث انها
استطاعت ان تؤسس عملها بنفسها تتميز بالجد والنشاط في العمل ولها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة كانت تتلقى دائما الدعم
تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى زيادة فرصة عمل جديدة لها من خلال شراء كارت تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وايضا اكسسوارات
للهواتف النقالة
texts.en: Fatima is 38 years old, married with 2 children and she also shoulders the responsibility for her husband who does not work but rather helps her in her bakery. She has 20 years experience. She loves her family very much and is the sole breadwinner. She constantly wants them to be contributors in the community, and she has established her business independently. She is determined and motivated. She has good credit history with Al-Majmoua and has their support. With this loan she wants to create new business opportunities by purchasing mobile phone top-up cards and phone accessories.

loans.use: To start a new business selling mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is a 45-year-old man. He is married to Lea and has been blessed with 4 children: Marlin, 23 years old and married; Randy, 20 years old and disabled due to an accident and unable to complete his high school education; Dewi, graduated from senior high school but currently unemployed; Juan, 10 years old and in 4th grade. Danny and his family live in their simple house located in Kolhua Village. 

To generate daily income, Danny runs a small kiosk. Using the small amount of money that he has, Danny purchases various daily basic needs such as soap, toothpaste, snacks, cigarettes, etc. Danny relies on the profit from his kiosk to meet his family's needs. 

Danny's kiosk is located about 20 meters from the main road and is quite difficult for his customers to reach. This poor location has greatly affected his income. Danny serves just a few customers and can only generate a small income, which he spends to replace his business stock, buy food and pay for electricity and other expenses. Danny feels that his income is very small. As head of the family, he keeps thinking about how to improve his business and generate more income. He believes the solution lies in enlarging his kiosk and finding a strategic location but Danny doesn't have enough capital to do so. 

Danny has tried to find a loan to help him improve his business. Fortunately, he met TLM’s Field Officer who introduced him to TLM’s lending program. Danny is interested in joining the individual program and is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. Danny is hoping to get the loan so he can implement his plan.

loans.use: to move his business and to add more inventory

loans.name: Segakuca

texts.fr: Segakuca M. est éleveur des bovins et poules, il est né au Congo. Il a 50 ans et est marié, il 9 enfants entre 30 et 4 ans, 7 de ses enfants vont  à l’école. Il a un diplôme d’A0 en Agronomie. Il est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour acheter une vache et des poules pour augmenter son élevage, ses ambitions sont de travailler à la hâte pour augmenter sa capacité financière, et la production des ses bêtes, sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaires et d’augmenter le terrain à cultiver car il fait aussi l’agriculture des légumineuses et graminées, enfin il veut rehabiliter sa maison.
texts.en: Segakuca M. raises  cattle and poultry. He is born in Congo. He is 50 years old and married. He has nine children between 30 and four years of age. Seven of his children are in school. He has an “A0” level diploma [roughly corresponding to junior college] in agronomy. He is a client of ACB since 1010. He needs a loan in order to purchase one cow and some chickens in order to increase his business. His goal is to work hard to increase his financial capacity and raise more livestock. His strategy is to increase also his field as he is also a farmer and grows vegetables and grasses. Finally, he wants to renovate his home.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and chickens

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, es empleado desde hace 7 años, trabajando como vendedor en un comercial del centro de El Transito.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que este medio le dará mayor rapidez para llegar del trabajo a la casa y viceversa, esperando con esto satisfacer las necesidades básicas y alcanzar sus objetivos y metas por el buen desempeño en su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and lives in El Transito, in Usulután department, with his wife and two children aged 3 and 5.  José has been working for a company for 7 years.  He is a salesman in a store in the center of El Transito.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle as this will enable him to get home from work, and vice versa, more quickly.  He hopes this will help him to cover his basic needs and reach his goal to do well at work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Josué Gamabiel

texts.es:
Josué tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, está soltero, vive con su padre, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace un año y medio, aprendió el oficio en otro taller donde inicio como trabajador, el horario que posee es de 7:00 a 5:00pm, su manera de trabajar es por pedidos.
Actualmente necesita invertir en madera de diferentes clases, para poder fabricar los muebles encargados, este crédito le ayudara a tener en su inventario el material necesario y atender la demanda.
Su Objetivo es superarse poco a poco, tener un taller más amplio y mejorar su trabajo, para satisfacer a los clientes.
texts.en:
Josué is 27 years old, single, and lives in Osicala, located in the Department of Morazán, with his father. He has worked as a carpenter for a year and a half and he learned the trade in another shop where he started as a worker. He works from 7am to 5pm and works by request.

He currently needs to invest in different types of wood in order to be able to make the furniture requested. This loan will help him to have the necessary material in his inventory and meet the demand.

His goal is to get ahead in life little by little, to have a larger workshop, and to improve his work in order to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy different types of wood.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 57 years old and married with 11 children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jerlito

texts.en:
Jerlito is a single farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Jerlito spends hours tilling his land and preparing it for planting rice crops. When not busy farming, Jerlito drives his tricycle to transport people around his community. He works hard to save money and help his family.

Jerlito is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and repair his tricycle. In the future, Jerlito hopes that his business ventures prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and repair his tricycle

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESTRELLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la señora María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de batidos, venta de golosinas, ayudante de confección de colchones, venta de salchipapas, tejido de mantas, tienda, inicio de negocio.

La señora María nos indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer, en el centro de Senkata, pero por traslado de casa ahora es parte del centro de Collpani. Ella cuenta con un negocio de tejido de mantas desde hace un año, el que aprendió de sus amigas.

El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para comprar lana y equipo (que utilizará en la elaboración de sus productos) estos materiales llos comprara de la feria 16 de julio y los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro
texts.en:
The communal bank "NUEVA ESTRELLA" is beginning its first term in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Social Center.  It is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Maria.  The business activities of the members vary and include: blanket weaving, milkshake sales, sweets sales, mattress making assistant, salchipapas sales, general store operation, and business establishment.

Mrs. Maria says she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year in the Senkata center, but since she recently moved is now in the Collpani center.  For a year she has been earning an income as a blanket weaver, a skill she learned from her friends.

The loan she is requesting is to buy wool and equipment (to make her products).  She will buy the goods at the July 16th fair and then sell her products on an order basis.  Her work allows her to generate an income to help out with family expenses.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she liked most about Pro Mujer, she replied that it was the savings involved.

loans.use: To buy machines and wool.

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Mr.Byambatsogt is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family live in their own house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. His two eldest children go to University and the youngest one attends a kindergarten. His wife is unemployed at the moment and has been actively looking for a job for the last few months. 

Byambatsogt has been running a taxi business, using his family car, since 2005. He also raises pigs. He has 8 pigs at the moment and he is planning to expand his farming business. Recently he found a quite suitable place for selling motor engine oils and he negotiated to rent a kiosk there. His wife is going run the engine oil and cooling liquids retail kiosk. The loan Byambatsogt is taking will be used to stock up engine oil and cooling liquid to sell to customers and, at the same time, will give his wife a chance to earn money.

loans.use: to stock up enough engine oil and cooling liquid and to sell these items to customers. This will also give his wife a chance to earn money.

loans.name: Phelesiah

texts.en:
Phelesiah is a 33-year-old businesswoman, mother and wife to Charles who is also a businessman. They have three children, aged between seven and ten years old, and reside in the Kwisero area of the larger Kakamega County.

She sells grains, mostly maize, because of its high demand in this part of Kenya. She has been doing this business for the last 12 years and is able to make a monthly income of KES. 9,500. She has been awarded a second loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD which she will use to buy five bags of maize for resale.

She intends to use the profit to invest back into her business and also pay back her loan without default. Her dream is to open a grain shop as opposed to her current business location, which is an open air stall.

loans.use: to buy five bags of grain.

loans.name: Barbra's Group

texts.en:
Barbra is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Barbra has a small retail shop business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business running a clinic.
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao, age 55, is a rice farmer. Her husband, Khan, age 56, is a construction worker. He assists his wife in the farming business when he is free. They have been married since 1978 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child is a construction worker, and the other two children are garment workers. They live in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pao is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

Photo: Pao and her husband

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea tiene 50 años de edad, ella es casada con el señor Juan y con quien procreo seis  hijos cinco ya están fuera de su responsabilidad y uno aún está con ellos Esteban de dieciseis años de edad.

    Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mantas para después bordarlas, con esta actividad lleva treinta y tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido sus propios ingresos para sostener  en bien a su familia.

      Lo que motivo a esta actividad fue su propio gusto ya que en la localidad donde ella vive las personas se dedican a bordar mantas lo que es la tradición ahí, ella desde muy pequeña se dedica a ello y esta muy contenta porque con ello a sacado a delante a  pequeña familia.

    Lo que más desea es  seguir trabajando con su actividad hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea, 50, and her husband, Juan, have six children, four of whom are grown and independent.  Their youngest child, Esteban is sixteen years old.  

Andrea will use her loan to buy supplies for her embroidery business.  She has operated the business for thirty-three years and says that she is pleased with it because it provides her with an independent income that she has used for the good of her family.

Andrea was well suited to an embroidery busienss because there's a long tradition of embroidering textiles in this part of Mexico.  She's embroidered textiles since she was a young girl and she's pleased she can make a living from it because she can help support her little family.  

What she most wants is to be able to continue her work for the rest of her life.

loans.use: to buy thread and other supplies for her embroidery business.
